story:
Dear Family, Friends and Potential Angels,

Thank you for your interest in participating in what we expect to be a continuous link to great American films that take place in New York City.

  • Hi, my name is Sal Rinella. I have produced and directed over a dozen films, videos and shorts. I love what I do because the people I surround myself with love what they do, and they need this arena to continue creating great film works. As for importance, we are introducing a new voice to the Mob-Comedy Genre.  
  •  We want to film in Corona, NY mid-July to mid-August. 
  • “Good Friday" is a motion picture, written and helmed by Sal Rinella, to be filmed in the New York City area. Mr. Rinella brings his storytelling passion to the film industry again. Your participation will make it possible for us to give this wonderful screenplay a first class film production.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $50,000 for production, location rental, set building, lights, props, and salaries for our entire production team.  The amount of money we raise will directly impact the quality of the production. 
  • Perks are in the Perks Section and are accessible to anyone who wants to help us.
  • We are committed to achieving this production.  
  • Indie films usually aren’t as flashy as big Hollywood productions, but their small budgets mean that, if they hit big, they are hugely profitable. It also doesn’t hurt that they tend to be award magnets.

The Impact

  • Mob-flavored films have been a big favorite of the movie going public for years. The Mafia has been a source of some of the best stories in film history. The drama, action, and moral dilemmas the characters face always keep viewers on the edge of their seats, wanting more.
  • Mafia comedies revolve around the mafia and a comedic plot line, usually a chase or a complicated situation involving the Mafia. Examples of Mafia comedies include: The Gang  That Couldn't Shoot Straight, Johnny Dangerously, Oscar, The Whole Nine Yards, Wise Guys, Corky Romano, The Freshman, Mickey Blue Eyes, Jane Austen's Mafia, Analyze This, Analyze That, and You Kill Me. In Bruges, in which Colin Farrell stars, is also considered to be a Mafia comedy.
  • Many Crime/Gangster films involve a lot of comedic moments, especially during witty conversations between gang members. This can be seen in such films as Goodfelllas, Johnny Stecchino, Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels and Pulp Fiction.
  • A lot of the humor in such films is based upon the portrayal of gangsters as ordinary people. The perceived view of gangsters is that they are tough, serious, mysterious and often quite evil characters, so when a film portrays a side of normality to a gangster’s character, it can have a humorous effect. Father Bello is a good old-fashioned priest.
    .

Risks & Challenges

The motion picture budget is composed of two parts: production and profit participation costs. A few key people involved in the making of “Good Friday” work at less than standard rates; the balance of their normal pay being deferred and paid out of profits. Deferment costs can be approximately 15 percent of the profits after investors are repaid 130 percent of their investment. Also, limited partner/s are repaid in full before the managing member is repaid.

The Team

The Co-Producers

The Director:  Sal Rinella is a SAG/AFTRA actor/director/producer who has won 7 awards for his films and screenplays. Sal wrote the screenplay "Geek to Guido" that featured Tony Darrow, Vinny Vella, Karen Lynn Gorney and Willie Demeo. “Geek to Guido” gained critical acclaim at the 2012 Artlightenment Film Festival where the film received high honors and Sal Rinella won the Best Screenwriter award. This film also received the awards for Best Ensemble and Best Wardrobe.

Some other noteworthy accomplishments include:

* Best Wardrobe, Sal Rinella, Betsy Brubaker & Steve Brubaker, for "Dry Gulch."

* Third Place People's Choice Award, Sal Rinella, Betsy & Steve Brubaker, for “Dry Gulch.”

* Florida Motion Picture Television Association Award for Best Screenplay.

Ted Mornel is the Associate Director. He has been a theatre director for fifty years and has directed over 300 Off-Broadway plays. Ted is also listed in the Who's Who in American Theatre. Ted has worked with Sal Rinella on "Richard III", "Homesick" and "Austin's Angels". Ted Is considered one of the pioneers of experimental theater. He has premiered over two hundred new plays. The totality of his work has earned him a place in Don Marquis' "Who's Who in American Theater”. Mr. Mornel and Mr. Rinella have been colleagues and collaborators since working together on Sal's debut film, "Austin's Angels".

Matt Jade is an actor and producer, known for "Gangster's Crib" (2008), "All Bookies Wear Speedos" (2005) and "Saturday" (2006). Matt has acted and produced movies since 2002.

John Thomas is a Casting Director/Producer who is known for his work on The "Way to Go" (2012), "Blood Line" (2009) and "Black Heart" (2011).

Enrique Williams and his partner Floria Dautaj have run MEDIAMAXplus since 1987. Mr. Williams has experience producing and shooting features, short films, documentaries, interviews, corporate films, legal videography, etc. He has a vast knowledge of film (35mm. 16mm) cameras, HD & HDSLR video cameras as well as lighting and sound techniques. Mr. Williams brings 25 years of expertise and connections in the industry, thus assembling the best crew and cast, while accommodating the budget. 

Domenica Pizioli is the sales, marketing and public relations point person who is willing to make the right connections for the team.

Bobby Ciasulli is a third generation auto dealership owner/operator. He appeared on season 6 of The Real Housewives of New Jersey. He brings to the team his business savvy and willingness to portray a wide variety of characters. He has appeared in many local commercials through the years which he wrote and in which starred. Bobby is also a Volunteer Firefighter.

Joseph Vancheri is a writer, songwriter and actor. Joe has written several screen plays and television movies. Joe is also our "Godfather." He has been featured in TV's "Law and Order" shows and industrial videos.

Short Synopsis

Meet Father Aniello Bello, an Italian Priest in training who is put through the ringer by his church seniors as he works in the church's internship towards "full-fatherhood". He is given all sorts of jobs unbecoming of a father. Ever the loving man he is, all he wants to do is bring love and joy to his neighborhood parish.

Nelly as he is known in his neighborhood, is wrapped up between the two Dons, Parisee, owner of the Very Social Social Club and Basel, owner of the Club Soda Social Club, who compete and bet over everything in the neighborhood. Both Dons have been promised control of the Good Friday Feast.  When each one finds out he is not the only one in control of the feast, their turfs are too small for these big-bellied comical dons.

Father Bello, ever the big American TV buff, recommends "A big sit-down like in the big movies” which gets both Basel and Parisee crews to sit down and break bread in, of all places, a comedy club. As luck has it, Father Bello gets on the stage as Stand-up Priest roasting both gangs. Father Bello makes his confessions on stage to the anger of both dons. Both Basel and Parisee secretly hire the same hitman, an undercover agent for the Pope to who has been keeping tabs on both bosses.

Father Bello escapes hazards in a very comical ways. Father Superior convinces both Basel and Parisee to put their differences aside as Parisee's daughter weds Basel's son in the mob wedding of the century. Will Father Bello bring love, joy and peace to the community in time for the Good Friday feast? Or will father Bello fall victim to the mob, get shot or fail his "calling"? Sit back and enjoy the laughs that fuel this comedy-fest written by award-winning writer Sal Rinella. Experience all their gestures, music and especially the sights of this mafia-farce loosely based in the nineteen-seventies .

  • Pass the word about our Good Friday Campaign on your Social Media Outlets!!!
  • Please don't leave this site till you use the Indiegogo share tools!

campaign_city: New York, New York, United States

story:
"If the stars should appear but one night every thousand years, how man would marvel and stare."
-Ralph Waldo Emerson

 

You Are Invited To The Elven Kingdom!

Through this colouring book, you will be transported into a magical kingdom of elves, filled with starlight, beautiful creatures and enchanting scenery.

The 'Stargazers' colouring book is the first project in a series of books and stories that I am creating. My name is Eeva Nikunen, I am an artist from Finland and I am deeply inspired by fantasy and the writings of poet Ralph Waldo Emerson. I have combined both these passions into the 'Stargazers' colouring book. Through this book, you are invited to embark on your own meditative journey, and discover your own inspiration through the quotes of Ralph Waldo Emerson as you are colouring your way through the starlit elven kingdom.

  • 'Stargazers' is a meditative colouring journey through a starlit elven kingdom.
  • Throughout the pages of the book, you will discover meditative quotes from poet Ralph Waldo Emerson that will inspire you.
  • 50 enchanted pages for colouring.
  • Printed with environmentally friendly paper and inks.
  • Made in Finland.

 

What You Get And What Is Needed

With your generous help, together we will be able to make 'Stargazers' a reality. The funds from the campaign go to printing and packaging costs of the 'Stargazers' colouring book. With your help, we will be able to make 'Stargazers' the most beautiful colouring book possible.

Through this campaign, you have access to exclusive goodies that won't be available anywhere else, such as limited edition prints, original art and more!

My sincerest thanks for your support, and I hope that through 'Stargazers' you will experience the joy of colouring, and you are able to take a meditative journey through a starlit elven kingdom.

 

Awards:

Stargazer 19€

 

Infinite Stargazer 29€

 

Friend Of The Owls 49€

 

The Gift Giver 76€

 

Friend Of The Elves 99€

 

Ruler Of The Elven Kingdom 499€

 

Risks & Challenges

Even if we don't reach our campaign fundraising goal, I will still make sure that everyone who pre-ordered a book and award through this campaign will receive them.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know one person in your life who would enjoy this colouring book that is filled with elves, owls and other magical creature, please share this campaign with them. With your help, together we will be able to bring the enchanted world of 'Stargazers' to life!

www.eevanikunen.com

story:
UPDATE: FUNDED(!!!) AND NEW STRETCH GOAL

$1800 

Thank you so much for donating!


are feeling all the love and want to let more people get on board and help out. 

We have decided to stretch for another $300! 
Used To: Hire a Professional Photographer/Videographer to cover our project!

NEW Perks!

$20 - Digital InkJet Print-  Ready to Frame. Created by Catherine.

Home III - $80 Perk

Introducing a great new perk for you for donating. 

Let's see how far we can get! 

Hello and welcome to our campaign page!

Allie is an artist living and working in the lovely Duluth, Minnesota. She received her degrees from Macalester College and The University of Kansas. 

She loves, in no particular order: creating Art, kayaking, American Modernist and Regionalist art styles, and cat videos on YouTube.

                      


Catherine is an artist and mother (wow!) living and working in Ames, Iowa. She received her degrees from Iowa State University and The University of Kansas. Her artistic voice is one of second chances. 

 She prays. She makes Art. 

She drinks coffee in the shower.

 The Common Threads Exhibition is in reaction to the murals at Iowa State University by Grant Wood entitled When Tillage Begins,  and 
Other Arts Follow. 

See them here.

These murals, in their creation, execution, and viewing, inspire ideas of growth and discovery.

These themes are especially important in today’s context, and what better way to bring people together than to create a welcoming space full of art where you are encouraged to add to the installation piece?! 

The exhibition will be held at ISU Design On Main in Ames, Iowa.

October 1 - 31st, 2016.

 A variety of events will be included, such as artist talks, an interactive installation, drawing classes and more! 

By supporting this campaign, you aren’t just supporting a series of events; you are enabling community growth, education, and exploration.


What We Need: 

$1,500

We are writing a grant to receive funding from the Iowa Arts Council Project Grant. The funding for this grant is contingent on a cash match for half of the requested amount. 

That is where this campaign comes in- we need to raise $1,500.00 in order to be qualified for receiving the grant funding.

The breakdown of what this campaign money will be used for is as follows:

  • Work time Snacks/Steady caffeine IV-drip (not REALLY, but just about) for artists for about 4 months $100

  • Domestic travel (i.e. multiple road trips) from Duluth, MN to Ames, IA and back for research and real time collaboration (includes more caffeine) $300

  • Various art materials such as natural indigo dye, gouache, and art markers for the 2-D collaborative pieces, and materials such as high-quality 4’ x 8’ plywood, nails, screws, sandpaper, and cotton thread for the installation piece $150

  • Marketing materials: posters and postcard designing, printing, and shipping.  Once we get this whole thing funded, we have to tell people to come! $50

  • Shipping!  Neither Allie nor Catherine can teleport themselves or objects, so we need to pay the good ‘ol USPS to ship the collaborative 2-D works back and forth with a small amount of insurance each time $80

  • Indiegogo perk art pieces and objects: making, packing, and shipping $200

  • Food for exhibit opening and various events (talks, performances, drawing classes, etc.) that will be hosted at ISU Design on Main throughout the month of October $250

  • And lastly, we need to pay ourselves the going rate for artists (Wow, I wish this happened more often!) $370

Total: $1,500.00

Perks:

    What YOU get!

    If you donate:
  • Any amount: shout-out on facebook and twitter to let all your friends know how awesome you are-unlimited
  • $10: Everyone who gives at least $10 will receive a personal, handwritten thank you card with a killer plow sticker to stick on your water bottle-unlimited


  • $20: 8 x 10 Ink Jet Print of Digital Collage - created by Catherine

    •                

                                       

  • $20: 8 x 10 Ink Jet Print of Digital Collage - created by Catherine
  • $25: Japanese Stab Bound Book created by Catherine- Limited Edition-10 Available

    • -OR-

  • $25: “Stitch” 5 layer, 8” x 10”screen print created by Allie-Limited edition-15 available

  • $50: 2 Wrapped sculptural pieces from installation created by Allie, Catherine, and the good people of Ames, IA-Limited edition-10 available



  • $80: Home I, II, & III
    Get one of these great, textile-covered sculptures to hang inside your own home! Created by Allison, these homes have a wooden armature, and are covered with tiny, colorful, fabric loops that bring a splash of color to any wall. Easy to install with just a hammer and nail! Each sculpture varies in size; Home I measures 7.5” x 6.5” x 3”, Home II is 8” x 6” x 2.5”, Home III is 3.5” x 10” x 3”

    •              

  • $100: Litho Print created by Catherine-Limited Edition -3 available

    • -OR-

  • $100: 2’ x 2’ piece of “Hidden Hands” a large scale textiles installation created by Allie-4 available

  • $500: Collaborative Piece(Drawing) of your choice from the exhibit created by Allie and Catherine, professionally framed and ready to hang -10 available

  • $1000: VIP Party with Champagne and Pizza-Personal Q&A with Artists– Collaborative Piece(Drawing) of your choce from the exhibit, our endless gratitude-Let us know what you’re interested in, we can work something out!

    • If we, for some reason, don’t reach our goal of $1,500.00, we will focus the funding on the art materials, artist fees, and travel costs. You will still receive your awesome perks, and we will still be able to have this incredible experience, but things will be a lot tighter.

The Impact:

Yes, but why should I contribute?

If you are asking yourself this question, read on! 

Here are 5 good reasons to donate to this campaign:

  1. You get a chance to support artists AS THEY CREATE; every dollar that gets donated is a dollar we don’t have to spend time worrying about, and instead we can focus on making the work incredible.

  2. You get to tell all your friends that you are an arts supporting philanthropist (High-fives all around!)

  3. You will get cool stuff! (Who doesn’t love that?)

  4. Your name will be posted on the internets AND at the exhibition as a supporter of the event and the arts in general.

  5. You will have our undying gratitude!

    Risks & Challenges:


    We may NOT get the Grant.

    For this project we are currently applying for an Iowa Arts Council Project Grant. The $1,500 that we are raising through the Indiegogo campaign is the cash match portion of this Grant. The total budget for this project is $3,200 with (hopefully!) half coming from the grant and half coming from you guys!

    Long distance - we live 370 miles apart from one another.


    Other challenges; Catherine is a mom/working artist, and Allie works a 25 hour/week serving job and runs a fine art screen-printing business ( Midnight Oil Studio ) she shares with her husband.

    That being said, we are both HIGHLY INVESTED in this project 

    read: we are so excited to work together on this awesome experience!

    We have already worked very hard to carve out time from our other responsibilities to make it work! Grant or no grant we will invest the time, money, and resources to make this project happen.

    It will  be a challenge to create collaboratively long distance, but we plan on skype-ing, sharing photos at varying stages, and of course, doing one real, in-person visit to churn out great art.

    There may be challenges, 

    but this project is worth the risk.

    We are confident in our abilities as artists and know that we have an excellent support base of friends and family.

    So join with us.

    Pledge any amount you can.
    Together let’s make this thing happen!

    Timeline Plan:

    Here is a sneak peek at our timeline so you know what we are up to:

    April-May 2016-  collaborators will skype weekly and use various media sharing tools to divide and conquer tasks, write grant, launch and complete Indiegogo campaign,  package and send out perks that are not a part of the exhibit so YOU can receive them by June 2016.

    June 2016 - Perks that will not be part of the exhibit received by YOU 

    July 2016 -   Allie visits the booming metropolis of Ames for a studio intensive; begin creation of works on paper

    July – September 2016- Collaborators will become best friends with our mail carriers (i.e. shipping pieces back and forth), skype-ing 2-3 times per week, Works in Process marketing via Instagram, Facebook, etc., 

               August 2016- Begin Social Media Campaign to coincide with the new                academic semester.

               August 24 – 31, 2016- Finish Works on Paper

               September 19 – 30, 2016- Framing & Finishing (works on paper)

    October 3-7, 2016- Allie goes to Ames to do Installation and on-site construction of interactive installation with Catherine

    Week One - Thursday October 6, 2016

    Exhibition Reception - Thursday 5-8pm - Design on Main Gallery

    Week Two – Thursday October 13, 2016 

    During the day – ISU  Drawing students or local drawing class visits

    Wrapping Party 5 - 7pm – Open to the public

    Week Three – Thursday, October 20, 2016

     During the day – ISU Drawing Students or local drawing class visits 

     Wrapping Party 5-7pm – Open to the public

    Week Four – Thursday, October 27, 2016

    Final Wrapping Party  5-7pm-Open to the public

    October 30 - 31, 2016 - Tear Down

    Post-Exhibition: November-January 2017-Artists will skype weekly, organize and package up perks from the exhibit, ship those perks to YOU  by January 10, 2017, so that you can receive them in the mail by the middle-end of January (depending on where you live).

      Other Ways You Can Help:

      If you find yourself digging into your wallet only to discover it is woefully empty, never fear! You can still help us in a number of ways:

      1. In-kind donations: if you have no cash, but you do have (for example) a crazy amount of unopened, delicious chocolate bars (we’re not judging!), you could donate those and we can serve them at our various events! Or it could be a box of screws! Or whatever, just let us know what you have and we’ll tell you if we could use it!

        2.              

      2. Make some noise, ya’ll! You know people that we don’t-tell them about this campaign and what a great thing it is we are doing…aww, we’re blushing!

      3. Use the Indiegogo share tools to post about us on the internets and social media

      Please consider a cash match or in-kind donation to make this exhibition a reality.

      FAQ’S:

      Can I get multiple perks?

      Yes! You can back our campaign as many times as you want, choosing as many perks as you want.

      Can I change my perk?

      Unfortunately, not during the campaign. But before we send you your gear, we'll send you an email with a link to a system that will help you manage your perk, input your shipping information, and purchase add-ons if you choose.


      I've changed my mind. Can I get a refund?

      Sorry, Indiegogo's policy is No Refunds. Unfortunately, there's nothing we can do about this. When your contribution is deposited into our account, it comes from Indiegogo, not from you. So if we were to refund your contribution, it wouldn't make it back to you.Please see Indiegogo's rules here.

      And that's all, folks! Please let us know if you have any other questions or comments.
story_txt:
UPDATE: FUNDED(!!!) AND NEW STRETCH GOAL
$1800 
Thank you so much for donating! 
 are feeling all the love and want to let more people get on board and help out. 
We have decided to stretch for another $300! Used To: Hire a Professional Photographer/Videographer to cover our project!
NEW Perks!


$20 - Digital InkJet Print-  Ready to Frame. Created by Catherine.


Home III - $80 Perk
Introducing a great new perk for you for donating. 
Let's see how far we can get! 
Hello and welcome to our campaign page!
Allie is an artist living and working in the lovely Duluth, 
Minnesota. She received her degrees from Macalester College and The 
University of Kansas. 
She loves, in no particular order: creating Art, 
kayaking, American Modernist and Regionalist art styles, and cat videos 
on YouTube.



                      

Catherine is an artist and mother (wow!) living and working in Ames, 
Iowa. She received her degrees from Iowa State University and The 
University of Kansas. Her artistic voice is one of second chances. 
 She prays. She makes Art. 
She drinks coffee in the 
shower. 



 The Common Threads Exhibition is in reaction to the murals at Iowa State University by Grant Wood entitled When Tillage 
Begins,  and Other Arts Follow. 
See them here.
These murals, in their creation, execution, 
and viewing, inspire ideas of growth and discovery.
These themes are 
especially important in today’s context, and what better way to bring 
people together than to create a welcoming space full of art where you 
are encouraged to add to the installation piece?! 
The exhibition will be
 held at ISU Design On Main in Ames, Iowa.
October 1 - 31st, 2016.
 A variety of events will be included, such as 
artist talks, an interactive installation, drawing classes and more! 
By 
supporting this campaign, you aren’t just supporting a series of events;
 you are enabling community growth, education, and exploration.

  What We Need:  

$1,500

We are writing a grant to receive funding from the Iowa Arts Council Project Grant. The funding for this grant is contingent on a cash match for half of the requested amount. 
That is where this campaign comes in- we need to raise $1,500.00 in order to be qualified for receiving the grant funding.
The breakdown of what this campaign money will be used for is as follows:

Work time Snacks/Steady caffeine IV-drip (not REALLY, but just about) for artists for about 4 months $100




Domestic travel (i.e. multiple road trips) from Duluth, MN to Ames, IA and back for research and real time collaboration (includes more caffeine) $300


Various art materials such as natural indigo dye, gouache, and art markers for the 2-D collaborative pieces, and materials such as high-quality 4’ x 8’ plywood, nails, screws, sandpaper, and cotton thread for the installation piece $150


Marketing materials: posters and postcard designing, printing, and shipping.  Once we get this whole thing funded, we have to tell people to come! $50


Shipping!  Neither Allie nor Catherine can teleport themselves or objects, so we need to pay the good ‘ol USPS to ship the collaborative 2-D works back and forth with a small amount of insurance each time $80


Indiegogo perk art pieces and objects: making, packing, and shipping $200


Food for exhibit opening and various events (talks, performances, drawing classes, etc.) that will be hosted at ISU Design on Main throughout the month of October $250


And lastly, we need to pay ourselves the going rate for artists (Wow, I wish this happened more often!) $370


Total: $1,500.00

Perks: 


What YOU get!
If you donate:

Any amount: shout-out on facebook and twitter to let all your friends know how awesome you are-unlimited



$10: Everyone who gives at least $10 will receive a personal, handwritten thank you card with a killer plow sticker to stick on your water bottle-unlimited




$20: 8 x 10 Ink Jet Print of Digital Collage - created by Catherine

               
                                   

$20: 8 x 10 Ink Jet Print of Digital Collage - created by Catherine

$25: Japanese Stab Bound Book created by Catherine- Limited Edition-10 Available


-OR-


$25: “Stitch” 5 layer, 8” x 10”screen print created by Allie-Limited edition-15 available





$50: 2 Wrapped sculptural pieces from installation created by Allie, Catherine, and the good people of Ames, IA-Limited edition-10 available










$80: Home I, II, & III

Get one of these great, textile-covered sculptures to hang inside your own home! Created by Allison, these homes have a wooden armature, and are covered with tiny, colorful, fabric loops that bring a splash of color to any wall. Easy to install with just a hammer and nail! Each sculpture varies in size; Home I measures 7.5” x 6.5” x 3”, Home II is 8” x 6” x 2.5”, Home III is 3.5” x 10” x 3”

             

$100: Litho Print created by Catherine-Limited Edition -3 available

-OR- 



$100: 2’ x 2’ piece of “Hidden Hands” a large scale textiles installation created by Allie-4 available 

$500: Collaborative Piece(Drawing) of your choice from the exhibit created by Allie and Catherine, professionally framed and ready to hang -10 available

$1000: VIP Party with Champagne and Pizza-Personal Q&A with Artists– Collaborative Piece(Drawing) of your choce from the exhibit, our endless gratitude-Let us know what you’re interested in, we can work something out!
If we, for some reason, don’t reach our goal of $1,500.00, we will focus the funding on the art materials, artist fees, and travel costs. You will still receive your awesome perks, and we will still be able to have this incredible experience, but things will be a lot tighter.   The Impact: 
 Yes, but why should I contribute?
If you are asking yourself this question, read on! 
Here are 5 good reasons to donate to this campaign:

You get a chance to support artists AS THEY CREATE; every dollar that gets donated is a dollar we don’t have to spend time worrying about, and instead we can focus on making the work incredible.
You get to tell all your friends that you are an arts supporting philanthropist (High-fives all around!)
You will get cool stuff! (Who doesn’t love that?)
Your name will be posted on the internets AND at the exhibition as a supporter of the event and the arts in general.
You will have our undying gratitude!

   Risks & Challenges:

We may NOT get the Grant.
For this project we are currently applying for an Iowa Arts Council Project Grant. The $1,500 that we are raising through the Indiegogo campaign is the cash match portion of this Grant. The total budget for this project is $3,200 with (hopefully!) half coming from the grant and half coming from you guys!  
Long distance - we live 370 miles apart from one another.



Other challenges; Catherine is a mom/working artist, and Allie works a 25 hour/week serving job and runs a fine art screen-printing business ( Midnight Oil Studio ) she shares with her husband.
That being said, we are both HIGHLY INVESTED in this project 
read: we are so excited to work together on this awesome experience!

We have already worked very hard to carve out time from our other responsibilities to make it work! Grant or no grant we will invest the time, money, and resources to make this project happen.
It will  be a challenge to create collaboratively long distance, but we plan on skype-ing, sharing photos at varying stages, and of course, doing one real, in-person visit to churn out great art.
There may be challenges, 
but this project is worth the risk.

We are confident in our abilities as artists and know that we have an excellent support base of friends and family.

So join with us.
Pledge any amount you can.Together let’s make this thing happen!
Timeline Plan:
Here is a sneak peek at our timeline so you know what we are up to:
April-May 2016-  collaborators will skype weekly and use various media sharing tools to 
divide and conquer tasks, write grant, launch and complete Indiegogo 
campaign,  package and send out perks that are 
not a part of the exhibit so YOU can receive them by June 2016.
June 2016 - Perks that will not be part of the exhibit received by YOU 

July 2016 -   Allie visits the booming metropolis 
of Ames for a studio intensive; begin creation of works on paper
July – September 2016- Collaborators will become best friends with our mail carriers (i.e. shipping pieces back 
and forth), skype-ing 2-3 times per week, Works in Process marketing via Instagram, Facebook, etc., 
           August 2016- Begin Social Media Campaign to coincide with the new                academic semester.
            August 24 – 31, 2016- Finish Works on Paper
           September 19 – 30, 2016- Framing & Finishing (works on paper)
October 3-7, 2016- Allie goes to Ames to do Installation and on-site construction of interactive installation with Catherine
Week One - Thursday October 6, 2016
Exhibition Reception - Thursday 5-8pm - Design on Main Gallery
Week Two – Thursday October 13, 2016 
During the day – ISU   Drawing students or local drawing class visits
Wrapping Party 5 - 7pm – Open to the public
Week Three – Thursday, October 20, 2016
 During the day – ISU Drawing Students or local drawing class visits 
 Wrapping Party 5-7pm – Open to the public
Week Four – Thursday, October 27, 2016
Final Wrapping Party  5-7pm-Open to the public
October 30 - 31, 2016 - Tear Down
Post-Exhibition: November-January 2017-Artists will skype weekly, organize and package up perks from the exhibit, ship those perks to YOU  by January 10, 2017, so that you can receive them in the mail by the middle-end of January (depending on where you live).   Other Ways You Can Help:
If you find yourself digging into your wallet only to discover it is woefully empty, never fear! You can still help us in a number of ways:

In-kind donations: if you have no cash, but you do have (for example) a crazy amount of unopened, delicious chocolate bars (we’re not judging!), you could donate those and we can serve them at our various events! Or it could be a box of screws! Or whatever, just let us know what you have and we’ll tell you if we could use it!
              
Make some noise, ya’ll! You know people that we don’t-tell them about this campaign and what a great thing it is we are doing…aww, we’re blushing!
Use the Indiegogo share tools to post about us on the internets and social media

Please consider a cash match or in-kind donation to make this exhibition a reality.

FAQ’S:
Can I get multiple perks?
Yes! You can back our campaign as many times as you want, choosing as many perks as you want.
Can I change my perk?
Unfortunately, not during the campaign. But before we send you your gear, we'll send you an email with a link to a system that will help you manage your perk, input your shipping information, and purchase add-ons if you choose.
I've changed my mind. Can I get a refund?
Sorry, Indiegogo's policy is No Refunds. Unfortunately, there's nothing we can do about this. When your contribution is deposited into our account, it comes from Indiegogo, not from you. So if we were to refund your contribution, it wouldn't make it back to you.Please see Indiegogo's rules here.
And that's all, folks! Please let us know if you have any other questions or comments.

story:
Project Summary:

Me: I am Sara Rockinger, award-winning fiber installation artist for over 20 years. I often wonder what it is like to be someone else, so I usually ask, and this informs my work.

My team: Mark Conkle, collaborator/creative partner/videographer extraordinaire

What’s the deal?

In/Visible, a fiber art and video installation, has been juried into a prestigious exhibition titled Stories of Migration: Contemporary Artists Interpret Diaspora to be held at the new George Washington University’s museum, The Textile Museum, in Washington DC from April through September, 2016. I am thrilled to have my work be a part of this exhibit of international contemporary artists. Now, I need your help to get it there!

How can you help?  Read more about In/Visible, take a look at our budget then we would greatly appreciate it if you would make a donation! There are some fun benefits of supporting In/Visible in DC such as cards, sharing your story and a cool photo book, but the greatest of all are knowing...

A. you contribute to opening someone’s eyes, mind, and/or heart to an idea maybe they hadn’t thought of (many, many people will visit this show)

B. you contribute to the national discussion on immigration, and 

C. you are helping me take advantage of a career-changing opportunity.

YOU do all this with your donation of any size! THANK YOU!

Whether or not you make a donation, please share this via your favorite social media.

What is In/Visible?

In/Visible was started in 2008 and is an investigation of immigration in our communities. This multi-media installation includes video projection onto as many as 53 handmade life size textile figures of cotton or silk which act as a projection screen. The clothing is modeled after clothing worn, and often left in the desert, by men and women crossing the US/Mexico border on foot today. These figures represent past and present migrants while the video offers first-hand stories and an opportunity for discovery of this complicated discussion of migration.

A vital part of In/Visible is the recorded interviews of personal immigration stories graciously shared with us by people across the West, for example: a  gentleman living anonymously in Tucson; ancestors of a Wyoming sugar beet farmer; a National Bilingual Teacher-of-the-Year in Colorado; an Armenian American woman growing up in East St Louis; a Japanese internment story; an 80-year-old-man recounting his boyhood immigration from Scandinavia. These stories and others, combined with personally collected imagery, are woven together by Mark Conkle and projected onto the figures which act as a projection screen offering visitors an opportunity of discovery, in the work and in themselves.

The budget:

  • Shipping (the figures are light but life-size)………..…….….$3000                          
  • Travel to install…………………………………………………...….…..$1000 
  • Travel to represent In/Visible at opening……..…………….$1000 
  • Video expenses (tapes, time, technology).....……………….$1000 
  • Incidentals………………………………………………………………..….$500                               (there are always unforeseen expenses)
  • Total needed……………………………………………………………….$6500

In/Visible has been applauded by Colorado Public Radio and a Phoenix Arizona Fox affiliate.

Why title it In/Visible?

Sometimes it seems that the following things are invisible (yet actually visible if you look, or ask):

* Contributions of migrant workers in our communities

* A shared US history as a nation of migrants

* Migration as a natural phenomenon (Canada geese fly over my house all the time)

* Claiming this land as “ours” and not recognizing it was purchased, or stolen, from someone else

 * Discrimination

* My own personal immigration story: I’m from the Midwest. My parents always said we were “Scottish, English, Irish and Welsh” but that’s not really specific, and my grandmother was adopted. Visibly I am Caucasian, though I prefer European American, but what really is my story?

story:
What is Incendio e Illuminato? 

This is the garden your parents warned you about…an interactive garden that illuminates your soul and gives you permission to question. Walking into the mysterious, Renaissance-inspired art garden you'll pause and realize that things aren’t what they seem.

In this cabalistic garden feel the radiance of the sun and the coolness of the blue sky, while reflecting on the contradictions in your own soul in our reflecting pool where steel replaces water.

Stroll through the garden day and night to discover and question your own enlightenment:

*Choose your own truth: Is the world burning? 

Or are your passions igniting the world?

*Are you reaching out for the nectar of life? Or are you afraid of being stung?

*Recognize the façade you wear to protect yourself. Control the fire lilies' bursts to lighten your own burdens and expel everything holding you back.

*Release these burdens into Die Waldgeist by dropping them into an urn
which will be burned in the Temple on Sunday night.

*Reflect and recognize your own wisdom deep inside of you.

*Now relax and join us on the Flaming Seesaw!

In the garden, release your inner child, lighten your burdens, purge your faults, reflect on your soul, and allow yourself to be vulnerable again.


The Inspiration

We're a bi-coastal team of artists originally inspired by the 2016 Burning Man Da Vinci theme, but we’re all a little twisted…so we added our own twists to a wide variety of art mediums that bring the garden to life!  

Sculpture pedestals are based on the Fibonacci sequence: 3' tall, 5' wide, with 8' sides.  Each pedestal panel will be adorned with paintings or laser carvings inspired by the Burning Man community and the individual Departments of Burning Man (aka "The architects who make the magic happen").


What We Need & What You Get

We’ve already constructed 75% of the project from art grants and other individual donations through fundraisers. With all-volunteer labor your additional donations will be used to literally fuel our fires (500 lbs of propane a night), other materials (steel, lumber, generators, solar powered LEDs, electronics and wiring), along with the cost of fuel and truck rental to get everything to and from Burning Man. Our transportation alone will cost over $5,000.

You may have already seen small parts of the garden at Wickerman, Freeform, and Playa Del Fuego…and we’ll be at Transformus and Love Burn 2017! Your contributions will bring the entire garden together to bloom on the playa.

Our perks are one-of-a-kind and will look great in your home!

Of course, you also get our undying gratitude, a nice tax deduction, and awesome Incendio goodies.


How You Can Help

Every single donation will help get us that much closer to our goal! Also help us by...

  • Telling others about this Indiegogo campaign
  • Joining us at our next fundraiser in the Metro DC area: Friday, July 22nd at Gallery O on H Street from 8-11pm.  https://www.facebook.com/events/1079916532080887/
  • Liking Incendio e Illuminato on FB to keep updated:  https://www.facebook.com/Incendio.e.Illuminato/...
  • Volunteering for our "Safety" team on Playa...contact us for more details.

Email us at info@incendioart.org 

Visit our website www.incendioart.org

We want to create this interactive fire garden for YOU to experience. Your help will make that happen. Thank you for any and all support. See you in Black Rock City...and beyond! 

Incendio e Illuminato is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Incendio e Illuminato must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Fluctuations

In "FluMental" I try to capture the invisible positive energy around us that we often forget about and pass it on to anyone looking at my paintings. I’d like to remind the viewers that we’re all connected even when we’re physically far away from each other. My goal is to make them submerge in a magical space that may be even more real than our perceived surroundings and remind them that everything is possible.

Background

At the core of quantum physics is the idea that the forms and sizes of objects in the Universe depend on the viewer’s perception. This idea is very different from the Philosophical Realism of the ancient Greeks who believed that everything in the Universe exists in and of itself, independent of human consciousness. The theory of quantum physics seems closer to the one of Idealism where it’s believed that reality is a form of the human mind. It can take on a variety of different forms because both consciousness and matter consist of pure energy.

The strange floating creatures in my paintings represent energy vessels of information from the invisible world in which we’re submerged. These “Fluctuations” can take on different, unusual shapes that can also remind of creatures from the sea depths or the microcosmos. They are everywhere around us. They react to us and change based on our thoughts and moods. They float in a different substance with lighted spaces on the background, in city landscapes, some of which are more homogeneous and others more dynamic.   

The sharp protruding elements come from the material world. They pierce the “fluctuations,” creating visual and compositional dynamic.

What We Need & What You Get

All the paintings are finished. Your funding is needed for:

  • Installation costs: $860
  • Art catalogue and promotional materials: $1300
  • Artwork transportation: $540

Based on your funding preferences you can get anything from a “Flumental” postcard and inclusion in the sponsors’ list to a watercolor or original “Flumental” - themed painting. Here is an example of a watercolor painting and you can learn about all the great perks on the right side of this page.

The Impact

With your contributions you'll give a broader audience in Europe a chance to touch themselves to the positive messages of magic, unity and possibility in a time when there is a lot of division among us. You'll help people get together through beauty and remind them that there is much more than our eyes can see and that it is up to us to live positively. 

My previous exhibition at Gallery Cortina — the same Milanese gallery that has sent me this invitation to showcase my new paintings in June — gathered huge crowds and has been my most successful exhibition to date. 

My work has been featured in various international publications, including the British magazine Illustration, the Italian editions of Artecultura, Artshow, Giornale di Sicilia and others. Additionally, critics that have written about my work include Stefano Cortina, Plamen Dimitrov, Dorothea Pavlova, Bruna Solinas, Salvatore Arichio, Roses Orlando, and Francesco Paolo Campione.

I have been interviewed for a local and a national channel on Bulgarian Television as well as a number of newspapers. 

I am also a winner of the Aurelio Galleppini illustration competition in Chiavari, Italy.

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenges would be to transport all the paintings safely, without any damages. I'm investing additional funds in packing to make sure the paintings will get to Milan safely. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, there are other ways you can help. Please spread the word among your friends and family and share this campaign on your social media channels. 

I am deeply grateful for any support you can offer.
story_txt:
Fluctuations
In "FluMental" I try to capture the invisible positive energy around us that we often forget about and pass it on to anyone looking at my paintings. I’d like to remind the viewers that we’re all connected even when we’re physically far away from each other. My goal is to make them submerge in a magical space that may be even more real than our perceived surroundings and remind them that everything is possible.
Background
At the core of quantum physics is the idea that the forms and sizes of objects in the Universe depend on the viewer’s perception. This idea is very different from the Philosophical Realism of the ancient Greeks who believed that everything in the Universe exists in and of itself, independent of human consciousness. The theory of quantum physics seems closer to the one of Idealism where it’s believed that reality is a form of the human mind. It can take on a variety of different forms because both consciousness and matter consist of pure energy.
The strange floating creatures in my paintings represent energy vessels of information from the invisible world in which we’re submerged. These “Fluctuations” can take on different, unusual shapes that can also remind of creatures from the sea depths or the microcosmos. They are everywhere around us. They react to us and change based on our thoughts and moods. They float in a different substance with lighted spaces on the background, in city landscapes, some of which are more homogeneous and others more dynamic.   
The sharp protruding elements come from the material world. They pierce the “fluctuations,” creating visual and compositional dynamic.

What We Need & What You Get
All the paintings are finished. Your funding is needed for:

Installation costs: $860
Art catalogue and promotional materials: $1300
Artwork transportation: $540

Based on your funding preferences you can get anything from a “Flumental” postcard and inclusion in the sponsors’ list to a watercolor or original “Flumental” - themed painting. Here is an example of a watercolor painting and you can learn about all the great perks on the right side of this page.

The Impact
With your contributions you'll give a broader audience in Europe a chance to touch themselves to the positive messages of magic, unity and possibility in a time when there is a lot of division among us. You'll help people get together through beauty and remind them that there is much more than our eyes can see and that it is up to us to live positively. 
My previous exhibition at Gallery Cortina — the same Milanese gallery that has sent me this invitation to showcase my new paintings in June — gathered huge crowds and has been my most successful exhibition to date. 
My work has been featured in various international publications, including the British magazine Illustration, the Italian editions of Artecultura, Artshow, Giornale di Sicilia and others. Additionally, critics that have written about my work include Stefano Cortina, Plamen Dimitrov, Dorothea Pavlova, Bruna Solinas, Salvatore Arichio, Roses Orlando, and Francesco Paolo Campione.
I have been interviewed for a local and a national channel on Bulgarian Television as well as a number of newspapers. 
I am also a winner of the Aurelio Galleppini illustration competition in Chiavari, Italy.

Risks & Challenges
One of the biggest challenges would be to transport all the paintings safely, without any damages. I'm investing additional funds in packing to make sure the paintings will get to Milan safely. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute money, there are other ways you can help. Please spread the word among your friends and family and share this campaign on your social media channels. 
I am deeply grateful for any support you can offer.

story:
Join the Family and help us turn a 

An Antique Gypsy Caravan

into an enchanting

~~Travelling Theatre~~ 

We want to take brilliant performance, out of the traditional setting, onto the road and into communities creating a meeting place for sharing stories that are intimate, informative, imaginative and inspired.

Please join us and make this happen...

We need your help to restore the wagon to its former glory, build a bespoke stage and get out into the world (not to a museum!) to bring stories and magic to back streets and forgotten corners of the country.

The caravan was first built to house a circus performer's family in 1892 and moonlighted fifty years later as a horse driven tea room when two intrepid young women refurbished it to mark the end of WWII.

Now, it in its third century it is being reborn, this time as a travelling stage - going to the places most theatres can’t get to.

 

 The Theatre will be a captivating platform bringing together the best international story-telling, theatre, cabaret, poetry, music and talks.  Artists who travel with the Gypsy Caravan Theatre will engage with the community. The people who live where the caravan arrives will become part of the worlds these artists create. Audiences will be enthralled and excited and most importantly, connected.



Enter our Gypsy Caravan Theatre world.

 

 

The Caravan Theatre is an invitation for people from all walks of life and all ages to meet and share stories through performance.

The emphasis is on collaboration and bringing together groups of people who might not normally work together so that we can learn from one another and share our own story.

A place to listen or take part in performance both playful and poignant.

We will turn up anywhere; whether church or car park, music hall or hospital, village green or council estate.

We are interested in challenging the normal expectations of going to the theatre. We want you to walk up a dirt track, slide down a dune to a beach, slink your way through a dark alley until you see the lights twinkling and the music playing and find yourself at a rare and beautiful site...

The Gypsy Caravan Theatre has come to your town

"The lost art of storytelling, whether in a 1500 seat theatre or a small film made for a mobile phone, is coming back with a relish. I can't imagine any more elegant, magical or authentic arena for story-telling than the Gypsy Caravan Theatre, and I am sure it will prove a stunning success."

Dominic Dromgoole - Artistic Director of Shakespeares Globe Theatre

So here's the thing:

The Gypsy Caravan is in a very fragile state. In fact it is slowly decaying and soon will be in total disrepair. Having been lovingly looked after by so many different people over its long life, a modern day Black Beauty, we have come to realise that we will need a little more than love to get the caravan's onto its next journey.

Before it can face the world as a travelling stage is it in need of restoration.

Edward Crouch of Crawford Coachbuilders and Wheelwrights one of Britain's most eminent craftsmen of this traditional trade will conduct the work. They have restored carriages for Showmen of the worlds best Circuses to the state carriages of the Royal Family. Edward and his team will use traditional methods and specialised techniques for this extraordinary heritage project. Their work will allow everyone who comes in contact with the wagon to appreciate the craftsmanship and traditional travelling homes of Gypsies and Circus people alike, a sight that is now so rarely seen out of a museum or a Glamping catalogue.   

We need to raise £25,000 in order to replace the roof, restore the undercarriage, undertake woodwork repairs and reinforcements to the main body as well as stripping, painting and traditional decorative work.

 

And also a stunning set to travel with us..

The Theatre set will be created from hand-painted wooden concertina screens that will fit neatly underneath the wagon for travelling. The screens are designed to widen the performance space without destroying the spell of the caravan’s special history.

Who is behind The Gypsy Caravan Theatre...?

We are a group of creative practitioners, with expertise in the arts, theatre and film direction as well as community outreach work and festival and event production. We are dedicated creating a participatory way of enjoying performance, one that creates cultural encounters through stories, art and song.  

 

My name is Clemmie I grew up playing in the caravan with my cousins. It was our wendyhouse from another realm. I first imagined the theatre after I moved the caravan from my grandmother’s field to a Gypsy museum in Kent to start working on the restoration.

One afternoon a friend came over to help me paint and started playing his guitar and singing out the back of the wagon.

A group of school children who were there to learn about Gypsy culture came over and joined in.

There was a spark of magic in that moment as I watched the children clamber onto the wagon and join in with the music. The caravan and its inspiring history and captivating world had brought us all together. 

Ever since then I wanted to take that enchantment onto the road and share it with as many people as possible. 

 

The Gypsy Caravan Theatre has begun its journey as it means to go on, through creative collaborations.

We have partnered with 1st Framework's Maxine Webster and Peter Avery to produce 3 original events

Gypsy Caravan Midwinter Cabaret~ Local Kent musicians, puppeteers and comedians made this stage their own for an evening in January 2013.

‘Journeys’ Puppetry Shows ~  A culmination of a 6 week collaborative project under 10s at Faraday Primary School and 3rdthought, an older adult theatre company in the London Docklands. .

Gypsy Caravan Midsummer Cabaret ~ An evening showcasing everything from Opera to Reggae Choir on the banks of the River Thames by Londons oldest Lighthouse.

Please support us so we can get even more ambitious with this work.

There are many organisations that are keen to work with us in 2014 - but we won't be able to do it without you!

To name but a few; The Globe, Battersea Arts Centre, Hay on Wye Festival, The Roald Dahl Museum...

Other Ways You Can Help

As a group of artists and producers we believe you can participate and contribute in a variety of ways. Not everyone will be able to contribute financially and that's ok with us. We have dedicated our time to this project for free, in the hope that this can encourage other people to share what they have.

We know you all have something to bring and the really exciting thing is we know it will be fantastic whatever it is, because working together is the real goal and thats when the magic happens.

  • Maybe you're a performer - opera singer or actress -  interested in taking your work somewhere new in the midst of a community

  • Maybe you sing or do you carry stories in your notebook?

  • Are you good at marketing or a dab hand at advertising?

  • Are you a painter, set designer or artist - are you inspired? Do you want to make signs, build sets, take photos?  

  • Do you like baking cakes, feeding people and serving cold cider to a hard working crew?

  • Do you want to see the very best of British Theatre performed in a clearing in a wood out the back of a wagon.

If you are any of these things get in touch.  There is plenty to do!

gypsycaravantheatre@gmail.com.

Only with your help can we make this happen!

story:
About

BPBD (Best Portuguese Book Designs) is a project established by six Portuguese Graphic Designers working between Lisbon, Porto and Amsterdam. Together, we are Ricardo Leite, Marta Veludo, João Santos, João Martins, João Sousa and João Simões.

Book contests are an important cultural mark in countries such as Holland, Switzerland, France, England, Belgium, etc. Each country recognises what arethe most beautifully designed books and thus presents them to the world, spreading and preserving their cultural heritage whilst also taking influence from abroad. We decided to implement the same idea in Portugal, to give an insight into an editorial practice throughout a range of years with the intention to archive a part of our national history. 

Our campaign is aimed at raising the necessary in order to achieve the dream of Best Portuguese Book Designs. For this project to be realised, we will need your support to make the exhibition happen. It will take place in 2015 in Portugal, and it will be designed with the help of industrial Portuguese design studio Galula (www.galulastudio.com). To make the exhibition complete, we will print an edition of 500 catalogues, featuring essays and articles of critics, designers and publishers, both nationally and internationally recognised.

Your contribution can make our dreams become a reality. With your help, we can start BPBD and reveal to the world the great quality of design that is made in Portugal. With your support, we can build a public exhibition that has the high quality, which this project deserves. From this, we can produce our catalogue in collaboration with five esteemed printing companies, and thus create a beautiful and memorable object.

Our ambition is to spread the BPBD catalogue to as many places as possible, including museums, institutions and bookshops. 

To achieve this goal, your help is invaluable.


Our funds will be mainly used for three things

1. A printed catalogue with a print run of 500, including all the production costs and translations. 

2. The exhibition design, including materials, structural design and transportation. 

3. Indiegogo Rewards and Postage.



Our Rewards 

The BPBD rewards are an ode to the print and book universe. You can join us in this fantastic adventure from only placing your name on our website, to purchasing the exhibition. You would be buying a part of history and precious design material that defines Portuguese design from 2010-2013! Check them out, we have wonderful goodies too! If we can't reach the goal, the funds are going to be spent building the exhibition in the best way possible. The catalogue will be in a cheaper format, or only with digital presence.

The Impact

By supporting BPBD 2010-13, you will be a part of a renowned Portuguese organisation. With your help, we can fill the gap in design culture in Portugal. We would also like to export Portuguese design in an editorial format. We believe in the quality and excellence of what is made in our country and the necessity that we have to show ourselves internationally. This is one of the reasons why we present ourselves as bilingual. 

Risks & Challenges

Through our professional occupations in the design, we have plenty of experience managing the production process from the initial stages of the writer’s draft through to design, layout, proofing and finally printing. For the exhibition design, we are working closely with Galula Studio. With your help, we are confident that we can deliver this exhibition and catalogue to the highest standard.

To be able to make the BPBD exhibition and catalogue, we really need to reach the €9,000 target trough this Indiegogo campaign. Donations beyond this target will help us enormously with covering distribution costs and making sure the exhibition and catalogue are exceptional beyond reproach. We believe in the importance of BPBD in the national design culture.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share our campaign with your friends! Every contribution is valuable to make this happen. 

Thank you for taking the time to read about Best Portuguese Book Designs 2010-13. 

We hope you will consider contributing and share the project with all your friends. 

www.bestportuguesebookdesigns.com


—

PORTUGUÊS

BPBD (Best Portuguese Book Designs) é um projecto desenvolvido por seis designers gráficos portugueses que trabalham e residem entre Lisboa, Porto e Amesterdão: Ricardo Leite, Marta Veludo, João Santos, João Martins, João Sousa e João Simões.

As selecções de livros são uma marca cultural em países como a Holanda, Suíça, França, Inglaterra, ou Bélgica. Cada país reconhece os melhores exemplos de design de livros e divulga-os para todo o mundo, apresentado e preservando a sua herança cultural e sua influência internacional. 

Decidimos implementar a mesma ideia em Portugal, para oferecer um ponto de vista sobre a prática do design editorial entre os anos 2010-2013 com a intenção de constituir um arquivo da nossa história nacional.

A nossa campanha tem como objectivo alcançar a visão que temos deste projecto como Best Portuguese Book Designs. Para a realização deste projecto, necessitamos de todo o apoio necessário para produzir um catálogo e uma exposição. A exposição irá ser inaugurada durante 2015 em Portugal, tendo vindo a ser desenhada pelo estúdio português de design de produto Galula (www.galulastudio.com). Para completar esta exposição iremos também produzir uma edição de 500 catálogos impressos, com ensaios e artigos de críticos, designers e editores, reconhecidos nacional e internacionalmente. 

A vossa contribuição pode tornar o nosso sonho em realidade. Com a vossa ajuda, poderemos continuar o BPBD e mostrar a grande qualidade do design feito em Portugal. Com o vosso apoio, poderemos criar uma exposição public com a qualidade que o projecto merece. Daqui poderemos também produzir um catálogo em colaboração com 5 estimadas gráficas, criando um objecto belo e memorável.

A nossa ambição é distribuir o catálogo BPBD por o maior número de locais possível, incluindo museus, instituições e livrarias. Para atingir estes objectivos contamos convosco!


Os fundos vão ser usados principalmente para três coisas:

1. Um catálogo impresso com uma tiragem de 500 exemplares, incluindo custos de produção e traduções.

2. O design da exposição, incluindo materiais, design estrutural e transporte.

3. Recompensas do Indiegogo e despesas de envio.



As nossas recompensas

As recompensas por ajudar o BPBD são uma ode à impressão e ao universo dos livros. Queremos que se juntem a nós nesta aventura, desde colocando o vosso nome nos agradecimentos do catálogo e website, até à compra da exposição completa. Ficarão com uma parte da história do design português e contemporâneo e materiais exclusivos que definem o design português entre 2010 e 2013! Se não conseguirmos atingir o objectivo, os fundos serão investidos para construir a exposição na melhor forma possível. O catálogo será nesse caso impresso num formato mais económico, ou apenas terá presença digital.

O impacto

Ao apoiar o BPBD 2010-13, serão parte de uma reconhecida organização Portuguesa. Com a vossa ajuda, poderemos preencher uma lacuna na cultura de design português. Também pretendemos exportar o design português num formato editorial. Acreditamos na qualidade e excelência do que é feito no nosso país e na necessidade de nos mostrarmos internacionalmente. Esta é uma das razões porque nos apresentamos em português e inglês.

Riscos e Desafios

Através das nossas ocupações profissionais em design, temos bastante experiência em gerir os processos de produção, desde os primeiros rascunhos dos autores até ao design, paginação, arte-final até à impressão. Para o design da exposição estamos a trabalhar em colaboração com o Estúdio Galula. Com o vosso apoio estamos confiantes de que conseguiremos realizar esta exposição e catálogo ao mais alto nível.

Para realizar a exposição e catálogo do BPBD, necessitamos realmente de chegar aos € 9,000, através desta campanha no Indiegogo. Todos os fundos que estamos a pedir são direcionados para estes objectivos, não havendo nenhum pagamento para a organização. Donativos que ultrapassam o objectivo vão ajudar-nos muito a cobrir os custos de distribuição e a certificar-nos de que a exposição e catálogo serão excepcionais. Acreditamos na importância do BPBD na cultura de design portuguesa.

Outras formas de nos ajudarem

Podem partilhar esta campanha com os vossos amigos! Cada contribuição é valiosa para tornar este projecto real.

Obrigado por terem dedicado tempo a ler sobre Best Portuguese Book Designs 2010-13.

Esperamos que considerem a contribuição para este projecto e que o partilhem com todos os amigos.

www.bestportuguesebookdesigns.com

As selecções de livros são uma marca cultural em países como a Holanda, Suíça, França, Inglaterra, ou Bélgica. Cada país reconhece os melhores exemplos de design de livros e divulga-os para todo o mundo, apresentado e preservando a sua herança cultural e sua influência internacional. 
Decidimos implementar a mesma ideia em Portugal, para oferecer um ponto de vista sobre a prática do design editorial entre os anos 2010-2013 com a intenção de constituir um arquivo da nossa história nacional.
A nossa campanha tem como objectivo alcançar a visão que temos deste projecto como Best Portuguese Book Designs. Para a realização deste projecto, necessitamos de todo o apoio necessário para produzir um catálogo e uma exposição. A exposição irá ser inaugurada durante 2015 em Portugal, tendo vindo a ser desenhada pelo estúdio português de design de produto Galula (www.galulastudio.com). Para completar esta exposição iremos também produzir uma edição de 500 catálogos impressos, com ensaios e artigos de críticos, designers e editores, reconhecidos nacional e internacionalmente. 
A vossa contribuição pode tornar o nosso sonho em realidade. Com a vossa ajuda, poderemos continuar o BPBD e mostrar a grande qualidade do design feito em Portugal. Com o vosso apoio, poderemos criar uma exposição public com a qualidade que o projecto merece. Daqui poderemos também produzir um catálogo em colaboração com 5 estimadas gráficas, criando um objecto belo e memorável.
A nossa ambição é distribuir o catálogo BPBD por o maior número de locais possível, incluindo museus, instituições e livrarias. Para atingir estes objectivos contamos convosco!



Os fundos vão ser usados principalmente para três coisas:
1. Um catálogo impresso com uma tiragem de 500 exemplares, incluindo custos de produção e traduções.
2. O design da exposição, incluindo materiais, design estrutural e transporte.
3. Recompensas do Indiegogo e despesas de envio.








As nossas recompensas


As recompensas por ajudar o BPBD são uma ode à impressão e ao universo dos livros. Queremos que se juntem a nós nesta aventura, desde colocando o vosso nome nos agradecimentos do catálogo e website, até à compra da exposição completa. Ficarão com uma parte da história do design português e contemporâneo e materiais exclusivos que definem o design português entre 2010 e 2013! Se não conseguirmos atingir o objectivo, os fundos serão investidos para construir a exposição na melhor forma possível. O catálogo será nesse caso impresso num formato mais económico, ou apenas terá presença digital.
O impacto


Ao apoiar o BPBD 2010-13, serão parte de uma reconhecida organização Portuguesa. Com a vossa ajuda, poderemos preencher uma lacuna na cultura de design português. Também pretendemos exportar o design português num formato editorial. Acreditamos na qualidade e excelência do que é feito no nosso país e na necessidade de nos mostrarmos internacionalmente. Esta é uma das razões porque nos apresentamos em português e inglês.
Riscos e Desafios
Através das nossas ocupações profissionais em design, temos bastante experiência em gerir os processos de produção, desde os primeiros rascunhos dos autores até ao design, paginação, arte-final até à impressão. Para o design da exposição estamos a trabalhar em colaboração com o Estúdio Galula. Com o vosso apoio estamos confiantes de que conseguiremos realizar esta exposição e catálogo ao mais alto nível.
Para realizar a exposição e catálogo do BPBD, necessitamos realmente de chegar aos € 9,000, através desta campanha no Indiegogo. Todos os fundos que estamos a pedir são direcionados para estes objectivos, não havendo nenhum pagamento para a organização. Donativos que ultrapassam o objectivo vão ajudar-nos muito a cobrir os custos de distribuição e a certificar-nos de que a exposição e catálogo serão excepcionais. Acreditamos na importância do BPBD na cultura de design portuguesa.
Outras formas de nos ajudarem
Podem partilhar esta campanha com os vossos amigos! Cada contribuição é valiosa para tornar este projecto real.


Obrigado por terem dedicado tempo a ler sobre Best Portuguese Book Designs 2010-13.


Esperamos que considerem a contribuição para este projecto e que o partilhem com todos os amigos.
www.bestportuguesebookdesigns.com

story:
Dear supporters,

thanks a lot for all your help, patience and support! After a great campaign I just opened the regular online shop for all the Papertrophies you see here and even more.

Please visit www.papertrophy.com if you are interesed in buying one of the Papertrophies.



A collection of beautiful Papercraft Art for your home.

And, in a special Perk, the XXL-Size Mighty-Gorilla:


As requested from our fans there are now two new XL-Size Papertrophies availabe!

The XL-Elk is 110cm (43,31'') tall, the XL-Penguin about 81cm (31,89'')






Inspired by the classic animal trophies I set out to find a timeless design you love to look at every day. The complex yet simple polygon structure reflects the modern design-approach. The Papertrophy animals feature a minimalistic cubic design. It represents simplicity while offering an astonishing look through shadows and light on the trophies. Their bright and vibrant colors create depth and radiate an extravagant elegance.
I designed five stand up figures and five wall hanging trophies.

You can choose one of the pre-colored designs (with two colors per Papertrophy, you can choose between 80 color-options per trophy!) or build the white version, which is offering a wide possibility for personalization. Either way you will get a beautiful piece of art that simply makes your living room, kitchen or study just look so much better. They are also an excellent gift-idea for people who just like nice things around them :)


Hundreds of polygons fit perfectly inside each other and build a sturdy construction using nothing more then paper and glue. It's astonishing how solid the final product is if you see the single paper elements used to build it.

The models are so solid in the end; you might even want to wear them as masks for your next Halloween party!



I use only heavy, high quality papers of at least 220g/m2 (as a reference: your regular printer paper is 80g/m2), handpicked from German paper manufactories. All papers are eco friendly and carry the FSC seal.





Building Papertrophies is easy. It just takes some time and regular paper glue. The final product arrives not only pre-cut but with pre-creased folding patterns at your doorstep. That makes folding super easy.
You don‘t even need complicated and long instructions: Simply glue the numbered pieces together and the final product will magically appear piece by piece in your hand.


Once all flaps are glued together you see the initial paper-parts transforming into a three-dimensional artwork ready to be hung on the wall and displayed.

Design is a very important factor for everything I do. I studied every single polygon, cut line and flap. My goal was not only to perfect the look but also to ensure that building it will be straightforward and as easy as possible. In the end I was able to set up every single Papertrophy elegant, yet easy to build.

You don‘t need a blueprint or complicated instructions. Theoretically you don‘t even have to know what kind of animal you are building - the figures form themselves. Some say its like magic :)
 
To make sure that you will build a perfect Papertrophy every package contains a training sheet. That means you can try out your long forgotten gluing-skills from your childhood before start building the real Papertrophy!

Instead of just sending out a training sheet everybody who orders a Papertrophy (excluding downloads)now gets our  guinea pig for free!

That's right: Order a Papertrophy now and you get this adorable pig for free!



Papertrophies are designed in Berlin, Germany,  machine-cut and pre-fold from high quality eco-friendly paper for precision and quality by local printers.

Every papercraft is checked manually to ensure that only perfectly cut and pre-folded models receive the official Papertrophy seal.

I worked hard to optimize the complex polygon design without compromising the user-friendly building-process. Over the last few months I prototyped many different options and settled for the perfect size, look and use of material.


I didn‘t just want to send out sheets of paper.
Cutting hundreds of polygons takes a lot of time and tools (around seven hours for one trophy by hand - believe me I built quite a few ;) )

But more important you have to be very precise in cutting when you do it by hand as small mistakes of a fraction of a millimeter add up fast to an unsatisfied experience in the end.

That's why for the mass customization I'm are going to use professional industrial style plotters and die molds to ensure the highest grade of quality possible while shortening the building process. 

The final product arrives not only pre-cut but with pre-creased folding patterns at your doorstep. 



I came up with the idea for Papertrophy because I was tired of looking at 2D posters and framed paintings on the walls. I also like to travel and love to see wild animals in their natural habitat. So I set to create a design concept that allows me and anyone else to create art in the style of classic Safari-trophy in a modern and animal-friendly design approach.


Using them as projection surfaces for light-installations in the clubs of Berlin I got asked a lot to produce them for friends at home. That's how I came up with the idea of Papertrophy. I redesigned the first seven models for home use and am now ready for releasing them to the public.



Papertrophy models come in a variety of colors. Drop me a line if your favorite is not among the offered ones and I will do my best to include it in the next batch.

If you have any ideas or special wishes for other creatures and/or color-variations, I'm more than happy to receive input on this matter at info@papertrophy.com. I might even be able to design some of them as a special limited edition for you here at indiegogo as a stretched goal!


The regular retail price for one regular Papertrophy will probably be $69.

If you support me on indiegogo you will be able to get my special supporter rates. Simply scroll back up and select a Perk you want to get!

But hurry, the faster you are, the more you'll safe!



Do you want to share my story in your blog?
AWESOME!
Here is a link to high-resolution pictures:
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/oz4q986d9av4zsu/AADTInmGpgu2ySXwqxY232Fia?dl=0

If you have any questions I'm more then happy to answer them! Drop me a line at
info@papertrophy.com, skype me at "papertrophy" or visit my contactpage.

Thank you for reading so far - I really appreciate it!
Even if you can't spend your hard-earned Dollars, you can help the project come to live for free:

Please spread the word by sharing below. THANK YOU!

story:
House of Strength 

Hi, I'm Nooshin Rostami, a New York-based interdisciplinary artist and educator. I was raised in Tehran, Iran and currently live and work in Brooklyn, NY, where I have a studio at Industry City.

I've been given an amazing opportunity to perform my piece House of Strength at the DUMBO Arts Festival on Saturday, September 27th and Sunday, September 28th. House of Strength is a performance inspired by traditional Persian gymnasiums called Zoorkhaneh (House of Strength) where male participants practice physical training, as well as virtues of humbleness, forgiveness, brotherhood, and generosity. Women have traditionally been strictly forbidden from entering these gyms where male semi-nude performances are led by a singer who chants sacred poetry and plays drums and bells. Women are occasionally allowed to enter the arena and sit as members of the audience. 

With my first performance, I reimagined the Zoorkhaneh as an exclusively female space, where women artists collectively performed a contemporary rendition of these traditional rituals through choreographed movements with props and music. For my performance of House of Strength at the DUMBO Arts Festival, I've invited male and female artists from different ethnic backgrounds working in a variety of disciplines to participate in reinventing House of Strength as an inclusive, global (rather than culturally-specific) and androgynous arena.  

Visit the House of Strength website for photos and videos of my first performance: www.houseofstrength.info

A recent review on our first performance:
• The House of Melancholy and Strength, Written by Gelare Khoshgozaran, Published by jadaliyya

What I Need

Honoraria for Performers, Sound Artist, Choreographer and Production manager 

Rehearsal Space

Safe Platform for the Dancers to be able to perform on cobblestone 

Funds for Repairing Props 

New Costumes for Dancers 

Photographer and Videographer 

Post-Production: Video Editing, Website, Etc. 

YOUR SUPPORT!

Artists

Director and Producer : Nooshin Rostami
Dancers : Jessica Israel, Anahita Mogahaddam, Catherine Murcek, Scott Olsen, Abby Price, Princeton Spicer
Choreographer: Autumn Kioti
Sound Artist: Negar Behbahani
Production Manager: Amirmohsen Shahheidari

---------------------
Previous members, whose dedication and work made our first performance possible:

 Mersiha Mesihovic (Choreographer, Dancer and Hairstylist)
 Amanda Hameline, Natalie Pulido (Dancers)
