story:
Bringing Art + Beer Together

Goal: To transform our buses into iconic mobile pieces of art that inspire people to appreciate craft beer.

What Is The Project All About?

Our mission is raise enough funds to so that we can get two full decal wraps as well as the necessary mechanical repairs for our two short buses, Angel & Rosie.  The project will require a collaboration of many people working together to make it happen. Our vision is to have these buses embody the spirit of craft beer and the environment of Portland by being cultural landmarks for both visitors and locals. 

We have already begun the process. A local photographer, Deborah Jutz (BluView Photography) and a bunch of volunteers got together on a sunny Friday afternoon for a photoshoot. The idea is to show REAL people enjoying the BREWVANA experience in color, on top of the background.  The people are all wearing nametags and pretzel necklaces and holding beer with happy faces. BREWVANA is not just about the beer, it's really about the people. The plan is to have the images of the people in color, along with the BREWVANA logo on top of the collage of the environment of beer in Portland in the background. Here are the people we shot:

Next, we need to create the background, the environment. Photographer Aaron Filipowsky (ASF Shoots) has taken photos for us to use in the design including hops, barley, water, mountains, water, benson bubblers, bikes, bridges,  kegs, etc- any images he could find to build the environment of craft beer in Portland and the Northwest.  Next, our bus art designer, Cassandra Stemler is responsible for the design portion. First, she had to measure the buses to know what her canvas looked like. 

Whoa- thats a HUGE canvas! The next step is to take the photos as well as other images and collage them together to create the art.

And that’s how far we’ve gotten with the project. We are currently working on finalizing the design. The next step is to fix the repairs on the vehicles,  produce the wraps, apply them, and start rolling!

Just as water is to beer, our buses are to our business- we couldn’t make it without them! Our buses safely transport beer enthusiasts to and from breweries while providing the Ultimate Craft Beer Tour Experience. Now it’s time to show them some love with mechanical repairs as well as full decal wraps so they’re up to snuff with a brand spankin’ new look. These buses will truly represent the BREWVANA experience and our brand.

What Is the Cost Of This Project?

Our goal of $10,000 will pay for the following:

          -Creation of the bus art design

          -Repairs to the vehicle

          -Production and application of the wraps

Our stretch goal of $25,000 will pay for the following:  

          -An additional vehicle  

          -Permits and licenses to extend tours to Washington


Why Should YOU Donate?

Just as beer can unite anyone and everyone, so can art. Through art we are reminded why craft beer is so vital to the happiness and livelihood of the local community. BREWVANA’s mission is to support and promote the history, culture and community of the craft beer industry. These buses serve as champions for the craft beer community, rallying all levels of beer lovers both near and far, from eager newbies to seasoned vets, to enjoy Portland’s many breweries. By donating to our cause, you’ll allow us to complete our bus art project,  transport beer lovers both safely AND in style and allow us to expand to reach more Northwest beer destinations. More importantly, you will be helping to promote other local businesses, the toursim industry, the economy in Oregon AND craft beer everywhere! Did we mention our super sweet perks?


Our Perks

Since our project is all about combining art and beer, so do our gifts! With all of our $25+ perks, you will get an awesome Art Poster designed and designed by the bus artist!!  Other perks include hand-crafted beer koozies, beer art coasters, wall mounted bottle openers, and even beer soap! Higher perk levels include joyrides on the newly transformed buses with your friends.  All of our perks are created with love. 

We always try to support our friends in the community so supplies used to craft our gifts were specifically chosen from local businesses. By choosing local we're able to support and promote the wonderful small businesses of the Pacific Northwest. All rewards are made with love. Check out our perks page for more pics and to see what local businesses we partnered with to create your gifts!


11x17 poster designed and signed by the bus design artist, Cassandra Stemler.

We love ART and BEER!

What YOU can do to help:

A donation of ANY amount will get us closer to reaching our goal.  We would also appreciate you sharing this page with your friends, family, loved ones and enemies, anyone who you think would appreciate our cause and support us in reaching our goal. 


THANKS SO MUCH AND CHEERS TO YOU! LOVE, THE BREWVANA CREW!

11x17 poster designed and signed by the bus design artist, Cassandra Stemler.

We love ART and BEER!









What YOU can do to help:A donation of ANY amount will get us closer to reaching our goal.  We would also appreciate you sharing this page with your friends, family, loved ones and enemies, anyone who you think would appreciate our cause and support us in reaching our goal. 

THANKS SO MUCH AND CHEERS TO YOU! LOVE, THE BREWVANA CREW!

story:
Short Summary

Earlier this year, I was chosen to be a part of a select few in John Ross Palmer’s Escapist Mentorship program while attending Millikin University for my BFA. Being the first and only Millikin student to be selected as an Escapist has been a monumental moment in my career and has set me up for success as an artist. The Escapist program is based out of John's home base of Houston, TX, while I currently live in St Louis, MO. What's becoming astonishingly clear during my time as an Escapist is that I need to physically travel to Houston to meet John. 

In October, John hosts his annual Black Tie Gala, an exhibition event in which all of his Escapist mentees mingle with John, each other, and John's collectors who help support his  painting career. Meeting all of these people is the next step in my path and will open doors in terms of my professional success. By backing me, you are not only helping me to fund both myself and my art getting down to Texas, you’re helping a young artist materialize his dream. Every dollar you give is a step closer to my success.  I plan to extensively document this process from Day 1 through the actual trip to Houston in form of video logs and journal entries, giving backers insight into where I’m at and how my journey is going.

I have a lot of momentum going into this: this year, I won both Best in Show and Peoples' Choice awards at the 2014 Self-Employment in the Arts Conference in Lisle, Illinois. I also completed my BFA Exhibition titled Omphaloskepsis: New Visions, which focused around painting as an act separate from daily life yet totally entrenched in it. I'm especially concerned with ideas of narcissism that are inherent in the process of painting a self-portrait and taking those ideas to their logical extremes through repetition.

John always tells us to refuse to struggle. Although the costs of this trip are problematic for a young painter still getting on his feet, I have strong faith that you will help me to become as successful as I know I can be. Getting to Houston is the first step. From there, there are no limits.

Available works and prints through this campaign are shown below, and you can see larger versions of these images in the gallery above.

Elizabeth (Sleeper), Sharpie on Stonehenge paper, 16x13" w/frame, $125

Looker, oil and pencil on paper, 21.75x27" w/frame, $175, prints $25, limited edition prints $60

Self-Portrait Falling Over, oil and pencil on paper, 21.75x27" w/frame, $175, prints $25, limited edition prints $60

Self-Portrait as a Man Left to His Own Devices, oil and pencil on paper, 21.75x27" w/frame, $175, prints $25, limited edition prints $60

Self-Portrait with a Dead Right Arm, oil and pencil on paper, 21.75x27" w/frame, $175, prints $25, limited edition prints $60

Self-Portrait as a Navel Gazer, oil on canvas, 16x20", $250, prints $25, limited edition prints $60

Self-Portrait (Whistler), oil on canvas, 16x20", $250, prints $25, limited edition prints $60

Vaseline, oil and pencil on canvas, 16x20", $250, prints $25, limited edition prints $60

Compacting Experiment, oil on canvas, 12x16", $125, prints $25, limited edition prints $60


More information about John Ross Palmer and the Escapist Program can be found here: EscapistProgram.com

More of my work can be seen by clicking here

You can get in touch with me here: michael.e.shultz@gmail.com

What I Need & What You Get

For this trip, I'll need to raise $1,500

  • $500 for economy, round-trip airfare and affordable lodging.
  • $500 for shipping, crating, and insurance costs to be certain my work arrives safely
  • $500 for miscellaneous costs, including extra supplies, tuxedo rental (this IS a black tie event, after all!) and accomodation for the time I'm there.

The Impact

Your dollar will go towards a life-changing journey for a young artist. There are no words that can describe my gratitude should you decide to contribute to this project-- so instead of words, you'll get some fantastic original art!

    Risks & Challenges

    The inherent risk with art projects is that I find myself funded and with no serious interest in my work. However, there are no real risks involved for you as a backer-- since these works are already created, I can guarantee their arrival on your doorstep.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Not everyone will be able to contribute, and that's okay! By liking, sharing, or even just watching this campaign, you are helping to spread the word of one young man's dream of becoming a professional painter. Thank you!

story:
Dear Indiegogo-ers:

Welcome to my second Indiegogo campaign in support my memoir in progress "Point & Shoot-The Death of Photography". My name is Paul Perrier and I am a photographer/filmmaker born and raised in Montréal and now living in Toronto, Canada. After backpacking through Europe and the Middle East with a 35 mm camera in 1981-82, I returned home and had to make a decision on what to do with my life? One of the photographs I took on this journey called "The Gates"  led me to a decision to pursue photography and attempt to make a career out of it. It has been a long strange trip ever since and the reason for writing my story. It took a long time for me to understand that being a photographer is more than making pictures ... it is a way of life. Not exactly a normal way of life either. The art of photography is taking a negative and changing it into a positive. This process is achieved in the dark, through which light always shines.

My background:

Upon my return to Montreal after my backpacking trek, I studied photography at The Dawson Institute of Photography for two years in the mid 1980's and then set out to pursue my dream. It has been proven that to become good at anything one must put an average 10,000 hours of practice into it. From 1985 until 1999, I did my time and then some, while making hundreds of thousands of photographic images. Just as I felt I was beginning to master my craft and build a business, I sensed a change was on the way that would cause a wave of disruption in my career path - Digital Imaging. It was at this time that I decided to take advantage of the same emerging new digital technology in documentary filmmaking to expand my story telling options. With no experience in the field and with the help of some knowledgeable friends, I documented the events on video and through still photographs at my high school's 22nd year reunion in August of 1999, at the Queen Elizabeth Hotel in Montreal. My instincts were correct and on October 31st, 2000 my first film "Marymount Again..." was broadcast before a national audience in Canada on CBC's "Rough Cuts". 

The experience was a refreshing change for me and it began to lead me in new artistic and career directions. By 2002 digital photography was taking over the landscape and I shot my last portfolio series on 35 mm film called "The Lost Vegas Art Project"  later that year before going to the other side.


On Thursday August 14, 2003 I documented the evening of the "Big Blackout" with a night vision camera. The result was an experimental short film I called "Maybe the Big rabbit Did it ?" which was only screened once at the 'New York Independent Film festival' in 2004. Later that year I was one of six people selected as "Canada's most promising filmmakers" to participate in Allan King's ill fated "Documentary Studio". Unfortunately I never got to finish my film "Melody Ranch - The Last Matinée." 

My life would take, what I can only describe as a twist of fate, on February 24'th, 2004 when I answered a phone call from a friend who wanted me to interview her on camera, in a dingy room at the Bay Street Motel in Toronto as she spoke honestly about her life  as a drug addict. "Cracked Not Broken" a real time and unplanned documentary, was screened at the Regent Theatre in Toronto for friends and family on September 12th, 2005. Nine months to the day later it was featured on the 'Oprah Winfrey Show" and was one of four independent films selected to be broadcast as part of HBO"s Award winning "Addiction Series" in 2007.

It was the last film that I have made.

On June 29, 2007 the first generation Apple I-Phone was introduced. Besides causing a revolution in smart phone business, it would prove to be 'the nail in the coffin' for most professional photographers. The Tsunami had reached the shore and it's effects to the business of photography were the same as an actual tsunami ... total devastation.


Every disaster will lead to something..
Which leads to this book project in 2013. Technology continues to change many lives and careers throughout the world at a rapid pace. It continues to eliminate more jobs than creating new ones. 

Book publishing is now experiencing the same radical disruptions that photography and music each went through and is the reason that I decided to independently promote, fund and release this book through Indiegogo. The great aspect of this technological advancement is the relationship it allows between the audience and the artist. This allows for artistic control over the content. The audience can put their money where their preferences lie instead of relying on an institution to make decisions for them. This can can only lead to more interesting work being released.

There are some changes that I made since finishing my first campaign. The most important is that I will only produce physical copies of the book and not release it as an e-Book. There are  a few reasons for this. I still feel that actual books are cooler than electronic books, much as printed photographs are cooler than digital images and record albums are cooler than song files. The tactile quality of each add to the sense of the stories being expressed. I hope you consider each tome a piece of affordable Art that you can add to your library of books stored on your shelves so that the future generations will remember what a book was.

Another change I decided to make was to include everyone's name in the book who help me reach my goal. For as little as $ 1.00 your name will live on for ever inside the pages of my artistic release. That's good bang for your buck !

I also set two very ambitious goals for this final campaign. During the 33 day period of that it runs, I plan to finish writing the book. I have gathered most of the images that I will use as context and I am eventually figuring out the flow from the beginning, to the end of the book. Some of the chapters I plan to pen feature behind the scenes stories from some interesting photo assignments I did with some iconic characters of the 20th century including:  "Shooting Bill Gates" -  "Bill Hicks-The Prince of Darkness." - "My Lunch with George Plimpton." - "St. Nick Nolte" - "The Eye of Storm Thorgerson." - "The Drowning" - "Snake Eyes." - "Lost & Profound" - "The Wizard of Oprah"  and many more.
The second goal is to pre-sell 5,000 copies of the book, which would classify it as a "Canadian Best Seller' without ever being in a bookstore. That would be a cool story! 

The writing aspect I now believe I am getting a handle on. Through lots of bad writing, I believe that I have found my written voice? I guarantee it won't be the most literate voice in writing but it will be original. My photography and film work has appeared in the public eye in various forms since the beginning of my career. Some of these works have been subject to criticism and rarely if ever, in my case, is the voice of the person who created the work ever heard. I have kept my eyes open and mouth shut for a long time ... I now have some things to say.

As with most artists, I could always benefit from any and all help in the promotion, marketing and selling departments. Obviously any contribution is welcome but there are other ways to help as well. Sharing the project. I have always felt that 'word of mouth' is the most credible form of advertising or marketing because people who don't stand to gain personally by promoting something, put their reputations on the line every time they make a recommendation. The technological abilities to do this on social networks like Facebook and Twitter et al, make this a simple process.  The more personal the better. Every time someone clicks on the campaign it helps raise the traction of the project on Indiegogo which in turn helps it get viewed by more people. I am open to bartering also. Maybe you can provide a service that would help me in promoting the project (PR/ leads to radio, newspaper or blogger interviews etc). Perhaps you own an isolated old hotel where I could seclude myself and go mad pounding out a masterpiece like Jack Nicholson in 'The Shining" ?

Speaking about personal. I plan to take the campaign out onto the streets of Toronto during the campaign to perform some impromptu readings of "The Gates" accompanied by the original framed print. If it worked for the Queen of Amanda Palmer it can't do any harm and a great way to connect with new people. If you haven't seen her Ted Talk it is an inspired 10 minutes.

In the same vein, I would also be interested in doing some lunchtime readings followed by a Q & A period at your companies office about how creativity combined with technology can create positive changes in the workplace. Ideal for companies in the creative fields. Essential for companies that are not.


I have participated in a couple of crowd sourcing projects in the past and I really enjoyed following the process of the making of  the work as it gave me a greater appreciation and understanding of it when I received the final product upon completion.

In conclusion. I hope that my story and this book serves a few purposes. First and foremost I hope it is an entertaining read at the very least and that it gives the reader a sense of what it was like to have worked as a photographer in the pre through to the  post digital era. If it educates or inspires one people in some way towards knowledge or to tell their own stories then I will have done something worthwhile.

Everybody has a story underneath it all...

I sincerely thank you for taking the time to look at this project. Take some time to peruse some of the other projects on this site, there is fascinating stuff going on. 

Hunter S. Perrier

I welcome any feedback or suggestions ... let's do this.

story:
... sometimes the Abyss gazes back!


Seasons of the Abyss is a one year art subscription featuring illustrations and design from Ennie and Origins Award winning artist, Aaron Acevedo.


Theme


The theme for this series is seasons, but with a dark fantasy or horror twist. Each season gets three illustrations, for a total of twelve, one for each month of 2012. If you subscribe, you may see dark faeries at a springtime festival, zombies at the beach, or the Ice Queen's winter palace. Maybe all three. There's even a perk for you to chose the subject matter!


Goal


Every $50 in pledges unlocks a new illustration, up to twelve at the $600 goal.The funding pays printing and shipping costs, with any additional funds going to the artist for the time invested in creating the artwork. If you live outside the United States, please add an additional $5 to your pledge for extra shipping expenses.


This is a limited edition series, no more than 500 of these illustrations will be printed. That covers all the contributor perks and leaves 85 prints for conventions.


Bio
Aaron is a full-time artist, author, and game designer living in New York. He is most widely known for his work in the Adventure Games industry. 

Aaron has worked on A Song of Ice & Fire, Babylon 5, Call of Cthulhu, Deadlands, Dungeons & Dragons, Legend of the Five Rings, Solomon Kane, Suzerain, Warlord, Wheel of Time, and World of Darkness properties, among others, and produces art and design for bands, comics, dvds, films, games, and concept work

.



For more information, visit aaronace.com


NEW PERK! I'm excited to announce that John Wick (author of L5R, Houses of the Blooded, and Curse of the Yellow Sign) is going to write a story for each of the prints in the series if we hit our funding goal!  I'm a big fan of John's work and think his style is a perfect fit for the illustrations I have planned for the series.


NEW PERK! If we reach our goal, all contributors of $10 or more receive a digital 2013 calendar of the entire set. All contributors of $40 or more receive a physical calendar as well.

story:
Performing Arts Studio and Creative Space, located in the heart of the Gong. 

 

Singing. Drama. 
Events. Shows!
Consultation, Direction, 
Management, Music Instruction, Band, Media & More! 

We want to expand and offer heaps of classes and programs but need funding to bring in TEACHERS!!!

 

Also to build, expand, grow, invest in local talent, nuture the community, provide creative services, ETC...

 

 

Help us create a home for you.

 

x

 

Chaplin Arts
story_txt:
Performing Arts Studio and Creative Space, located in the heart of the Gong. 

 
Singing. Drama. Events. Shows!Consultation, Direction, Management, Music Instruction, Band, Media & More! 

We want to expand and offer heaps of classes and programs but need funding to bring in TEACHERS!!!
 
Also to build, expand, grow, invest in local talent, nuture the community, provide creative services, ETC...
 
 
Help us create a home for you.
 
x
 
Chaplin Arts

story:
WHAT IS CREATION WORLD?

It is a website where each creator can display his creation of any category (movie, music, video game, book, photograph, etc.), create a portfolio, participate in monthly contests with cash prizes, in which (contests) will vote and annotate the Voters who will earn money with each vote and comment of them. There are two types of Users: the Creators and the Voters.

WHAT IS A CREATOR?

Every person over the age of 18 who personally or with the assistance of other persons has completed a creation (movie, music, book, etc.), which must be a new independent creation not advertised, published, sold, hired, given in use in any third person.

WHAT IS A VOTER?

Every person over the age of 18 who has the ability to vote and annotate on independent creations of Creators.


HOW MUCH THE SUBSCRIPTION;

A) FOR THE CREATORS:

- For the first 2 creations the participation in a contest is free!

- For participation in a contest with 1 creation: ($ 30 -50% =) 15$

-For participation in contests with 2 creations: ($ 55 -50% =) 27$

-For participation in contests with 3 creations: ($ 80 - 50% =) 40$

-For participation in the contests with 4 creations: ($ 100 - 50% =) 50$

-For participation in the contests with 5 creations: ($ 115 - 50% =) 57$


Β) FOR THE VOTERS:

- Simple member: registration without payment and starts from the 1st Level.

- Bronze member: registration and payment of 30 dollars every 3 months and starts from 3rd level.

- Bronze member: registration and payment of 60 dollars every 3 months and starts from 6th level.

- Golden member: registration and payment of 100 dollars every 3 months and starts from 10th level.

WHAT ARE LEVELS?

These are levels that can earn both the Creators and the Voters depending on their participation in this website and which provide them with greater economic and not only advantages (see: levels).


WHAT ARE THE CONTESTS?

Each month will occur contests in various categories of creations which will last 1 month and will provide cash prizes to Creators depending on the position in which they finish in the final standings. These contests will be announced on the website and with their launch will be announced the cash prizes that will take contestants. In these competitions will vote and annotate the Voters who will earn money depending on the number of votes and comments. The amount of money that will be given to the Voters will be posted with the start of the competition and this amount will be reduced daily depending on the number of votes and comments.

WHEN THE CREATORS AND THE VOTERS ARE PAID?

The Creators who won the contest are paid directly with the completion of this contest. Voters are paid when they reach the minimun amount of cashout (1 dollar), depending on the number of their votes and comments, their Level and the categories that they voted in the contest.

story:
Short Summary

Kampala is a wonderful green creative city, full of young talented artists, however there is a severe lack of urban art initiatives where young talent can showcase their work while at the same time art becomes freely accessible to the public. Public street art gives a voice to the voiceless and can create room for discussion in a country where many issues remain unresolved. 
The National Street Gallery project will be an annual event and consists of two activities. The first part is a five-day event at the Uganda National Culture Centre, where, inspired by a yearly theme based on cultural and political issues, national and international artists work together to create large murals and installations which will result in a year round Public Art Gallery, open to the Kampala community. The second component is a Mobile Arts Project, where artists from different regions visit remote communities to develop art with the people to voice their needs and struggles, which can then form inspiration for next year's theme. 

The National Street Art Gallery Project 

In the National Street Art Gallery Project artists from different regions in Uganda work together with both national and international volunteers, including artists, art lovers and activists and communities to create artworks that advocate directly for cultural and social change - think of issues such as Aids/HIV, corruption, landgrabbing and discrimination of minorities. 

The strength of the project lies within the fact that the art themes are inspired by the community for the community. Where the artist functions as a messenger of the issues, giving his (or her) visual interpretation of the issue theme chosen. This approach will inspire understanding and mutual respect between the artist and the community.

At the National Street Gallery public launching event large walls will be constructed for mural painters, street artists and installation artists to create the art works. These artists will be invited from all over the world on an annual theme to paint and repaint art works together with Ugandan visual artists, art students and the audience.

The ongoing Open Call for artists to participate in the first NSG launching event has already reached 120 artists both locally and internationally. The NSG shall reach over 2 million people since the event will be open to the public from the second day to witness artists producing their works, it is free of entry and will recur annually. 

What We Need 

National Street Gallery is a non-profit  project, we are full-time artists without  any fixed monthly salary trying to create a legacy of the 1st Street Art Space in East Africa, but the question is: 

Are we able to provide the materials and host the artists who are creating works for betterment of the Ugandan Communities?

With our collaboration with the Uganda National Cultural Centre we have already secured our outdoor space location, and we have local sponsors who will make the launch and reception a success. However we are still short on the essential materials to make this project happen. Therefore we are using this campaign to raise US$ 2,400,- to cover the following costs:

  • The Gallery walls construction; namely wood to construct the large walls on which the murals will be painted. The majority of the money will be used for this one-time expense, the walls will be reused and repainted on a yearly basis according to the different themes. We choose durable, sustainable materials so the walls can last for many years in the outdoor space.
  • Art supplies and construction material for the creation of the art pieces; the paintings on the walls and installation pieces.

What You Get

Donating to our cause will help us and the Ugandan communities by giving them a voice as well as creating mutual understanding and respect for artists. Have a look at our perks and donate what you can, apart from the perk you receive, we will be immensely grateful!


The Impact

The first NSG event is set to take place at the Uganda National Culture Centre outdoor space in Kampala next March 11th to 15th, 2015. As this will be the first year running the theme will be slightly more general: 'This is Uganda' . 

The NSG event will include:  

  • Outdoors gallery canvas wall construction with live mural creation by street artists, both local and international, advocating for a positive change in Ugandan communities through the work. 
  • Guest artists’ exhibitions.
  • Opportunities for artists to meet, network and introduce their work to a larger audience. 
  • Create opportunities for artists and art lovers alike to meet and network to encourage new partnerships and create a better understanding and appreciation for the artists.
  •  NSG permanent activists, volunteer and friends membership registration.  
  •  Live music performances by DJs, real Hip Hop artists and acoustic performers.  

About the Organiser

I am Kabati Ayub, however I’m mostly known as Destreet, a curator and community-based artist in Kampala, Uganda. My art is inspired by daily life in my country such as the beautiful nature and cultural history of Uganda. I create pieces demonstrating stories which are easy to interpret. My artistic perspective has led me to work with different art forms, such as printmaking, screen design, graphics, photography, and video work. I also enjoy sculpture, painting and most recently installation. For the past seven years I’ve been running my own foundation, Destreet Art Foundation (http://destreetart.webs.com/) which gives children and youth growing up in Kampala's slums opportunities to learn and expres themselves through art. 

After having toured through Europe a few times, I realised even more how important public art is as form of communication for societies' needs and issues. So upon my return I realised not only that Uganda needs more space for  young artists to grow and express themselves, but to share and interact through public visual arts projects also. This is how the "National Street Gallery" was born.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, don't worry there are other ways you can support us:

  • Share our cause, via Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/pages/National-Street-Gallery-Uganda/1519956324894271), Twitter or simply old fashioned and tell people about us over (Christmas) dinner and maybe pick up some coins that way.
  • If you are in Uganda and have some extra time, we can always use volunteers.
  • If you are a writer, journalist, blogger, please mention us and spread the news.
  • Or be creative too and write a song about us and busk it out on the streets!

story:
Summary

Imagine walking into a gallery and being immersed in a soundscape that interweaves the voice of nature with traditional Hawaiian chant and song. Combined with storytelling, the voice leads you on a journey along the path of Kuku-'ena-i-ke-ahi-ho'omau-honua (Beating Hot in the Perpetual Earth Fire). Kuku`ena, goddess of lei makers, sister of Pele, and guide to those lost in the forest.

With this multimedia art exhibit, to be held at the Hawai`i Museum of Contemporary Art in Hilo, I hope to use my art to illuminate the story of Kuku`ena, the lei-making guide to the lost, and to fund the Hilo Lei Day Festival, a community event that celebrates the culture and heritage of the lei. My husband, Manu, and I have been the primary funders for this event for 10 years, and  request your help in continuing the festival.

The show will incorporate permanent and ephemeral art, static and kinetic art, visual art and performing art. I work in steel and copper, and I work in fabric and paper. I paint, I weld, and I dance. but ultimately, I am a storyteller, and my storytelling informs all of my art.

In this show, "Beating Hot," I seek to tell the story of Kuku`ena: Her voyage with Pele across the vast Pacific, her arrival in a new land, her gift of the plants and art of the lei.

I hope to bring the viewer with me on a journey through a landscape of cultural metaphor of the lei. I want to give our island residents and visitors a place to reconnect with the forest, with nature, with the cultural concepts derived from nature that make us, as Hawaiians, who we are.

The exhibit is being held in conjunction with the Hilo Lei Day Festival, which is being re-visioned to be the showcase for a sustainable environmentally responsible interwoven program of education in arts, the environment, social responsibility, and fiscal responsibility.

Aloha! I am Leilehua Yuen, artist, author, and educator. Some 25 years ago, I coined the term "edutainment" for what I do. . . teach Hawaiian culture and environmental sustainability through traditional cultural arts, including hula and storytelling.

It sure sounds boring when written out for a grant, but in practice, the audience, my husband (who is my performance partner), and I go on a magical romp through geology, ecology, anthropology, ethnology, musicology, the occasional apology, and Hawaiian history and culture.

I've spent much of the last quarter century taking educational performing and visual arts programs "on the road" for a variety of clients. For seven years, my husband and I performed weekly at the historic Hilo Palace Theater, sharing the culture and history of Hawai`i nei. And over the past 30 years, I've done the occasional art show. My husband, Manu Josiah, and I have worked with internationally renowned producer Tatiana Issa and and photographer Paula Lobo on Mundo Em Movimento - Dances of the World.

This May 2015, I want to bring it all together in a composition of sculpture, painting, dance, music, stasis, kinesis, all exploring Hawaiian cultural concepts of the geology and ecology of Hawai`i, and how they interact with Hawaiian cultural constructs, through the metaphor of the lei.


Time and Place

I hope to hold the show the at the Hawai`i Museum of Contemporary Arts, opening on Friday, May 1, with a preview the evening of April 30. All proceeds from the preview tickets will go directly to the museum, and 50% of the proceeds from my show will go to the museum.

What the Show Needs

Cash - $60,000

Wow! That's a LOT of money! Well, 50% off the top will go to the Hawai`i Museum of Contemporary Arts.

Materials and replacing some of my aging equipment will take another big chunk of money. To put on this show, in addition to the scrap metal, plywood, paint, and other assorted goodies I've collected so far, I will need more paint, wood glue, fabric, water color paper as well as canvas, plus (and here is where it gets expensive) I need wood and metal chisels, garnet paper, instrument quality varnish, steel, copper, brazing rods, flux, oxygen, acetylene, and a new torch handle. A new TIG welder would be nice, too.

And finally, I need to malama everyone who helps, including myself.

In Kind Donations

If you have any of these items gathering dust, I can use them:

  • Artist's Oil Paints
  • Color Crayons
  • Scrap copper (gutter, plumbing, etc)
  • Embroidery Floss
  • Cut Glass / Crystal vases, candy dishes, etc. (Not all are suitable, I would need to see them)
  • Art Canvas
  • Stained Glass goodies (lead, cutters, glass, etc.)
  • Woodworking Tools

What You Get

First, you'll get the wonderful warm-fuzzy of knowing you have helped to promote and perpetuate traditional and contemporary Hawaiian culture and arts. Second, there's the art itself. Third, assorted other goodies.

How the Perks Work

Donation Perks

I have some nice perks as a mahalo for your donation. These will be sent out as soon as the campaign closes (some even before!). They range from music CDs to artwork. Many of these will be available in time for Christmas giving!

Sponsorship Perks

You can sponsor specific works of art. Once the show closes, they are yours to take home. You may come pick them up at the Museum, or I can arrange for shipping. You will be responsible for the cost of shipping, but I will do everything I can to keep the cost down. The sponsored works will ship during the two weeks after the show closes.

Other Ways You Can Help

I also need help in other areas

  • Help me get the word out - let your friends know about the show, and encourage them to donate or sponsor a work.
  • Help sell preview tickets.
  • Be a docent at the show.
  • Think of stuff I've missed and let me know!

story:
Dear Friends of the Arts, 

If you’ve visited the Petaluma Arts Center over the last several years, you’ve probably met our dedicated volunteer, Judy Oster, sitting at the front desk.  Judy has always been there for the Petaluma Arts Center, especially in supporting arts education programs for children who might not otherwise be able to afford art classes. Now, we want to be there for Judy.

Judy Oster has been dealing with cancer. At her request we would like to establish the Judy Oster Scholarship Fund. It is important to Judy that all children have the opportunity to be exposed to the arts now and in the future.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $10,000 for The Judy Oster  Scholarship Fund by October 4th, 2012. We know this is not very much time to complete such a lofty goal but time is of the essence.  $10,000 supports 66 children for one session of afterschool art classes or one week of summer art camp. 

With Judy's Fund the Petaluma Arts Center will be able to establish a scholarship  program in conjuction with local service agencies and schools to provide classes, and transportation to children who might not otherwise have access to our afterschool, summer and weekend art programs.

Your tax deductible donation of any amount will help make Judy’s wishes come true. In the past Judy herself has donated several thousand dollars to this fund. With your help this year and in future years we will be able to continue to offer art education scholarships at the Arts Center. 

Our Mission:

Our mission is to promote awareness, appreciation and expression of the
cultural arts for Petaluma and Southern Sonoma County.

How We Serve the Community:  

In the last twenty years the Petaluma community has grown culturally and economically to become a hub for southern Sonoma and northern Marin Counties.  Residents have long recognized the need for a community arts center.  Since opening its 4,500 sq. ft. facility in the fall of 2008, the Petaluma Arts Center has established itself as a venue where people of all ages and diversity meet and experience the arts through educational and cultural opportunities.

The Petaluma Arts Center offers:  Visual Art Exhibitions of high quality provide a platform for individual self expression and a public venue for the visual arts. The Education Program Children, teens and adults create works of art and   develop their artistic abilities, and where appropriate, to further their artistic careers. Artist and Art Resource Listing Service is provided on our website for artists and art patrons. Celebrations such as El Día de los Muertos help Petaluma build bridges among the many cultures in our community. Arts Advocacy by the Petaluma Arts Council since 1998 has resulted in the City of  Petaluma’s Art & Cultural Component of the Petaluma General Plan.  This Component established the Public Art Ordinance which places sculpture in public places and recognizes art and culture as necessities for quality of life,

Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

You can spread the word and make some noise about Judy's Fund by forwarding this campagn through the Indiegogo share tools!

With much appreciation, 

Virginia May, the staff and Board of Directors of Petaluma Arts Center

 

The Petaluma Arts Center is a private, non-profit organization putting Art in the Heart of our Community. We offer high quality exhibitions; art classes and workshops for kids, teens and adults; lectures, performances, cultural events and more. Visit our sculpture garden located on the lawn in front of our renovated historic railroad building at 230Lakeville St

The Center is open Thursday through Monday, 12 to 4 pm, closed on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and most national holidays.   For information, call 707.762.5600 or see www.petalumaartscenter.org.
story_txt:
Dear Friends of the Arts, 
If you’ve visited the Petaluma Arts Center over the last several years, you’ve probably met our dedicated volunteer, Judy Oster, sitting at the front desk.  Judy has always been there for the Petaluma Arts Center, especially in supporting arts education programs for children who might not otherwise be able to afford art classes. Now, we want to be there for Judy.
Judy Oster has been dealing with cancer. At her request we would like to establish the Judy Oster Scholarship Fund. It is important to Judy that all children have the opportunity to be exposed to the arts now and in the future.  


What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is to raise $10,000 for The Judy Oster  Scholarship Fund by October 4th, 2012. We know this is not very much time to complete such a lofty goal but time is of the essence.  $10,000 supports 66 children for one session of afterschool art classes or one week of summer art camp. 
With Judy's Fund the Petaluma Arts Center will be able to establish a scholarship  program in conjuction with local service agencies and schools to provide classes, and transportation to children who might not otherwise have access to our afterschool, summer and weekend art programs.
Your tax deductible donation of any amount will help make Judy’s wishes come true. In the past Judy herself has donated several thousand dollars to this fund. With your help this year and in future years we will be able to continue to offer art education scholarships at the Arts Center. 
Our Mission:


Our mission is to promote awareness, appreciation and expression of thecultural arts for Petaluma and Southern Sonoma County.
How We Serve the Community:  
In the last twenty years the Petaluma community has grown culturally and economically to become a hub for southern Sonoma and northern Marin Counties.  Residents have long recognized the need for a community arts center.  Since opening its 4,500 sq. ft. facility in the fall of 2008, the Petaluma Arts Center has established itself as a venue where people of all ages and diversity meet and experience the arts through educational and cultural opportunities.
The Petaluma Arts Center offers:  Visual Art Exhibitions of high quality provide a platform for individual self expression and a public venue for the visual arts. The Education Program Children, teens and adults create works of art and   develop their artistic abilities, and where appropriate, to further their artistic careers. Artist and Art Resource Listing Service is provided on our website for artists and art patrons. Celebrations such as El Día de los Muertos help Petaluma build bridges among the many cultures in our community. Arts Advocacy by the Petaluma Arts Council since 1998 has resulted in the City of  Petaluma’s Art & Cultural Component of the Petaluma General Plan.  This Component established the Public Art Ordinance which places sculpture in public places and recognizes art and culture as necessities for quality of life,
Other Ways You Can Help:


Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
You can spread the word and make some noise about Judy's Fund by forwarding this campagn through the Indiegogo share tools!

With much appreciation, 
Virginia May, the staff and Board of Directors of Petaluma Arts Center
 
The Petaluma Arts Center is a private, non-profit organization putting Art in the Heart of our Community. We offer high quality exhibitions; art classes and workshops for kids, teens and adults; lectures, performances, cultural events and more. Visit our sculpture garden located on the lawn in front of our renovated historic railroad building at 230Lakeville St
The Center is open Thursday through Monday, 12 to 4 pm, closed on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and most national holidays.   For information, call 707.762.5600 or see www.petalumaartscenter.org.

story:
Short Summary

Hello!  My name is Beth and I am a graduate of the Pacific Northwest College of Art, Portland, OR, with a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in Sculpture.  In the three years since graduating, I have been creating works of art through drawing and painting.  All the while, I have been craving sculpture.  Up until a few months ago I lived in apartments and houses where the only option for a creative outlet was two dimensional works.  I am currently renting a house with a shed that I want to turn into a sculpture studio.  

 

My dream is to have a career sculpting wood.  Half of this would entail carving abstract figures from tree trunks and large branches.  The two images I chose for this campaign are examples and were part of my Thesis project for my degree.  The other half of my dream career would be creating furniture (chairs and benches to start) out of tree branches.  I would take the bark off and sand the branches smooth, then piece the furniture together and sand a comfortable seat into it.

 

The $1600 I am asking for will go towards fixing up my shed and buying the power tools I need to start sculpting.

$168 - 12 sheets of 4'X8' plywood to board up the shed (it currently has exposed insulation and my landlord does not want to pay for it, but has said I can do whatever I want to it)

$30 - two overhead fluorescent lights

$10 - nails for the plywood

$40 - two gallons of white primer paint to seal the plywood and help the light reflect

$700 - 60 gallon/120v air compressor

$130 - angle grinder and wood carving wheel

$50 - pneumatic sander

$125 - extended die grinder

$60 - shop vac

$287 - indiegogo fees, possible underestimation of costs, odds and ends

 

What do you get for supporting me, besides the good feeling of helping a sculptress with her dream?  Art!!  I will make a print of one of my drawings and send it to you.  The more you give the larger the print will be, up to a poster sized 2'X3' print.  Go to http://www.zhibit.org/bethnix and take your pick!  And, even better, if you give at the $500 level you will get a wood sculpture custom made just for you!

And if you can't help with any funding, share my cause!  Links to my Facebook page, website and First Thursday Art Sale (Portland, OR) are below.  The more people that know about this the better chance I will have of reaching my goal.  And if I don't reach my goal, I will at least be going in the right direction!

 

THANK YOU for anything and everything you can do to help me reach my goal and start my dream!  Love and light to you and yours,

Beth

story:
New Orleans needs public chess tables.

We need them because they're fun. We need them because they'll be beautiful. We need them because they allow people to interact who normally couldn't. We need them because our kids are desperately lacking positive recreational options. We need them because they encourage thought, play, and most of all, nonviolence.

Chess gets people together!

We want to make ART tables.

We will work with local artists and artist organizations to design and build the tables. The artists must create functional, durable chess tables. Within that framework, they will have the freedom to manifest their inspiration. We hope each table will be uniquely suited to its location in whichever park, neutral ground, sidewalk, or other public space will be its home.

Stunning tables will attract & inspire players.

Chess builds community and creates space for engagement between diverse groups. It accomplishes this even in an uninspired environment because a love of chess bridges what usually divides us. Simply put, all different types of people love to play.

Given that, imagine how effective stunning tables will be! Combining mixed media sculpture, photography, and poetry with functional chess tables will double the allure. Some will come for the art and stay for the chess. Others will do the opposite.

People of all ages, races, genders, and class play chess. Chess bridges the differences that usually divide us.

Chess strengthens communities.

Because the tables will be placed strategically around the city, diverse populations will be able to enjoy them. Through the combined experience of art and chess, neighbors will have the opportunity for meaningful dialogue. Because the infrastructure for smart play will be in place, children will have alternative options to violence. 

We need your help.

We aim to build a minimum of 10 tables in strategically selected public spaces around the city. We will pay the artists a living wage for their work, and so we estimate the tables will cost an average of $1,000 each to design, build, install, and maintain.

Please donate what you can to make this project a reality. Every donation counts, so even if you can't give much, please show your support! And if you have money to spare, consider donating generously. We believe this is truly a good cause.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Chess in New Orleans

Few know that New Orleans native Paul Morphy is considered by the greats to be the best who ever played the game.

Chess prodigy Paul Morphy grew up in the building that now houses Brennan's Restaurant.

Yet despite the city's rich tradition of great chess play, we currently have only a couple of public spaces that incorporate chess. One stroll through New York’s Washington Square or Washington D.C.’s Dupont Circle or any other park where chess is integrated into the environment shows the camaraderie and intrigue that chess tables can create.  

We will fill this void of chess infrastructure in New Orleans by commissioning community artists to build chess tables in inner-city public spaces. We aim to link the City's rich artistic tradition with its strong heritage of chess.

Kids love chess!

Our children need chess.

In addition to community engagement, the availability of free and open chess tables enhances our parks and provides our children with the opportunity to cultivate a love for chess and to experience cross-cultural relationships. We hope that these experiences will naturally lead to less violence and more tolerance in the upcoming generation.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

About us

Chess Communité is a group of chess enthusiasts with varying levels of skill and obsession. We all love the game, and we're all willing to donate our time to help this project succeed!

story:
Site : www.manonrenier.com

 

  • Qui suis je ? 

Manon Rénier, 21 ans, Etudiante à l'école ETPA de toulouse dans la section Photographie.

  • Que m'a apporté cette école au jour d'aujourd'hui ?

Mon travail tout au long de ces deux premières années d'étude au sein de l'école ETPA de Toulouse m'ont permis d’obtenir le diplôme de praticien photographe et de finir major de ma promo. Ce fut vraiment un plaisir et un honneur pour moi. Cette reconnaissance venait couronner le bonheur que j’avais pris à m’investir dans mes projets photographiques. 

  • Pourquoi faire appel à vous ? 

Si aujourd'hui je viens vers vous c'est pour que cette aventure professionnelle continue et pour que mes efforts et mon travail se concrétisent au cours de la troisième année d’étude à l’ETPA. Je suis l’une des étudiantes à qui les professeurs ont proposé de continuer la formation. Encore un honneur pour moi car les nombre de place est limité et les possibilités qu’ouvre cette expérience supplémentaire sont immenses. Cette troisième année me permettrait de voir aboutir des travaux personnels commencés l'an passé. Je pourrais emprunter tout le matériel nécessaire à la réalisation des projets, accéder à des studios professionnels, au labo… J’aurais aussi la possibilité de tirer les images et je bénéficierais encore un peu plus du suivi et les conseils du photographe professionnel Pierre Barbot. Les étudiants qui feront partie du groupe pourront rencontrer différents intervenants de grande renommée, comme Jan-Evelyn Atwood, qui se déplaceront à l'école pour plusieurs jours et y présenteront leurs travaux et leurs démarches.

  • Que m'apportera de plus cette dernière année d'étude ?

Si j’ai la chance de pouvoir suivre cette année de formation complémentaire, je voudrais affirmer un peu plus encore ma personnalité dans la photographie et acquérir l’expérience qui est plus que nécessaire aujourd’hui pour acquérir une légitimité dans le milieu de la photo et pouvoir trouver un travail à la sortie de l’école.

La troisième année d’étude se clôt sur la remise des Grands Prix. Les images produites par les jeunes photographes sont alors envoyées à Paris et jugées par un jury de grands photographes. Plusieurs prix viennent encourager et récompenser les projets les plus prometteurs. Ces photos sont ensuite exposées à Toulouse à l’occasion d’une belle soirée de fin d’études. C’est l’occasion pour les étudiants de recevoir le diplôme de Licence en Photographie reconnu par l'État.

 


 

C’est pour pouvoir vivre tous ces moments que je m’adresse à vous. Je vous propose ainsi à la vente quelques unes de mes images sous forme de tirages papier, toiles ou encore shooting personalisé. Tous les tirages sont en édition limitées et seront numérotés de 1 à 10. Cette vente me permettrait ainsi de m'aider à financer cette troisième et dernière année d'étude. Vous seriez mes complices et je me ferais un plaisir de vous remercier avec ce que je sais faire de mieux : mes photos ! Vous pouvez en découvrir un aperçu dans la gallerie mais également sur mon site qui, je l’espère, se verra bientôt enrichi par mes nouveaux travaux.

www.manonrenier.com

 

Je vous remercie par avance et espère pouvoir vous raconter la suite des mes aventures photographiques très bientôt…

www.manonrenier.com

story:
Greetings Old Friends and Interested Newcomers! 


Since 1993, artists and audiences have assembled to participate in Barebones Production’s Halloween Show. To celebrate twenty beautiful years, we are raising funds to make this year a stunning show to remember- bringing back artists from year’s past, paying more artists to help bu­­­ild and perform, and offering stellar hospitality to our crew of over 300 volunteers. 

What is Barebones? We gather to honor the dead, celebrate the season, and dance with the boogey man. We reclaim the holiday of Halloween from what’s available: fear mongering horror movies and the endless parade of candy and hallmark cards. We are looking deeper into the traditions that formed Halloween, drawing our vision from harvest celebrations, myths and stories about the thinning veil of the season, community death rituals and celebrations.

To help us celebrate twenty amazing  years, we are running an Indiegogo campaign to raise funds to make this year a stunning show and to support the longevity of Barebones. 

Your contribution to this campaign will help complete the budget for this year’s extra special show. We’re bringing back artists from year’s past and hiring more artists to help build and perform, and offering stellar hospitality to our massive volunteer crew. Your contribution will also help ensure that audience revenue from this years show will go toward the future of Barebones.

This event started with about a dozen performers and maybe 50 audience members. We have now grown into 300 person cast and crew and an audience of thousands (6,500 total over five nights of shows).  Our spectacles highlight giant puppets, stilting, bicycles, masked drama, aerialism, fire and music.

As our founding artists age and as members of our own community pass away we realize more than ever how the community needs this event  - and so do we. 

How we create this outdoor spectacle is pretty fantabulous:

The Halloween process starts in August with some community brainstorming – EVERYONE is welcome! A smaller group of designers and directors craft a story board. In September we start building. Seasoned artists alongside first timers work side by side, inventing anything and everything that gets used in the show!  Canoes turned into instruments, giant owls, crows, and skeletons,  puppet arms large enough to embrace a whole audience, inflatable works of art… All created from recycled materials and peoples imaginations.

We rehearse these humble creations, choreograph dances, and compose music to these wild ideas. We let them inhabit our world of the living thru their performance.

To see the sheer will of a group of people create an event into the world is stunning. The collaboration of many hands together making art – changing the tide of alone-ness and apathy is beautiful. 300 people come together as cast, musicians, and crew to make it happen. 80% of them are volunteering! 

Your donations will help complete our budget to make it an extraordinary year. Every penny will help us in our goals:

  • Super hospitality:  food and hot soup for our many volunteers!

  • Returning artists:  travel costs to artists who have participated over the last twenty years (in most cases volunteering)

  • 100% of this years show-time donations funding the continuation of Barebones and the 21st Halloween Show. 

Have no money but want to contribute?

We need help: building puppets, ushering, personing the merchandise tent for the show, and much more. Visit our website www.barebonespuppets.com for more information about volunteer opportunities. You can also donate unused Air Miles to support past returning artists. Please email: barebonesadmn@gmail.com

Thank you so much for giving whatever you can to help this tradition continue.

Hope to see you at the show!

story:
New Hermetics Tarot Deck

Although an author of more than 18 books, Jason Augustus Newcomb is best known for his 2004 landmark title, The New Hermetics, in which he strips down the rituals of the old world and empowers each individual to create his or her own path. This tarot set is an outgrowth of both his book and the New Hermetics system. Each card is from an original painting, created during the writing & publication of his book. This is the first time they will have been published as a deck. But, you need not be familiar with Jason's book, The New Hermetics, in order to benefit from this insightful and symbolic tarot set!

Descriptions of the various items in the Perks are as follows:

TRUMP CARD

We are offering 5 larger, 3.5" x 5.5" copies of each of the 22 Trumps from the New Hermetics Tarot set. Claiming these cards will happen on a first-come, first-serve basis. Once all FIVE copies of a specific Trump card have been claimed, we will no longer offer it, as long as the other Trumps are still available; however, if all 5 sets of trumps sell out quickly, we will print additional sets, 5 at a time, to accommodate those that may want a single card or who may have missed being able to claim a set. These larger cards, with a different back than the regular set, are intended to be a focal point on your altar or as a meditation aide. Perhaps you've always felt an unspoken connection with a specific tarot trump and consider it as a kind of personal totem. This would be for you.

BOOK

Jason has penned a new companion book on the Tarot, entitled Examining the New Hermetics Tarot, but more specifically discussing this particular deck and why he made the decisions he did when choosing what symbology to include on each card. This will be a limited edition, smaller paperback book, signed by the author, with an estimated pressrun of 250.

SMALL DECK

Only available through this campaign, we are offering a limited pressrun of a smaller, travel-size version of the New Hermetics Tarot deck. This smaller deck measures in at 2.25” x 3.5”. This is a 78 card deck and though limited to an estimated 100 copies, it will not be numbered or signed.

REGULAR DECK

This is really what this campaign is about. We want to create an unlimited edition of a regular, 2.75” x 4.75” New Hermetics Tarot deck, to be commercially available. We are starting off by offering a signed & numbered, first pressrun of that deck. This will be an 80 card deck (one of those extra cards will be numbered & signed). After the approx. 200 signed & numbered copies are gone, this deck will remain commercially available (with a different design on the rear) but not signed & numbered.


TATTWA CARDS

A set of 25 meditative, color-scale cards, divided among the 5 elements, Tattwa Cards were traditionally employed by the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn to aid students in astral clairvoyance. An affordable commercial set of these cards have not been available on the market for many years, with used copies of John Mumford’s set selling for well over $100 on places like Amazon or eBay. Our complimentary set of these cards, included as a “Thank You” for your level of support at $100 or more, measures 3.5” x 3.5” square and will surely find a welcome and familiar home in your temple!


Descriptions of the various Perks are as follows:

01) Pick a Card, Any Card    $10

Your support at this level, gets you the choice of ONE of the 22 Trump designs from the New Hermetics Tarot, printed as a beautiful 3.5" x 5.5" card, with a different back than the standard deck, suitable for meditation or display on your altar. We are starting with only 5 copies of each card available, so it's first-come, first-serve to reserve a Trump. For example, if you’re interested in the LOVERS card but 5 other people have already chosen that card (either in this or other perks), you'll have to pick a different Trump, instead. So act fast to get your favorite!

02) Double Down  $15

Your support at this level, gets you the choice of TWO of the 22 Trump designs from the New Hermetics Tarot, printed as a beautiful 3.5" x 5.5" card, with a different back than the standard deck, suitable for framing or display on your altar. We are starting with only 5 copies of each card available, so it's first-come, first-serve to reserve a Trump. For example, if you’re interested in the TOWER card but 5 other people have already chosen that card (either in this or other perks), you'll have to pick a different Trump, instead. So act fast to get your favorite!

03) Book Smart  $20

With this perk you’ll receive a signed copy of a newly penned book from author Jason Augustus Newcomb, Examining the New Hermetics Tarot, describing specifically the symbology and intent behind his own personal Tarot deck. This book will receive a limited pressrun of approximately 250 copies, and this may be your only chance to purchase a one.

04) Small Deck  $25

This perk gives the supporter a smaller version of our main project. You’ll receive a full 78 card New Hermetics Tarot deck in the smaller, travel size of 2.25” x 3.5”. This smaller deck will only be available through this campaign, with approx. 100 unsigned, unnumbered decks currently being planned.

05) Small Deck & Card    $30

This perks offers the supporter one of our limited-edition smaller decks, along with ONE of the 3.5” x 5.5” Trumps of their choice.

06) Large New Hermetics Tarot Deck  $35

This is why we are all here. Supporting this project at this level will reward you with a copy of the 80 card, signed & numbered, regular sized (2.75” x 4.75”) edition of the New Hermetics Tarot. By supporting at this level, not only will you be receiving this Tarot deck for less than retail but you won’t need to worry about those pesky s&h charges that you’d likely be stuck paying if you wait a few months to buy it. Although this deck will be available after the campaign, this will be your only opportunity to purchase one of the limited, numbered & signed sets. The exact number of these will be determined by the demand; however, we are anticipating printing approx. 200 of these signed & numbered sets.

07) Small Deck & Book  $40

This perk offers a copy of the smaller, travel-size New Hermetics Tarot deck along with a copy of the book. Remember, the smaller deck is NOT numbered and signed.

08) Small Deck, Book & Card  $45

This perk offers a copy of the smaller, travel-size New Hermetics Tarot deck along with a copy of the book and your choice of ONE of the 3.5” x 5.5” Trump cards. Remember, the smaller deck is NOT numbered and signed.

09) Small BFF Tarot Set  $45

Would you prefer to pick up TWO copies of the smaller, travel-size New Hermetics Tarot deck for you and a friend? This perk is perfect for you!

10) Large Deck & Book  $50

With this perk, you’ll receive a copy of the regular-sized, signed & numbered New Hermetics Tarot along with Jason’s new book, Examining the New Hermetics Tarot.

11) One & Another    $55

Can’t decide on the small or large Tarot deck? This perk gets you one copy each of the smaller, travel-sized AND larger, regular-sized New Hermetics Tarot deck. That’s 2 decks at a greatly reduced price! Remember, only the larger deck is signed & numbered.

12) Large & Small & one Card  $60

This perk gets you one copy each of the smaller, travel-sized AND larger, regular-sized New Hermetics Tarot deck, as well as your choice of ONE of the 3.5” x 5.5” Trump cards. Remember, only the larger deck is signed & numbered.

13) Two of a Kind    $65

This perk gets you TWO copies of the regular-sized, signed & numbered New Hermetics Tarot decks. This is a perfect way to give a gift, without feeling like you want to keep it for yourself at the last minute.

14) Two Large & one Card  $70

This perk gets you TWO copies of the regular-sized, signed & numbered New Hermetics Tarot decks, as well as your choice of ONE of the 3.5” x 5.5” Trump cards.

15) Small & Large & Book  $75

This perk gets you one copy each of the smaller, travel-sized AND larger, regular-sized New Hermetics Tarot deck, along with a signed copy of Jason’s new book, Examining the New Hermetics Tarot. Remember, only the larger deck is signed & numbered.

16) Small, Large, Book & Card  $80

This perk gets you one copy each of the smaller, travel-sized AND larger, regular-sized New Hermetics Tarot deck, along with a signed copy of Jason’s new book, Examining the New Hermetics Tarot. You also get your choice of ONE of the 3.5” x 5.5” Trump cards. This is a great combo. Remember, only the larger deck is signed & numbered.

17) Deluxe Set  $100

At this level, we are introducing a new item, a set of 25 traditional Tattwa cards, in addition to one copy of each of the 2 different sized decks and a copy of the book.  Tattwa Cards were traditionally employed by the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn to aid students in astral clairvoyance. An affordable commercial set of these cards have not been available for many years, with used copies of John Mumford’s set selling for well over $100 used on places like Amazon. Our complimentary set of these cards, included as a “Thank You” for your level of support, measures 3.5” x 3.5” square. So, to recap, this perk gets you 1 larger-sized, signed & numbered New Hermetics Tarot deck, 1 smaller, travel-sized, unsigned New Hermetics Tarot deck, 1 signed copy of Jason’s new book, Examining the New Hermetics Tarot and 1 set of 25 Tattwa Cards.

18) Adept set  $125

This perk level gets you just about everything: 1 larger, regular-sized, signed & numbered New Hermetics Tarot deck, 1 smaller, travel-sized New Hermetics Tarot deck, 1 signed copy of Jason’s new book, Examining the New Hermetics Tarot, 1 set of our new Tattwa Cards mentioned at the $100 level as well as a FULL SET of all 22 3.5” x 5.5” New Hermetics Tarot Trumps with a different back.

19) All In  $150

This final perk level really does get you everything: 1 larger, regular-sized, signed & numbered New Hermetics Tarot deck, 1 smaller, travel-sized New Hermetics Tarot deck, 1 signed copy of Jason’s new book, Examining the New Hermetics Tarot, 1 set of our new Tattwa Cards mentioned at the $100 level as well as a FULL SET of all 22 3.5” x 5.5” New Hermetics Tarot Trumps with a different back. In addition to everything at the $125 level, you’ll get a 30 minute phone call from the author, in which you can discuss his new Tarot set, ask for advice on how to work with the cards, request a tarot reading from him or just about any way in which you wish to spend your 30 minutes.

All prices include FREE s&h charges within the United States. Any international orders will be asked to pay only actual postage, which has yet to be determined.

Descriptions of the various Stretch Goals are as follows:

STRETCH GOALS

$1,500

If we reach our initial goal of $1,500 with this campaign, every supporter who donated $25 or more will receive a PDF of additional, unpublished, advanced instructions for the New Hermetics Tarot, as well as your choice of one of several audio recordings. The menu for you to choose from will include a number of never-before released audio recordings from Jason, as well as some standards. For those of you who are regular consumers of his 200+ audio recordings (for sale at Jason Augustus Newcomb dot com) or his free, weekly webinars, this is a great opportunity to hear some rare, unreleased material from him.

$2,000

If we exceed our goal and hit the $2,000 mark, everyone who contributed $50 or more will receive a specially printed set of the 22 trump cards, which were showcased in his book Sexual Sorcery. This book from 2005, still available from Red Wheel/Weiser, featured these 22 cards in black-and-white. You will receive a set of the 22 Major Arcana in full color, the same size as the New Hermetics Tarot, at 2.75” x 4.75”, perfect for use with meditations from the book and the awakening of your kundalini. Additionally, you’ll still receive the rewards from the $1,500 stretch goal.

$2,500

If we are able to exceed our initial goal by one thousand dollars and hit the $2,500 mark, each supporter who donated $75 or more to help us get there, will receive a set of 22 Hebrew letter, flashing-color meditation cards, designed by Jason. These meditative cards are the perfect tool for those individuals who explore the tarot on a deeper level through meditative pathworkings, as each of the 22 Hebrew letters directly corresponds with one of the 22 tarot trumps. Additionally, you’ll still receive the rewards from the $1,500 and $2,000 stretch goals.

$3,000

If we are able to double our initial goal and hit the $3,000 mark, each supporter who has donated $100 or more will receive all of the audio recordings that you were given a choice to choose between at the $1,500 mark. This means that you won’t need to fret when trying to decide which of the unreleased recordings to choose between. Additionally, you’ll still receive the rewards from the $1,500, $2,000 and $2,500 stretch goals.

$3,500

For each additional landmark of $500 beyond the $3,000 mark, we will continue to offer further "thank you" gifts to those who have contributed $100 or more to the campaign. So, this would happen at $3,500, at $4,000, at $4,500 and so on. These gifts could be anything from an original t-shirt to additional study aides. Basically, whatever our creative minds come up with. And, if you see us approaching one of these marks and have a suggestion, please share your ideas with us.
story_txt:
New Hermetics Tarot Deck
Although an author of more than 18 books, Jason Augustus Newcomb is best known for his 2004 landmark title, The New Hermetics, in which he strips down the rituals of the old world and empowers each individual to create his or her own path. This tarot set is an outgrowth of both his book and the New Hermetics system. Each card is from an original painting, created during the writing & publication of his book. This is the first time they will have been published as a deck. But, you need not be familiar with Jason's book, The New Hermetics, in order to benefit from this insightful and symbolic tarot set!

follows:

We are offering 5 larger, 3.5" x 5.5" copies of each of the 22 Trumps from the New Hermetics Tarot set. Claiming these cards will happen on a first-come, first-serve
basis. Once all FIVE copies of a specific Trump card have been claimed, we will
no longer offer it, as long as the other Trumps are still available; however, if all 5 sets of trumps sell out quickly, we will print additional sets, 5 at a time, to accommodate those that may want a single card or who may have missed being able to claim a set. These larger cards, with a different back than the regular set, are intended to be a focal point on your altar or as a meditation aide.
