story:
Project Summary

Want to send more interesting holiday cards this year? I know I do. I am gathering funding to have my Krampus design printed as postcards (and folding cards too, if funding reaches $100 or more) to send to people for the holidays. "Gruss vom Krampus" means "greetings from the Kampus." Though its roots lie in pre-Christian Germanic traditions, the Krampus eventually became a part of Christian winter celebrations. No free handouts of coal here; the Krampus catches bad little children and takes them away to be eaten. Great subject matter for holiday cards! Let's make the holidays a little different this year.

My Goals and Your Rewards

At the benchmark of $60, I can print postcards. If my project makes it to $100, I will be able to offer not only postcards, but folding cards as well. The postcards are 8.5x5.5 inches, folding cards will be slightly smaller than that. If my project makes it to $200, all contributors will receive an upgrade on their perks. If $400 is reached, a secondary mystery postcard/folding card design will be announced and included in the perks. If the project reaches $500, three mystery postcard/folding card designs will be announced and included in the perks. 

Funding goes towards:

  • Printing the postcards and cards
  • Shipping the postcards and rewards to supporters
  • Envelopes
  • Any proceeds accumulated above the goal amount will be used for future creative projects.

Rewards:

  • Postcards
  • Prints from my storenvy: http://phantomseptember.storenvy.com/
  • Ornate Colour Commissions. Example: odyssey_by_phantomseptember-d684u98.jpg
  • Sketch Commissions Example: tumblr_mvcehkmTAH1qmhewyo1_500.jpg
  • Big-Time Commissions Examples: garlic_by_phantomseptember-d64z2l5.jpg olm_dragon_by_phantomseptember-d5xzh16.jpg

Envelopes are included so that you can send postcards to people without the hassle of buying an entire box of over-sized envelopes. Why envelopes in the first place? Well, I'm not sure the postal service is prepared to handle an invasion of wintry demons just yet.

I've tried to make the perks as varied as possible, so that they cater to all kinds of people who want to invest in me and my artistic endeavours.

NOTE: The original copy of the sketch commissions will be mailed at no extra cost.All finished ornate bust commissions will be e-mailed as high resolution files to contributors in lieu of a physical copy. Contributors are free to contact me and arrange to have the original version (or a high-quality print) of the bust commissions mailed, if they so desire. An extra charge for printing and shipping will apply. Commissions may take longer to be completed and sent than other perks. 

NOTE TO CONTRIBUTORS OUTSIDE THE U.S.: Contributors from outside of the U.S. who are contributing $10 or more, and receiving perks through the mail, need to add $15 to their contribution for shipping. Contributors from outside the U.S. opting for commissions as perks do not need to add $15, and they will receive their commissions as high-resolution files.

The Impact

You will be helping me to fund my very first solo project as an artist, as well as encouraging and supporting future artistic endeavours from me! Every little bit helps. All profits go towards funding this project and future--perhaps even bigger--creative projects of mine! I can't do this on my own, but with your help I can. Your investment in my artistic endeavours is very much appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Getting the word out about my project helps a lot! Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter-- just talk about my project where ever you like to spend time on the internet! Telling friends and family is great too. Tell anyone and everyone you know! 


UPDATE!

FULLY FUNDED! 
A huge thank you to everyone of you. You are the reason for the success of this project. I am utterly amazed and honored by the amount of support I have received for my project. Thank you, and thank you again. I apologize for the lateness of my update.

SO! What Happens Now?
Because the project is fully funded, I will be able to print the three mystery postcard designs I mentioned. 
- Those of you who donated $10 or more will receive a set of the mystery postcards in addition to your original perks. 
- Those of you who donated $30 or more will receive three sets of the mystery postcards in addition to your original perks. 
- Those of you who donated $50 or more will receive five sets of the mystery postcards and five folding cards in addition to your original perks. 
-Those of you who donated $90 or more I will be contacting individually about your perks.

This Week (Dec. 1 - 7)
- I will be mailing out the thank you postcards, and the postcards of those who opted for extra Krampus cards as part of their perks. 
-I will be ordering the mystery design postcards.
-I will begin work on sketch commissions, and mail them out as I finish them.

After This Week
- I will be continuing to work on sketch commissions and commissions. 
- As soon as the mystery postcards com in, I will mail them out.  

Is There Anything Else You Need to Do?
Those of you who opted for commissions from me need to let me know what you would like for your commission. The sooner you let me know, the sooner I can start!
Please feel free to contact me know if you have questions, comments, or concerns!

The Three Mystery Designs Are:
http://aramis-september.tumblr.com/post/6912074...

Thanks again everyone! I'll post another update as things go forward.
story_txt:
Project SummaryWant to send more interesting holiday cards this year? I know I 
do. I am gathering funding to have my Krampus design printed as 
postcards (and folding cards too, if funding reaches $100 or more) to send to people for the holidays. "Gruss vom Krampus" means 
"greetings from the Kampus." Though its roots lie in pre-Christian 
Germanic traditions, the Krampus eventually became a part of Christian winter 
celebrations. No free handouts of coal here; the Krampus 
catches bad little children and takes them away to be eaten. Great 
subject matter for holiday cards! Let's make the holidays a little different this year. My Goals and Your Rewards
At the benchmark of $60, I can print postcards. If my project makes it to $100, I will be able to offer not only postcards, but folding cards as well. The postcards are 8.5x5.5 inches, folding cards will be slightly smaller than that. If my project makes it to $200, all contributors will receive an upgrade on their perks. If $400 is reached, a secondary mystery postcard/folding card design will be announced and included in the perks. If the project reaches $500, three mystery postcard/folding card designs will be announced and included in the perks. Funding goes towards: 
Printing the postcards and cards
Shipping the postcards and rewards to supporters
Envelopes
Any proceeds accumulated above the goal amount will be used for future creative projects.
Rewards:
Postcards

Prints from my storenvy: http://phantomseptember.storenvy.com/

Ornate Colour Commissions. Example: odyssey_by_phantomseptember-d684u98.jpg

Sketch Commissions Example: tumblr_mvcehkmTAH1qmhewyo1_500.jpg

Big-Time Commissions Examples: garlic_by_phantomseptember-d64z2l5.jpg olm_dragon_by_phantomseptember-d5xzh16.jpg

Envelopes are included so that you can send postcards to people without the hassle of buying an entire box of over-sized envelopes. Why envelopes in the first place? Well, I'm not sure the postal service is prepared to handle an invasion of wintry demons just yet.I've tried to make the perks as varied as possible, so that they cater to all kinds of people who want to invest in me and my artistic endeavours.NOTE: The original copy of the sketch commissions will be mailed at no extra cost.All finished ornate bust commissions will be e-mailed as high resolution files to contributors in lieu of a physical copy. Contributors are free to contact me and arrange to have the original version (or a high-quality print) of the bust commissions mailed, if they so desire. An extra charge for printing and shipping will apply. Commissions may take longer to be completed and sent than other perks. NOTE TO CONTRIBUTORS OUTSIDE THE U.S.: Contributors from outside of the U.S. who are contributing $10 or more, and receiving perks through the mail, need to add $15 to their contribution for shipping. Contributors from outside the U.S. opting for commissions as perks do not need to add $15, and they will receive their commissions as high-resolution files.The ImpactYou will be helping me to fund my very first solo project as an artist, 
as well as encouraging and supporting future artistic endeavours from 
me! Every little bit helps. All profits go towards funding this project 
and future--perhaps even bigger--creative projects of mine! I can't do this on my own, but with your help I can. Your investment in my artistic endeavours is very much appreciated.Other Ways You Can HelpGetting the word out about my project helps a lot! Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter-- just talk about my project where ever you like to spend time on the internet! Telling friends and family is great too. Tell anyone and everyone you know! UPDATE!FULLY FUNDED! A huge thank you to everyone of you. You are the reason for the success of this project. I am utterly amazed and honored by the amount of support I have received for my project. Thank you, and thank you again. I apologize for the lateness of my update.
SO! What Happens Now?Because the project is fully funded, I will be able to print the three mystery postcard designs I mentioned. - Those of you who donated $10 or more will receive a set of the mystery postcards in addition to your original perks. - Those of you who donated $30 or more will receive three sets of the mystery postcards in addition to your original perks. - Those of you who donated $50 or more will receive five sets of the mystery postcards and five folding cards in addition to your original perks. -Those of you who donated $90 or more I will be contacting individually about your perks.
This Week (Dec. 1 - 7)- I will be mailing out the thank you postcards, and the postcards of those who opted for extra Krampus cards as part of their perks. -I will be ordering the mystery design postcards.-I will begin work on sketch commissions, and mail them out as I finish them.After This Week- I will be continuing to work on sketch commissions and commissions. - As soon as the mystery postcards com in, I will mail them out.  Is There Anything Else You Need to Do?Those of you who opted for commissions from me need to let me know what you would like for your commission. The sooner you let me know, the sooner I can start!Please feel free to contact me know if you have questions, comments, or concerns!The Three Mystery Designs Are:http://aramis-september.tumblr.com/post/6912074...Thanks again everyone! I'll post another update as things go forward.

story:
What:

The Inner Light Festival is a unique opportunity for the city of Birmingham to showcase its dedication to a thriving creative culture. The festival will welcome and embrace all, creating the space for inspiration and action in the Magic City and beyond.

A “pop-up” village of lights, built around the Architects of Air Luminaria, a large scale inflatable cathedral of natural lights that has mesmerized thousands of people around the world. More than just a place, or an event, the Inner Light Festival will be an immersive experience, capturing the imagination of all who attend, and focusing the vibrant, creative spirit of Birmingham into a whirlwind of innovation and enjoyment. 

The contributors who work with us to bring the Inner Light Festival to life are making a powerful statement about their investment in Birmingham as an innovative, progressive city, a city that invests in its artists and thinkers to drive the economy, a city that belongs on the national and international stage.


Who: 

Marcus Turner - Promoter / Organizer

http://weldbham.com/blog/2014/02/20/a-sense-of-wonder/

The Architects of Air - Founder, Alan Parkinson

www.architects-of-air.com 

Panorama PR (PR Agency of Record)

http://www.prview.com/#!/

O2 Ideas (Creative/Advertising Agency of Record)

www.o2ideas.com

REV Birmingham (fiscal agent-awaiting confirmation from board)

http://www.revbirmingham.org/


Since 1992 Architects of Air’s luminaria have made over 600 exhibitions in 40 countries. From Berlin to Brooklyn, Hong Kong to Hawaii, Taipei to Tel Aviv, Sao Paulo to the Sydney Opera House, the monumental walk-in sculptures of Architects of Air have enchanted audiences around the world. 

The four day event will feature the larger than life luminarium Miracoco, ‘a dazzling maze of winding paths and soaring domes where Islamic architecture, Archimedean solids and Gothic cathedrals meld into an inspiring monument to the beauty of light and colour. 



Where:



Inner Light will be held at Railroad Park on the West Green across from Regions Park. 

When: October 24th through 27th 


The event is timed to begin with the Dalai Llama's historic visit to the Magic City . He is scheduled to speak at Regions Park on October 25th. 

What We Need & What You Get

The citizens of Birmingham and the local business community have the power to determine the size and scope of this event. The various sponsorship levels represent the funding needed in order to incorporate that aspect or idea into the experience. 

How far we take this experiment is completely up to you....Collectively, we have the power to start a Movement... Together and only together...can we make this project come to life in a BIG way. 



Calling All Visionaries !!!! 

Help us mold this city into something truly amazing! The cost for the illumanarium is an integral part of this project. We need in the neighborhood of $40,000 in order to pay the travel fees, setup costs, and marketing for the illuminarium. 

The Fire Starter Sponsor -  (10) $3,500

This sponsorship level was put in place to introduce a new idea. The movable , inter-changeable, creative lab / classroom / art museum / performance venue / record store / radio station / recording studio / media company / film studio / library...you get the point. 

Whatever you envision this to be...that's what it becomes. Be Creative and Inspire others to do the same. We'll equip your dome with a flag with your company logo on it. Imagine how this is going to look with LED lights illuminating it at night. 

At festivals end my goal is to donate these amazing structures to Railroad Park and UAB for the purpose of creating new revenue opportunities,  educating and inspiring others to "think inside the dome".

.


Hearts Of Dixie

Hearts of Dixie Sponsor - (20) $1,000

Sponsor a field trip for up to 200 children from a local school, a special needs organization or the children's charity of your choice. The children will experience a series of educational Art workshops, team building exercises, and creative writing projects. They will love this experience...make it happen. 

The True Innovators 

True Innovators Sponsor - (2) $5,000

These sponsors will forever be known as the true innovators of their industry.... you'll  receive logo placement where applicable on the event website, press releases, advertising, social media and location signage. 


Double Stage Sponsor - (1) $30,000

You will be solely responsible for bringing the music to this festival....You get naming rights to the double stage...similiar to the one shown above...but on a smaller scale. You and your associates will get the Rockstar treatment at a special VIP party in a private dome. You'll also get 25 weekend passes to Miracoco. The whole city will thank you for it. 


Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE SIGN OUR PETITION : 

http://www.ipetitions.com/petition/the-inner-light-festival-bring-miracoco-to

If you are interested in becoming a Steward or a volunteer....Please email or call me at the number / email below. Are you...or Do you know a member of the media who would/or might like to learn more about this project ? 

Do you have a special skill or talent ?...are you an artist, musician, writer, architect, entrepreneur, activist...it really doesn't matter...ARE YOU PASSIONATE  ? If the answer is yes...we want to hear from you...email or call 

Marcus Turner - marcus.birm@gmail.com - Cell- 205-572-2263

LOVE AND GRATITUDE.

story:
Short Summary

So for those of you that don’t know me my name is Todd Anderson-Kunert. I’m an artist that works between installation, performance, releases (like the one your about to read about), and generally mixes of those three things.

I have a solo show coming up at Strange Neighbour Gallery in Fitzroy (run by some really great people, check them out at www.strangeneighbour.com). The show opens Friday 21st February, and is an audiovisual installation consisting of nineteen photographic images, and an eight channel sound installation.

As a part of the exhibition, I’ve produced a 7” vinyl and black and white artist book. The vinyl contains the audio from the installation, and the book contains all of the images. All are hand numbered and signed.

The total cost of manufacturing the 7” Vinyl and book alone is AU$1650.00. At an edition of 100, this means that the cost of each one is $16.50. The normal sale price of 7” in my experience is between $10-$15.

I don’t make art for financial reasons, I make art because it makes sense to. At the moment, I’m aiming on getting my practice more sustainable. This doesn’t necessarily mean getting others to pay for my practice for me (I’ve already had these made!), but it does mean looking at other ways I can fund my projects. So…

What I Need & What You Get

There are two ways you can financially support this project:

1) Pre-order a copy of the 7” vinyl and artist book for the price of AU$15 (cheaper than making them yourself!). Your copy will be waiting for you to pick it up at the exhibition opening (Postage is available at an extra cost).

2) Or for AU$125 you can purchase the 7” vinyl and book also, but it will include a limited edition 7” chromogenic print of one of the images from the exhibition. This offer is limited to the first 19 supporters as there are only 19 images in the show. You will also get one of the first 19 editions of the vinyl/book. While this is a large amount of money, it’s actually about 80% less than I usually sell chromogenic prints for.

NOTE: Some of the images from the show are rectangular, which means that they can’t be printed as a 7” square print. In this case, the images will be 5.6 x 7”, and there will be a white strip of paper at two of the edges (it will still be printed on a 7” square of photographic paper).

The Impact

If I sell all 19 of the second option I'll raise AU$2000, that will pay for all of the production costs of the artist book, vinyl, and the limited edition prints. This would be a huge help. If these don’t sell during this campaign they won’t be available at a later date, so this is the only place to get one!

If I sell the remaining 71 vinyl/books, I’ll get a total of AU$1065. This will be used to other cover costs associated with the exhibition. This won’t by any means pay for the exhibition, but it will make my practice ‘more’ sustainable! Any that don’t sell during this campaign will be available for purchase on at the exhibition.

And also, pre-ordering gets you out of being ‘that person’ that says ‘I’d totally buy one’ and then not buying one…. which makes the world a better place.

NOTE: There are 10 editions here that are not mentioned. This is because they are being used for promotion and will be sent interstate and overseas.

Other Ways You Can Help

So, if you can’t help financially, that’s totally fine. But if you can spread the word to those that might be able to, that would be a big help.

You can also just turn up to the exhibition! And invite some friends along too! Opening night in on Friday 21st February from 6-9pm, and the exhibition runs until the 22nd March 2014. And if you enjoy it, drop me a line. That also helps too.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q. Can I choose my print if I’m paying $125 for a limited edition print?

A. No. The prints will be chosen at random. This is partly due to the fact I’d like the images to be seen for the first time within the installation environment.

Q. Can I hear the audio?

A. Nope, same deal as above. However, it’s similar in audio content to my last electroacoustic composition for my installation ‘Eveything in it’s place’, and the audio for that is online at:

http://toddanderson-kunert.com/index.php?/project/everything-in-its-place/

Q. How come this campaign has been started so far in advance?

A. Well, if people are somewhat similar to me, January is not the time to be asking people for money…

About me

- Currently I’m pursuing my PhD in Fine Art (Studio Research) through Monash University Caulfield.

- I perform and exhibit works regularly.

- More information about me can be found at: http://www.toddanderson-kunert.com

- Feel free to email me at info@toddanderson-kunert.com

story:
Project Summary

I will head west from Chicago, following the American Discovery Trail, the nation's only coast-to-coast, non-motorized trail, spending the night in campgrounds, farms and in the middle of nowhere.

My journey will be about facing fears and fantasies.

I have always had a special fascination with horses. And I used to ride regularly when I was younger. I tend to forget the bad experiences: horses walking on my feet, biting me, getting scared and galloping off, (almost) crushing my chest with their hooves.

My most persistent romantic dream is, to this day, to travel by horse through majestic landscapes and undergo some sort of heroic transformation. I haven’t been a teenager for thirteen years now. It is time to explore what was real about this desire, and face the reality of physical exhaustion, loneliness, fear. I will document my metamorphosis from irritable city dweller to whatever I will become after this epic feat. Failure is a possible outcome. Solitude will make me write.

I will carry with me a DSLR camera (capable of shooting HD video), a digital sound recorder (with binaural microphones), a film camera, pen and paper. This equipment is already in my possession. I’m considering bringing an iPad and regularly updating a blog.

I want to deconstruct my own myths but also interrogate the American myth of the Great Outdoors.

My journey will also echo the spiritual journeys undertaken by shamans in oral societies in order to reconnect with the non-human world and enrich human discourse with the stories embedded in the land and its animal inhabitants.

When I get back to Chicago I will turn my material into a documentary, several artist's books, a series of prints, an installation, maybe a performance.

I can’t make any of this happen without you. This is your chance to be involved in the development of my new line of inquiry, which will likely culminate in my MFA thesis project.

Who am I?

I'm an MFA student in Interdisciplinary Arts and Media at Columbia College Chicago. I'm originally from Rome, Italy.

My artwork tends to originate in a place of darkness. It harnesses raw, potentially destructive energy, but my process is a movement toward greater understanding. I strive to recompose dichotomies and find solace in humor and beauty.

I was recently selected to be featured on my department's website as an example of interdisciplinary risk taking, sharp conceptual focus, and outstanding achievement:

http://www.colum.edu/Academics/Interarts/research/student-research.php

And this is my personal website: www.valentinavella.com

What I Need 

I need 11,000 dollars to cover the first year of my expenses. This includes the cost of buying or renting a horse.

This project will likely last two or more years but for now I just need to get it started.

Before leaving I will spend some time training and acquiring survival skills. I will learn how to plan excursions, take care of my horse, stay away from danger. I am taking natural horsemanchip lessons at a local equestrian facility.

I already possess most of the equipment I need to document my journey (I might just need to get extra batteries, SD cards, solar chargers etc...) so the majority of the money will cover horse tack, riding and camping gear, transportation, lodging, food, horse care, horse board.

In a perfect world I would start my journey in the summer 2012 and stop only once I reached the Pacific Ocean, but money and time limitations (being an MFA student) will require a different plan: I will travel this summer for about a month and then head back to Chicago to attend my fall classes, during which I will start turning my material into art that I will share with the public.

I will use Columbia College’s audiovisual facilities and its Center for Book and Paper Arts to create videos, artist’s books, prints, installations, sound pieces about my time in the saddle. I also plan on giving presentations and lectures.

I will resume my journey when I have the material resources and the time to do so. I won’t consider this project finished until our feet and hooves are resting on a California beach.

In case I don’t manage to raise all the funds I need by the end of my campaign but I still get enough to cover part of my budget, I will embark on a fully documented smaller-scale solitary journey which I will share with you all. I will then keep working on raising funds for the full project by applying for grants as well.

If I don’t get enough money for a small-scale journey I will at least train physically and mentally, research opportunities, volunteer at a local natural horsemanship center and keep working on making the full project happen.

What You Get

By contributing even a small amount of money to this project you will have the satisfaction of having empowered an artist to make new art. And your donations are tax-deductible!

There are of course perks, especially for people making substantial donations. They range from handwritten postcards, to producer credits, to several kinds of artwork. If you are not interested in receiving rewards you can say so and get a deduction for the full amount.

The Impact

My art-making stems from autobiographical experiences. I want to put myself in a situation that is at the same time very meaningful to me and utterly uncomfortable.

I believe this will turn me into a better artist. And the world needs good art. 

There is of course the potential for scholarly work. I am strongly influenced, among others, by the writings of Carl Jung, Rober Pirsig, Lewis Hyde, David Abram. I consider myself first and foremost an artist, but I sometimes like to indulge my more theoretical side.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially you can at least help me get the word out by sharing this with your friends and family!

Also, you might be able to help by giving practical and existential advice. Or maybe you know someone who could help me learn more about horses! Get in touch with me.

I have always had a special fascination with horses. And I used to ride regularly when I was younger. I tend to forget the bad experiences: horses walking on my feet, biting me, getting scared and galloping off, (almost) crushing my chest with their hooves.
My most persistent romantic dream is, to this day, to travel by horse through majestic landscapes and undergo some sort of heroic transformation. I haven’t been a teenager for thirteen years now. It is time to explore what was real about this desire, and face the reality of physical exhaustion, loneliness, fear. I will document my metamorphosis from irritable city dweller to whatever I will become after this epic feat. Failure is a possible outcome. Solitude will make me write.
I will carry with me a DSLR camera (capable of shooting HD video), a digital sound recorder (with binaural microphones), a film camera, pen and paper. This equipment is already in my possession. I’m considering bringing an iPad and regularly updating a blog.
I want to deconstruct my own myths but also interrogate the American myth of the Great Outdoors.
My journey will also echo the spiritual journeys undertaken by shamans in oral societies in order to reconnect with the non-human world and enrich human discourse with the stories embedded in the land and its animal inhabitants.
When I get back to Chicago I will turn my material into a documentary, several artist's books, a series of prints, an installation, maybe a performance.
I can’t make any of this happen without you. This is your chance to be involved in the development of my new line of inquiry, which will likely culminate in my MFA thesis project.
Who am I?
I'm an MFA student in Interdisciplinary Arts and Media at Columbia College Chicago. I'm originally from Rome, Italy.
My artwork tends to originate in a place of darkness. It harnesses raw, potentially destructive energy, but my process is a movement toward greater understanding. I strive to recompose dichotomies and find solace in humor and beauty.
I was recently selected to be featured on my department's website as an example of interdisciplinary risk taking, sharp conceptual focus, and outstanding achievement:
http://www.colum.edu/Academics/Interarts/research/student-research.php
And this is my personal website: www.valentinavella.com
What I Need 

I need 11,000 dollars to cover the first year of my expenses. This includes the cost of buying or renting a horse.
This project will likely last two or more years but for now I just need to get it started.
Before leaving I will spend some time training and acquiring survival skills. I will learn how to plan excursions, take care of my horse, stay away from danger. I am taking natural horsemanchip lessons at a local equestrian facility.
I already possess most of the equipment I need to document my journey (I might just need to get extra batteries, SD cards, solar chargers etc...) so the majority of the money will cover horse tack, riding and camping gear, transportation, lodging, food, horse care, horse board.
In a perfect world I would start my journey in the summer 2012 and stop only once I reached the Pacific Ocean, but money and time limitations (being an MFA student) will require a different plan: I will travel this summer for about a month and then head back to Chicago to attend my fall classes, during which I will start turning my material into art that I will share with the public.
I will use Columbia College’s audiovisual facilities and its Center for Book and Paper Arts to create videos, artist’s books, prints, installations, sound pieces about my time in the saddle. I also plan on giving presentations and lectures.
I will resume my journey when I have the material resources and the time to do so. I won’t consider this project finished until our feet and hooves are resting on a California beach.
In case I don’t manage to raise all the funds I need by the end of my campaign but I still get enough to cover part of my budget, I will embark on a fully documented smaller-scale solitary journey which I will share with you all. I will then keep working on raising funds for the full project by applying for grants as well.
If I don’t get enough money for a small-scale journey I will at least train physically and mentally, research opportunities, volunteer at a local natural horsemanship center and keep working on making the full project happen.
What You Get
By contributing even a small amount of money to this project you will have the satisfaction of having empowered an artist to make new art. And your donations are tax-deductible!
There are of course perks, especially for people making substantial donations. They range from handwritten postcards, to producer credits, to several kinds of artwork. If you are not interested in receiving rewards you can say so and get a deduction for the full amount.



The Impact
My art-making stems from autobiographical experiences. I want to put myself in a situation that is at the same time very meaningful to me and utterly uncomfortable.
I believe this will turn me into a better artist. And the world needs good art. 
There is of course the potential for scholarly work. I am strongly influenced, among others, by the writings of Carl Jung, Rober Pirsig, Lewis Hyde, David Abram. I consider myself first and foremost an artist, but I sometimes like to indulge my more theoretical side.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute financially you can at least help me get the word out by sharing this with your friends and family!
Also, you might be able to help by giving practical and existential advice. Or maybe you know someone who could help me learn more about horses! Get in touch with me.

story:
Hello Everyone:

Welcome and thank you for taking the time to visit my campaign.The story "Make Friends" was inspired during the summer I found myself without employment and my having to explain to my son why I would be home with him for the whole summer. What emerged out of this time was a great journey of learning and discovery for father and son. We gained knowledge and insight about our environment, our community and most importantly about each other beyond father and son. Make Friends is a story for anyone who wants to learn more about themselves and the willingness to Make Friends. 

All contributions will go to the artwork for the book. The artist, Mike Myers is a working artist and his work is the final piece needed to having the book ready for the publisher's final approval.

I did make attempts to have the publisher pay the artist, but they didn't offer me an advance, since this is my first children's book. 

The drawing above is Mike's b/w draft of the cover page for Make Friends.

If the funding goal reaches less than 50%, I will give it all to Mike to start working on Make Friends. If its over 50%, but less than 100% I will give it all to Mike. All funds will go to Mike, to do the art work. It is important to get this book out there for all to read. 

The stories I write are personal and are here to help others connect with people in their lives or build a bridge to re-connecting. That is why I share, there's no fear in helping others. It is part of my life's purpose. Always done with a smile.

And if for some reason you can't make a contribution that's okay to. We accept positive energy from all. Just do us one small favor and please share this campaign with all your family and friends, hopefully they can contribute. And remember to enjoy the journey. Many thanks, John :)

 

PS: Please use the indiegogo share tool.

story:
My Story

My name is Elijah Kihlstadius. I'm 19 years old, and I want to make a difference in this world. My story starts many years back, really. Growing up, is was in a very emotionally and verbally abusive environment. I was always the odd kid out, the odd ball, and the misfit. Unfortunately that environment changed me for the worse, as I grew up hating myself and hating everyone around me as well.


As I grew into my teen years, simple self hate and low self esteem stemmed into real serious problems. At first, it was simple self neglect and social avoidance. Then growing into my later teen years, I began to develop an poor eating habits, depression, and extreme avoidance of everyone around me.


In May of this year I was diagnosed with extreme depression. I was told that I should not be able to function. I was told that people in my mental state should not be able to work or go to school. I was told that people, like me, should be immediately admitted into a hospital for intensive treatment and therapy. And yet, here I am. Still trying to achieve my goals and show the world that God is not limited by my weaknesses.


“But he said to me, 'My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.' Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my weaknesses, so that Christ's power may rest on me. That is why, for Christ's sake, I delight in weaknesses, in insults, in hardships, in persecutions, in difficulties. For when I am weak, then I am strong.” - 2 Corinthians 12:9-10


In addition to being diagnosed with depression, I have also been fighting an eating disorder. Technically classified as E.D.N.O.S. (Eating Disorder Not Otherwise Specified), my disorder has caused me to maintain an unhealthy weight, and made it difficult for me to have a healthy immune system due to the lack of nutrients going into my body.


This is me. I am learning to accept the things I cannot change, and I am fighting to change the things that I can.

The Opportunity

I've been accepted to the Creative DTS (Discipleship Training School) at the Youth With A Mission base in Wiler, Switzerland. Additionally, they have asked me to teach the photography portion of the training there at the base. I could go into further details, but I want to refrain from possibly boring you with mundane things that aren't particularly pertinent to this letter.


I would be leaving mid September 2011 and returning early June 2012. My time there would be split up between a seven month training and lecture phase and two months of hard core global outreach, with four weeks of skill specific training, in my case photography, interspersed amongst the seven month lecture phase.

The Impact

I believe that before I can make a difference in other people lives, I need to first change myself. This opportunity to go to Switzerland will give me the chance to not only build a solid foundation for myself and my future, but more importantly this will give me the chance to heal. Away from the pain and darkness, I can begin to heal and put my life back together from the inside out.


What I Need

The lecture phase will cost 6600 CHF, which is approximately $7879 (it varies depending on the given exchange rate at the time). The outreach phase will cost 4500 CHF, which is approximately $5372. There are also some additional expenses such as the flight and some various supplies, which are detailed in a spreadsheet at the bottom of this page.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this page on your Facebook, Twitter, or other social media profile! Check out the sharing tools and spread the word! 


Also, please pray and ask God if He would have you support me in my efforts in going to Switzerland. If you can help in any way, whether it be through funds, providing a needed item (see list) or simply praying for me, it would be greatly appreciated :) Also, above all else, please pray that no matter what happens with this opportunity that God's will would done and He would be glorified in all that I accomplish.

___________________________________________________________________________________


DESCRIPTION CHF USD
School lecture phase 6600.00 $7,879.00
Tax 93.80 $105.94
Outreach Phase 4500.00 $5,372.00
Flight n/a $1,500.00
Tripod w/ ball head and pan-tilt head n/a
Heavy duty suitcase n/a
Hiking Boots n/a
50mm f/1.4 n/a
Vertical battery grip n/a
Jacket/coat n/a
Passport n/a $150.00
Visa n/a $95.00
Gaffers tape n/a
Large "backpacking" backpack n/a
Small day trip backpack / Camelbak / backpack with Camelbak built in n/a
(two) 2TB External Hard drives n/a $180.00
Wireless mouse n/a

story:
Our Story

                Marines At Work

 

September, 2011 is the the ten-year anniversary of the United States’ war on terror.  To capture the quiet, real courage and unique strength of the men and women currently in the United States Armed Services I will live and travel with a unit of US Marines on deployment in Afghanistan to do portrait sittings of the Marines.


In over twenty years of photography I have specialized in capturing individuals at work—from athletes to politicians, celebrities and people across the globe. A cross section of my work in Sports, Music and fashion can be seen at http://www.nickcardillicchio.com


Now I want to show Americans a series of close and quiet portraits of United States Marines who do the extremely unusual work of trying to bring peace to the world.   

 

My intention, in this project, is not to make the soldiers heroes, but to make them real, doing their work, contributing to a nation they care about. I will create quiet, simple, respectful portraits of individual Marines who, after all their specialized training and hard work are now deployed and simply doing their work.

 

I have the full cooperation of the United States Marine Corp: they support this project and believe in its potential to show the individual and collective greatness of the troops working selflessly in our military service


The photographs will ultimately become a published book about the work of individual soldiers and the larger organization of the United States Marine Corp.  In addition the portraits—along with the soldiers’ experiences in their own words-- will be presented in a gallery show in New York City and across the country.

 

In over twenty years as a photographer I have photographed people in extreme situations around the world including victims of sexual slavery in Nepal and India; torture victims in Indonesia; dissidents in hiding in Peru; child rights activists in central Africa; women's health providers in Egypt; traditional Fa Fa Fine in Micronesia; Border Patrol officers in the Southern U.S.; and Native American fugitives hiding on the Mohawk Nation.

 

As a feature editorial photographer for The Washington Post, Newsweek, Time, Sports Illustrated, Rolling Stone, Esquire and many more of the world’s most well known publications for over twenty years I have specialized in portraits of some of the world’s most prominent people. My partial client list includes:

 

The Washington Post

Newsweek

Time

Sports Illustrated

ESPN

Rolling Stone

GQ

Esquire

People Magazine

Men's Health

Men's Journal

Womens Health

Glamour

Marie Clair

New York Magazine

Forbes

Fortune

Texas Monthly

Los Angeles Magazine

Sony Music

BMG

EMI

Warner Brothers

Atlantic Records

Virgin Records

 

My work has brought me face to face with some of the world’s most prominent political figures. 

The Sports Illustrated Director of Photography once told me how to best capture the essence of people in unique situations.  To prepare me for doing portaits of star athletes such as Alex Rodriguez, Bernie Williams or the Manning brothers he told me,  "Shoot em where they work" This meant I was to shoot athletes in either a stadium or field, an ice rink or a pool, a gym or a race track or wherever it was they did their great work. NEVER in a living room or leaning on a fancy car. 

 

I will bring all of that experience to bear on my upcoming work with the U.S. Marines in Afghanistan.  I hope you will join me in making this project a reality: your donation will help bring  close-up views of the troops—along with their own thoughts—alive for during this ten-year anniversary and for decades to come. 

 

Thank you for your support. 


The Impact

This type of photographic project has continued and even increased impact over time. The images will help to both explain and remember this place and time. The Marines themselves will be given a voice and the work will contribute to the historical record for all time.


What We Need & What You Get

The requirements for producing this work are the photographic production costs which include equipment rentals, shipping, insurances, travel and flight costs and a range of minor and major items.

Also in this project are costs associated with the requirements placed by the USMC for my access. Regulations say I must purchase my own safety equipment including bullet proof vest, helmet, flak jacket and eye and ear protection.

I plan on using as much of my own money (and of course time) as I have along with using some credit. There simply is not enough for me to cover the costs of maintaining a high production value and a meaningful work flow. The first trip is by far the most expensive. 

Anyone who chooses to give in support of this effort can expect to see the works in progress as posted to a secure site for supporters to view throughout and after each stage of the project.

When the body of work develops fully I am happy to contribute back. For any contributer of at $100 dollars or more will make a photographic print of the image of your choice either from this project or from my existing work. 

Along with these things I hope each of you will have the satisfaction of looking at an important body of work and saying "I helped do that"


Other Ways You Can Help

Please take a moment and help me get the word out. Every contribution in any size really counts here. Will you help bring awareness by letting your friends and contacts know about this project?

story:
Feel The Spark.

An epidemic is sweeping our nation. We are discontent. Workaholics. Stressed.

Often what we need is engagement in a process that allows us to have a voice. We need places to make things without judgement. We need supportive communities of other creative people. We need space to make art and a creative community to join. 

Painting saved me. My creative community never ceases to inspire me. Everyone deserves that. 

We are about hosting 50 physical events that invite average adults to come find the creative outlet they have been searching for. There are opportunities waiting. The event may only last 2 hours, but attendees will walk away with resources to keep them going.

An Epic Creative Road Trip.

I leave June 16 for a 10,000+ mile road trip around the USA and Canada. The intinerary is just about complete and I am in the throws of planning each event. 

Each event will include:

  • An opportunity to make something. Choose between: a mixed media booklet, creative writing, or mail art. 
  • A raffle for creative books or products.
  • A chance to meet local artists/teachers.
  • Local creative resources.
  • Info on creative classes available through seekyourcourse.com
  • A chance to browse and purchase creative merchanise. 
 
The tentative route includes events in Buffalo, Pittsburg, Cincinnati, Chicago, St Louis, Kansas City, Winnipeg, Calgary, Banff, Vancouver, Seattle, Portland, Corvallis, Boise, Reno, Santa Rosa, San Francisco, Berkeley, Morro Bay area, Santa Barbara, LA, St. George (UT), Salt Lake City, Boulder, Denver, Santa Fe, 4 Corners, Grand Canyon, Phoenix, El Paso, San Antonio, Austin, Dallas, Baton Rouge, New Orleans, Nashville, Chattanooga, Atlanta, Greenville, Asheville, Raleigh, Blacksburg, Washington DC, Philadelphia, New York City, Boston, and Portland (ME).
 
The full budget is at least $10,000, but $2,500 will get me started. I will be asking for donations at the events, putting a donate button on the website, and fundraising as I go for the rest of it. I am confident that the people I meet along the way will want to help keep me going!
 
I have received some awesome donations for special perks! It want to receive an ecourse, painting, or some coaching sessions for your donation, go check out the available exclusive perks and claim one!
 

Declare Your Creativity.

Everyone deserves a night of open-ended art-making and writing. Everyone deserves the chance to declare themselves as a creative person. As we seek to bring creative empowerment to adults across the country we also encourage you to declare your creative self as well. 

If you can help fill my gas tank and stomach as I travel that would be awesome! I am on a mission, but need help getting there. 

Other Ways You Can Help.

Attend! Please come to any event. Check the website for details and pre-register for events as the route is confirmed. 

Spread the word! There is the big country out there and lots of people who I know will want to support this mission. If you can help me find them, thank you!

I Felt The Spark. 

This tour is being organized by Seek Your Course, an online resource of creative opportunities for adults. Seek Your Course features a database of learning opportunities on a wide range of creative-related topics.

Each event will include:

An opportunity to make something. Choose between: a mixed media booklet, creative writing, or mail art. 
A raffle for creative books or products.
A chance to meet local artists/teachers.
Local creative resources.
Info on creative classes available through seekyourcourse.com
A chance to browse and purchase creative merchanise. 

 
The tentative route includes events in Buffalo, Pittsburg, Cincinnati, Chicago, St Louis, Kansas City, Winnipeg, Calgary, Banff, Vancouver, Seattle, Portland, Corvallis, Boise, Reno, Santa Rosa, San Francisco, Berkeley, Morro Bay area, Santa Barbara, LA, St. George (UT), Salt Lake City, Boulder, Denver, Santa Fe, 4 Corners, Grand Canyon, Phoenix, El Paso, San Antonio, Austin, Dallas, Baton Rouge, New Orleans, Nashville, Chattanooga, Atlanta, Greenville, Asheville, Raleigh, Blacksburg, Washington DC, Philadelphia, New York City, Boston, and Portland (ME).

 
The full budget is at least $10,000, but $2,500 will get me started. I will be asking for donations at the events, putting a donate button on the website, and fundraising as I go for the rest of it. I am confident that the people I meet along the way will want to help keep me going!
 
I have received some awesome donations for special perks! It want to receive an ecourse, painting, or some coaching sessions for your donation, go check out the available exclusive perks and claim one!
 


Declare Your Creativity.
Everyone deserves a night of open-ended art-making and writing. Everyone deserves the chance to declare themselves as a creative person. As we seek to bring creative empowerment to adults across the country we also encourage you to declare your creative self as well. 
If you can help fill my gas tank and stomach as I travel that would be awesome! I am on a mission, but need help getting there. 


Other Ways You Can Help.
Attend! Please come to any event. Check the website for details and pre-register for events as the route is confirmed. 
Spread the word! There is the big country out there and lots of people who I know will want to support this mission. If you can help me find them, thank you!
I Felt The Spark. 

This tour is being organized by Seek Your Course, an online resource of creative opportunities for adults. Seek Your Course features a database of learning opportunities on a wide range of creative-related topics.

story:
Hi, My name is Elizabeth Stehling. My recent video artworks explore folk dance and human relationships.  Currently, I am producing and directing an Israeli folk dance video that will be held at Slater Hall in Greenville, South Carolina.  I aim for the video to represent a desire for communication with the foreign, as if the dancers are learning a new language.

After a visit to Israel and also learning about the folk dance community here in the Carolinas, I began to learn more about Israeli folk dancing with the help of the Greenville and Clemson International Folk Dancers.  Israeli dances consist of an active archive of over 4,000 dances with traditions from Spanish, Chasidic, Moroccan, Yemenite, and Greek dances.

I have already received an award grant from the Metropolitan Arts Council of Greenville, SC and need to match it.  I must raise at least $800 to cover my additional expenses including large fan and A/C rentals, speaker and microphone rentals, refreshments for 50 people, and a new heavy-duty hard drive for video editing.

I greatly appreciate any donation.  As a thank-you, I will give you credits in the final video as well as artworks.  Please read the details of the perks on the right-hand column for the specific information.

By donating, you will be supporting and engaging the contemporary art dialogue of new media, dance, and performance.

If you can't donate, there is still an opportunity to be in the video.  I am in need of skilled and unskilled dancers.  Don't worry, it's not difficult and all dances will be taught.  

Visit the Facebook Event Page for more information about participation.  You may also email liz.stehling@gmail.com for any questions.

The video shoot will be held July 15, 2012 from 4-7 pm at Slater Hall, 5 Whitney Street, Slater, SC 29683. Signature of Artist Release Form Required. Refreshments Provided.  Wear casual clothing and comfortable shoes.

The debut video screening will held September 27, 2012 from 5-8 pm at the Hughes Main Greenville Public Library, 25 Heritage Green Place, Greenville, SC 29601.

SPECIAL THANK YOU METROPOLITAN ARTS COUNCIL, CLEMSON INTERNATIONAL FOLK DANCERS, GREENVILLE INTERNATIONAL FOLK DANCERS, AND STEVE SNELL ON THE CAMERA.

PLEASE SUPPORT THIS PROJECT!

-Thank you, 

Elizabeth Stehling

www.elizabethstehling.com 

Biography

Elizabeth Stehling was born in Charlotte, North Carolina and makes project-based visual art using video, dance, and drawing.  She graduated from Pratt Institute’s Studio Art program in Brooklyn, New York with her M.F.A. in 2010.  She completed her B.A. in Studio Art at the College of Charleston in Charleston, South Carolina in 2005.  Her work has been included in numerous group exhibitions such as, Prime Time, the New Media Wing debut at the Asheville Art Museum, in Asheville, NC (on view until September 2012).  She has also exhibited in Berlin, Germany; Tel Aviv, Israel; Chicago; New York City; and throughout the Upstate, SC.  She is an adjunct professor of drawing and art appreciation at Spartanburg Community College and USC Upstate in SC.  When not teaching, she continues to make artworks from short meditations on situational problems.  Her current works use folk dances as structures to explore limitations of human interactions and group dynamics.

story:
Our Story

Each month Benjamin "IQ" Sanders presents Muddy Rivers Slam, a Brunswick based competition that has gives poets the opportunity to test their mettle against professional and amateur artists alike. Tough but fun comps are the name of the game; supporting your fellow poets while showing off your best game. The Slam is currently held at Noise Bar.

Part of the Muddy dream has always been to send a five person team to the PSI National Poetry Slam in the U.S. Already IQ has assisted Luka Lesson in getting to 2010 Individual World Poetry Slam and Bronwyn Lovell in getting to 2011 World of Women Poetry Slam. Now it's time for NPS.

NPS is the biggest of all, bigger than one of those ancient turtles that grant wishes to small children on solo round the world kayaking adventures. Those big Leatherback things. They're endangered, like poets. And really big. Unlike poets who are often quite small, but unfortunately still require a whole seat each on a plane. Which is very expensive.

The Impact

This is history in the making. We will be the FIRST Slam team from Australia to compete in the U.S. Nationals. That's huge. We'll also be one of the first poetry groups in Australia to pull off something this big (financially) using online tools like IndieGogo. And potentially this is a great media lead up to the 2011 Overload Poetry Festival in September.


What We Need & What You Get

Flights are approximately $1600 return p/p. We can get cheap backpacker accom. for $30 p/p p/n. Then there's food, travel costs and of course beer. You're not allowed to be in Boston and not drink beer, it's a law there, trust me.


What we're asking is that our friends and fellow poets pitch in just a couple of dollars (literally) to get us there. We can do it with your help and we can win this fucker. We're not asking for big hunks of cash that we know you don't have - chuck us the price of a coffee or just what ever you can. We're a community, we help each other out, same as it's always been. This time we need to raise that support with a real sense of urgency, but we do know a lot of people so we're confident.


As to what you get? Aside from the rosy glow of supporting a group of hardworking artists, you get an invite to the kick arse party we're going to throw when we get back. Win or lose, there will be a party. But we are going to win and when we do that party is going to go right off.


Other Ways You Can Help

We don't have a lot of time, 9 days in total before we have to be on a plane (at the latest). This is a total chaos mission. We need you to help us send this super-viral. Email, Facebook, Myspace, Twitter, SMS, word of mouth; anything that gets the eyes on this page and the dollars in the bank is pure golden.

story:
Hello Indiegogo!

While my collaborator Joshua Dawson has run a few successful campaigns, this is my first. I have an introduction about myself at the bottom of the campaign story, but I think the one important thing I’d like you to know about me is that trust and reliability are two of my most closely held values. If you like what you see, back this campaign with the confidence of knowing we have the experience, tooling and materials on hand to deliver the perks on time.

 

Ho’onalu - go with the flow. The Hawaiian language is very poetic and the name of this top embodies the meditative feeling I experience while spinning this top.  

For this collaboration our objective was to create a pocketable, long spinning top with clean lines and my unique “look”.  The design leverages over three years of experience making custom tops, one at a time on my Logan 1917 manual lathe. The execution leverages Joshua’s experience creating his own tops on his Mazak machining center.

 

 

Our combination of fundamentally sound design and meticulous execution creates a spinning top that delivers on the design objectives. The stem is machined with my signature look, the Simonich-style GunnerGrip, which provides visual appeal both static and spinning but most importantly facilitates traction between your fingers and the top for a great launch.

With it’s low design it is definitely not a “beginners” top, but with practice, backers should be able to hit spin time exceeding 10 minutes when spun on a smooth glass lens. If you are new to precision spinning tops, check out this link on spin technique: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N8GdFXx25Qw

 

To create a long spinning top you want the most dense (heaviest) material possible on the outer weight ring and the least dense (lightest) material at the core. Those to elements along with good design, sets the center of gravity low and the rotational inertia high.

MT185 tungsten was chosen for it’s high density - at 97% tungsten it comes in over 8% higher density than the 90% pure alloys (https://www.tungsten.com/products/tungsten-alloy/).  

While physics indicates that a less dense core material, like aluminum paired with a highly dense material like tungsten, would yield the longest spin times, through prototyping and testing we found copper, brass and stainless steel cores produced a more stable top with minimal sacrifice to spin time.

 

Ho’onalu Specs

Body: MT185 alloy Tungsten, .740” diameter

  • Machine finished or Flame blackened

Core Options: Copper, Brass, Stainless Steel, 0.185” diameter at stem w/ GunnerGrip texture

Bearing: .125” ceramic ball

Overall Height: .85”

Mass:

  • Ho’onalu w/ Copper Core - 30.7gr
  • Ho’onalu w/ Brass Core - 30.3 gr
  • Ho’onalu w/ Stainless Steel Core - 29.9gr

 

 

Joshua Dawson and I have both been making custom spinning tops since 2014.  This is our first collaboration piece.  I utilized my experience making tungsten mini tops to design Ho’onalu in Autocad Fusion.  Joshua then took my design, translated it into Mazatrol and is crafting them on his Mazak CNC Lathe.

 

The first prototypes were made with brass bodies and brass cores in June, 2017.  We started with brass so Joshua could program and test his machine and we could ensure the design produced a smooth spinner.  I have spun my brass prototype over 8 minutes, Joshua was breaking 10 minutes with his.

The second wave of prototypes was made in MT185 Tungsten and both Brass and Copper to validate that we could indeed make a 10+ minute, ¾” pocket top.  I was getting anywhere from over 10 minutes to 14 minutes with these tungsten protos.  They are currently in the hands of a few collectors who I hope will leave comments with their impressions.

 

 

 

Once we finalized the design, Joshua created pre-production units, which I’ve personally tested and used for the photography in this campaign.

Machining will start on these while the campaign is running in order to help get these delivered as quickly as possible.  Joshua ordered enough tungsten to make the first 100 tops - which we’ll be able to deliver in October, if not sooner.  If we surpass backing to produce more than 100 tops I will add additional Perks for a second batch that will come 30-60 days after the first batch.  The timing of the second batch is driven by lead time on the specific grade of tungsten we’ve chosen.

When Joshua finishes machining the tops, they will come to me in Oregon, to get a satin finished tip like on my customs, as well as final inspection and shipping.  

We would really appreciate your support in backing my first Indiegogo campaign.  Just hover over the option in the right hand column and click “Get This Perk”.

Please share this campaign with anyone who would appreciate a well designed, precision crafted top.

Keep in Touch

 

If you have any questions, don’t hesitate to ask - just scroll to the top and click on the comments to ask - I should be able to get back to you quickly.

For more information about our work, check out:

https://www.facebook.com/mitchlumMachined

https://www.facebook.com/groups/mitchlumMachined

https://www.instagram.com/mitchlum/

https://www.facebook.com/joshuadawsonprecisions...

https://www.facebook.com/groups/joshuadawsonpre...

https://www.instagram.com/dawson_precision_spin...

 

About Me

I was born and raised in Hawaii.  As a high schooler my first job was in a high end custom stereo shop where a creative eye and the utmost attention to detail was critical for the elaborate installations we did.  I carried these early learnings with me to the mainland where I went to college and grad school getting my formal education in electrical engineering.

I have been a hobby machinist for over a decade and a half, mostly making custom rings and pens in Timascus until March 2014, when I made my first spinning top.  I thought I might make 10, optimistically 20 tops before I ran out of friends and family who would want them.  After over three years, having made 250 tops one at a time on my Logan 1917, I’m extremely excited to collaborate with Joshua to produce a Made in the USA long spinning precision top, at a reasonable price.

Trust and reliability.  As stated in the section at the top - those are two values that are of utmost importance to me - in my personal life, my day job, my hobbies and most importantly to you - on this campaign.  I have plans for future campaigns, and this being my first, I want you to have the confidence that Joshua and I will deliver.  We’ve got material in hand to make the first 100 tops, which will start machining while the campaign is running.  While the delivery date for that first batch states October, we have line of sight for hitting an earlier date.

Precision and artistry.  I became a hobby machinist after a few years of collecting custom knives and meeting some of the most amazing metal artists in the world.  Tight tolerances combined with aesthetically beautiful design and materials selection excite me.  Those aspects of custom knives translate directly into custom tops - which besides making I’m also passionate about collecting.

story:
What's up:

There's a group called "The Experiment in International Living" that offers high school students educational trips to other countries! One of these programs is to Japan, where students learn the art of manga and anime.

The program lasts 4 weeks, from June 28 to July 27.
Days 1-4: Exploring Tokyo
Days 5-17: Animation and Manga Study
Days 18-27: Homestay (living with a Japanese family)
Days 28-29: Program Reflection and Wrap-Up (in Tokyo)
Day 30: Departure

This program is a huge opportunity for me to learn more about animation and the animation industry, as well as travel outside of the US for the first time! I'm not trying to raise all of the money I'll need, only a small portion of it.

More information on the program can be found here.

Where the money's going:

The total cost (including program fee, flight to Japan, flight to LA, and spending money) amounts to $8,506. I've managed to save up a portion of this, as well as received some financial aid, but this unfortunately won't cover the entire cost.

So, I've decided to try to raise some the funds through an online campaign! If you're interested in helping me reach this goal, I have some reward stuff for each donation level. Rewards include drawings, signed prints, T-shirts, and animation commissions. You can check the bar on the left for a full list of rewards!

All money raised, including extra money, will go to the trip.

Other ways you can help:

If your unable to contribute, feel free to share the campaign through Facebook and Twitter and stuff!

story:
Welcome to the East End Gallery, Beverley.

 Hi! How are you? 
Let me tell you a bit about ourselves and our dream. We are Kate and Michael Sofoulis, a fifty-something couple who live in Heavenly Beverley, the best kept secret in the Avon Valley, one hundred and thirty kilometres  east of Perth.
We came here by choice four and a half years ago after Michael was forced to retire from the mining industry due to ill health. In that time, we have renovated a dinky little doer upper house and, three years ago, we bought the Forbes Building, a derelict, 390 square metre 100-year-old building on the main street. Our intention is to create an artists' precinct.
We need your help to finish this project. Michael is a metal artist. He is also chief renovator. With a loan of $100,000 we have poured our hearts and souls into the building. We have run out of money. Michael has complex health issues and receives a Disability Support Pension.We are not eligible for another loan as I was injured at work and I am unable to return to my profession. We are ineligible for other funding as we are the independent owners of the East End Gallery. 
So far, we have renovated three shops, Michael's studio and part of the back two roomed accommodation unit.  The "residence" still needs a kitchen and new floorboards, due to existing holes in the floor.
The Gallery itself has been open since December 2014. We still have to complete the final forty-five square metres to extend the Gallery to its full potential. In addition, the building is moving due to its drying out after decades of neglect. We have repaired all the old cracks; now we have new cracks to revisit.
We also hope to install kitchenettes and bathrooms into the first two shops (each is fifty-seven square metres). We hope, in time, to build mezzanine floors in each of the shops to provide extra living space. That way, we can offer two separate units in Beverley town centre for artists to live and work in. The East End Precinct would then be a reality.
We realise that we have champagne tastes on a lemonade budget. Yet, we feel that we understand the building and her challenges. We are used to being frugal and very imaginative. Our immediate goal is to finish the Gallery so we have one hundred and fifty square metres of  space for Wheatbelt artists.
The Forbes Building was on the point of collapse when we bought her. We couldn't let a building of this age, with her history and character, die. Please be part of this project to finish our building, support Wheatbelt artists and fulfil the dream of our Artists' Precinct.
Many Thanks,
Kate and Michael.
PS please tell your friends about us and pop in for a look!

One of our challenges....

Chief renovator and artist at work...

How to install a new floor...

Another view of the East End Gallery - Autumn Exhibition Opening Night 2 April 2015.





Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Welcome to the East End Gallery, Beverley.
 Hi! How are you? 
Let me tell you a bit about ourselves and our dream. We are Kate and Michael Sofoulis, a fifty-something couple who live in Heavenly Beverley, the best kept secret in the Avon Valley, one hundred and thirty kilometres  east of Perth.
We came here by choice four and a half years ago after Michael was forced to retire from the mining industry due to ill health. In that time, we have renovated a dinky little doer upper house and, three years ago, we bought the Forbes Building, a derelict, 390 square metre 100-year-old building on the main street. Our intention is to create an artists' precinct.
We need your help to finish this project. Michael is a metal artist. He is also chief renovator. With a loan of $100,000 we have poured our hearts and souls into the building. We have run out of money. Michael has complex health issues and receives a Disability Support Pension.We are not eligible for another loan as I was injured at work and I am unable to return to my profession. We are ineligible for other funding as we are the independent owners of the East End Gallery. 
So far, we have renovated three shops, Michael's studio and part of the back two roomed accommodation unit.  The "residence" still needs a kitchen and new floorboards, due to existing holes in the floor.
The Gallery itself has been open since December 2014. We still have to complete the final forty-five square metres to extend the Gallery to its full potential. In addition, the building is moving due to its drying out after decades of neglect. We have repaired all the old cracks; now we have new cracks to revisit.
We also hope to install kitchenettes and bathrooms into the first two shops (each is fifty-seven square metres). We hope, in time, to build mezzanine floors in each of the shops to provide extra living space. That way, we can offer two separate units in Beverley town centre for artists to live and work in. The East End Precinct would then be a reality.
We realise that we have champagne tastes on a lemonade budget. Yet, we feel that we understand the building and her challenges. We are used to being frugal and very imaginative. Our immediate goal is to finish the Gallery so we have one hundred and fifty square metres of  space for Wheatbelt artists.
The Forbes Building was on the point of collapse when we bought her. We couldn't let a building of this age, with her history and character, die. Please be part of this project to finish our building, support Wheatbelt artists and fulfil the dream of our Artists' Precinct.
Many Thanks,
Kate and Michael.
PS please tell your friends about us and pop in for a look!


One of our challenges....


Chief renovator and artist at work...


How to install a new floor...


Another view of the East End Gallery - Autumn Exhibition Opening Night 2 April 2015.

story:
Our story about P.S. I Miss You:

If you ever had someone you cherish, read this......

This is my first ever Indiegogo project and I hope that you will support my little project that was inspired by some of the most precious person in my life.

After a series of sad abrupt departures recently, I was left to pick up the pieces in my life and to move on without saying a “former goodbye”. I vividly remember some of the wonderful moments with the departed and regretted that I had not done enough when my loved ones were still within reach.

These series of incident got me thinking about how we can really create something for everyone to show appreciation for their loved ones. At the same time, this “Gift” should be one that will ensure that we do not leave our loved ones without a word in the event when life steals us away.

The Start of The Final Gift

The idea of a traditional old style handwritten letter evolved. Stored in some place safe, this letter will allow the “Depositor” to deposit a letter that will only be sent to the intended person in the event he passed away. It is like leaving a legacy behind. This intended person, the “RECIPIENT” will know what the depositor would like to say….

To ensure the letter is known and not lost in the “safehouse”, the idea of “KEEPERs” began. KEEPERs safeguard the arrangement and make sure that in the event the Recipient does not remember the arrangement, they are there to remind the Recipient of the last letter.

The concept behind the FINAL GIFT is created.....

We added additional items to ensure that the Final Gift is a world class arrangement worthy of any users who only want the best for their cherished ones. We respect this inspiration that we are pursuing and we make sure, even if it was the sleepless night or multiple revisions to the drawing boards and plans, we continue to develop the FINAL GIFT to the same standard like we respect this notion. Our commitment is that we will only launch our FINAL GIFT if and only if we want to use it ourselves.

Now, the FINAL GIFT is 100% ready after a year. We make sure that we include all the necessary items to create the best FINAL GIFT for your cherished ones in The Final Gift Pack. We are ready to push it to mass production but require your support.

Aim 

We want to share our project with the community as it is based on cherishing each and every loved ones in our life. Not tomorrow or only Christmas but TODAY and NOW. We strongly believe every person should have someone the Final Gift is meant for.

  • We require the funding in order to push our product to mass-launch. We have 45 finished products for our first batch of the Final Gift as “Ground Zero”.
  • All for one and one for all. Share your testimonials of the times when you wished that someone could have left some words of relief behind.
  • Volunteer to help us to make videos revolving around this concept of “cherishness”.

Stretched Goals

If we hit USD 5,000, we will personally make a video (something you saw in our video list) to be sent exclusively to all contributors for you to send to your special cherished ones this Christmas. We will throw in a specially sourced sticker in every Final Gift Pack for you to decorate your letter better.

If we hit USD 6,000, we will place additional funding to subsidise a pilot project on integrating the less privileged into our value chain to create employment for them. Tentative ideas include getting them to prepare the Final Gift and getting them to help administer the Final Gift in our vault.

If we hit USD 8,000, we aim to create a video to inspire people to cherish their loved ones. We hope to collaborate with the local institutions in media production to show our support to the arts and videography.

    Gratuity

    P.S. Envelopes for your cherished ones

    Exclusive P.S. notebook

    Customisable P.S. Accessory

    Know Us More

      Like Us on Facebook

    For questions regarding The Final Gift Pack, drop us a note at ethan@psimissyou.com .

    Drop us a note too if you like to help us in becoming our ambassador.

    Risk & Challenges

    The challenge is getting people to discuss openly about the topic of potential mishaps. We sometimes underestimate the likelihood that something may just happen abruptly in life to us or our loved ones until we really experience them.
    This is the biggest challenge that we faced but we strongly feel that The Final Gift is also an opportunity for people to show their cherished ones that they appreciate them and are thinking ahead for them.
