story:
Constantly Consuming Culture--The Waterfront is a pair of art shows sponsored by Mapanare.us. The show will take place first in Miami, then in Chicago and feature artists from both areas. There will be painters, multimedia, music, video and performance work. The show will be open over a weekend at a party.The show will then move to Chicago a couple of months after the Miami Show.

Invest in the success of talented artists.

The idea behind these shows is two-fold; We want to introduce artists from one area to the other and  to provide small shows where artists not represented by galleries don't have to PAY to have their work shown. Artists won't pay "hanging fees” or a percentage of any sale to anyone. They get all the money (the only POSSIBLE fee might be something nominal for transportation...and if we make enough money with this? They won't even have to pay that).

The money will be used to rent the space, pay for insurance, set up the space, hang the art, transport the art (transporting art across the country is expensive), pay for various non-sponsored refreshments and promotion of the event.

The event will consist of an opening night and remain open a few days after (ideally a Friday opening and remain open Saturday and Sunday). If we raise enough money or get appropriate sponsors we may have some sort of brunch event during the day.

Artists tentatively include:

Chicago-John Airo, Gretchen Hasse, Elyse Martin, Julia Hamilton, Mikey Peterson and Tim Larson

Miami-Talia Ore, Kimberly Fitzgerald, Barry Bugarin and Caridad Sola (of Miami but now in NYC).

More artists will be added and artists are subject to change.

story:
PASSAGE & PLACE is a multimedia visual arts exhibition, book project, and skillshare series that explores displacement & movement, freedom & incarceration, and home & im/migration at the intersection of queerness.

For the PASSAGE & PLACE print project we have compiled a collection of written and visual artwork from queer and trans folx both inside and outside of prison, that consider and complicate the topic of "Home". Some contributers include Virgie Tovar (author of Hot & Heavy), Leah Lakshmi Piepzna-Samarasinha (author of Consentual Genocide, editor of The Revolution Starts at Home), Heidi Andrea Rhodes (co-founder & editor of Reveries & Rage), Veronica Stein (Fabulous Brown Works), Jacks McNamara (author of Inbetweenland, co-founder of The Icarus Project), Banah Ghadbian (Feminist Wire), and more!

As part of reaching beyond walls, we partnered with the TGI (Transgender | Gender Variant | Intersex) Justice Project/TGIJP and Black & Pink to send the Passage & Place call for submissions to currently incarcerated LGBTQ prisoners. We received over 100 letters, poems, and artwork!

A collection of these letters and images will be bound and printed into an anthology released in conjunction with the Passage & Place exhibition at the National Queer Arts Festival, 2014. All participants from the inside will receive a free copy of the finished book.

Your donations will support us in sending this book to the printers! Your donations will help us cover mailing costs so that contributors who are currently locked up can receive copies of the finished publication!

Our anticipated mailing costs for sending free copies to incarcerated contributors is $400 alone. Help us remind our queer family behind bars that their voices are still loud, fierce, and being heard!


$ M O N E Y $

It probably won't come as a surprise that funding for the arts is really, really limited -- and especially hard to come by for projects rooted in queer narratives and foregrounded by the voices of incarcerated queer and trans folks. The Passage & Place exhibition at the National Queer Arts Festival is funded in part by the Queer Cultural Center, and the book, as an axillary project, depends on support from Y O U.

Transparency notes: Our goal for this campaign is $1200, but we actually need more than that! We set the goal low to guarantee that we hit it and to minimize the fees taken off the top. The actual cost breakdown is approximately $1200 to print, $400 to mail copies into prisons, and an additional $100 to mail to contributors on the outside. We're volunteering the time we spend organizing, curating, publicizing, transcribing, and designing the book! If, through your amazing support, we raise more than our printing/mailing costs, the extra money will be donated to the TGI Justice Project -- to support their work of providing legal support and empowering a membership base that is largely trans women of color -- and Black & Pink -- to support their work advocating for, supporting, acting as a hub for penpals & information, and connecting "free world" allies to LGBTQ prisoners.


▼ P E R K S ▼

▼ MORE WAYS TO HELP ▼

Email this page to all your friends! 

Put it on blast on your Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter, Grindr, Instagram, OKCupid, etc/whatever! 

Invite everyone you know to the show!


Curators/Editors:

Lex Non Scripta is a 34 year old, working-class, trans/genderqueer/dandy multi-media artist, curator, and activist from the shores of the San Francisco Bay. Having lived in over 34 different homes throughout the U.S. over the course of their life, they are interested in exploring the ways that transience and displacement inform how we navigate the world, and how we build, sustain and invest in community. lexnonscripta.com & wildfancydesign.etsy.com

Annah Anti-Palindrome is a 32 year old queer/femme who was raised in the rural, working-class craters at the base of the sierra foothills. She is interested in exploring the ways that her home of origin constructed her early sense of self, as well as the ways that separation from that home (via juvenile detention centers, addiction, rehabilitation clinics, travel and relocation) have displaced her from that original sense of self over time. She is interested in exploring the ways we are often required to reclaim and redefine ourselves as we move (by force or choice) further away from what we once knew home to be. annahantipalindrome.com

mailing costs so that contributors who are currently locked up can 
receive copies of the finished publication!Our anticipated mailing costs for sending free copies to incarcerated contributors is $400 alone. Help us remind our queer family behind bars that their voices are still loud, fierce, and being heard!$ M O N E Y $It probably won't come as a surprise that funding for the arts is really, really limited -- and especially hard to come by for projects rooted in queer narratives and foregrounded by the voices of incarcerated queer and trans folks. The Passage & Place exhibition at the National Queer Arts Festival is funded in part by the Queer Cultural Center, and the book, as an axillary project, depends on support from Y O U.Transparency notes: Our goal for this campaign is $1200, but we actually need more than that! We set the goal low to guarantee that we hit it and to minimize the fees taken off the top. The actual cost breakdown is approximately $1200 to print, $400 to mail copies into prisons, and an additional $100 to mail to contributors on the outside. We're volunteering the time we spend organizing, curating, publicizing, transcribing, and designing the book! If, through your amazing support, we raise more than our printing/mailing costs, the extra money will be donated to the TGI Justice Project -- to support their work of providing legal support and empowering a membership base that is largely trans women of color -- and Black & Pink -- to support their work advocating for, supporting, acting as a hub for penpals & information, and connecting "free world" allies to LGBTQ prisoners.▼ P E R K S ▼▼ MORE WAYS TO HELP ▼Email this page to all your friends! 
Put it on blast on your Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter, Grindr, Instagram, OKCupid, etc/whatever! 
Invite everyone you know to the show!
Curators/Editors: Lex Non Scripta is a 34 year old, working-class, 
trans/genderqueer/dandy multi-media artist, curator, and activist from the shores of the San Francisco Bay. Having lived in over 34 different homes throughout the U.S. over the course of their life, they are interested in exploring the ways that transience and displacement inform how we navigate the world, and how we build, sustain and invest in community. lexnonscripta.com & wildfancydesign.etsy.comAnnah Anti-Palindrome is a 32 year old queer/femme who was raised
in the rural, working-class craters at the base of the sierra
foothills. She is interested in exploring the ways that her home of
origin constructed her early sense of self, as well as the ways that
separation from that home (via juvenile detention centers, addiction,
rehabilitation clinics, travel and relocation) have displaced her
from that original sense of self over time. She is interested in
exploring the ways we are often required to reclaim and redefine
ourselves as we move (by force or
choice) further away from what we once knew home to be. annahantipalindrome.com

story:
-The Sacramento Zombie Walk is an annual and much anticipated summer event in Downtown Sacramento. Started in 2001, the Zombie Walk was a promotional event for the Trash Film Orgy Film Festival, but has recently evolved into a stand-alone event.

-The Zombie Walk is a large-scale performance art experience where citizens dress up as the undead and infiltrate the streets of downtown. TFO Productions is credited with hosting the World’s Oldest Annual Zombie Walk and helping to create what has since become a worldwide phenomenon*.

-This year’s Zombie Walk is scheduled to take place on Saturday, August 26th and will include the CARNIVAL OF THE DEAD and an FREE outdoor screening of George Romero's 1968 undead masterpiece ‘NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD’ (updated 7-18-17). The Carnival will take place at Roosevelt Park and will feature live music, food trucks, professional make-up stations, zombie sports, dancing, carnival games, vendors, contests, prizes and much more!  The WALK will infiltrate the exciting R Street Corridor, complete with Undead Marching Band, then return to the park for the film.

-Due to the increased popularity of Zombies in popular culture, the TFO Zombie Walk has grown dramatically over the last few years. To meet this demand, event organizers are working closely with city officials and local businesses to keep this event safe, fun and FREE for zombies and spectators of all ages.

-While it is exciting and humbling to have created such a successful event, it also means that the costs of producing an event of this size have also grown accordingly. The Sacramento Zombie Walk NEEDS YOUR HELP to continue this tradition in Sacramento. With the necessary expansions this year, costs have again increased and organizers need to raise $5000.00 to cover hard costs alone (permits, police street closures, security, insurance, porta-potties, waste management and entertainment costs).

-For contributing, not only do you know that you are helping continue this exciting tradition of the Undead in Sacramento, but we'll also throw in some fun and unique perks for donating to the cause. Every dollar raised will go toward making this event even more awesome and exciting than any other year!  

-Please help TFO celebrate 17 years of Zombie Walks in Sacramento, take over a city park and fill the streets with the Undead to make this the biggest and best local ZOMBIE event ever! Contribute if you can and please share and repost.

NOTE: Most Perks will be available for pick up AT the 2017 ZOMBIE WALK August 26, 2017. If you are unable to attend, delivery can be arranged.

**Paintings will be 11x14 on Canvas, donor must provide photo reference. Finished art will be delivered by June 30, 2018

***To receive Carnival Tickets and Zombie Make-Up perks, you must attend the event Aug. 26th

*http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zombie_walk

story:
We Need a Projector

The Shed has the opportunity to exhibit the work of Lynn Hunter, but will need to purchase a video projector for the exhibition. The budget for this project includes the cost of a projector, and a modest honorarium for the artist. The video projector will remain the property of The Shed, and can be used for future exhibitions as well. 

In her work, performance artist Lynn Hunter risks trusting the viewer. Her physically and emotionally vulnerable endurance pieces are steeped in the shared empathy between herself and those present for the performance. Viewers of her work confront their feelings towards the endurance of the everyday Black woman. A conversation which is specific and distinct to each individual, given their own relationship to Black imagination, pain, and triumph.

For her solo exhibition at The Shed, Hunter will perform one of her Grounded burial pieces, in which the artist lies on the ground buried under soil. Artifacts from this performance will remain in the space prior to and after the performance and a video projection on the ceiling adds context to the events in the space. Viewers may experience this work by witnessing Hunter’s live performance, or they may place themselves in the center of the work, lying in a hammock that will stand in place of the artist during the remainder of the exhibition.

About Lynn Hunter

Lynn Hunter is a multimedia performance artist and Baltimore native. Her work inspires empathy and engages audiences in deconstructing their preconceptions of amerikan identity and Black culture while exploring new boundaries of imagination and Black presence. Hunter earned a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree concentrated in Photography from the Maryland Institute College of Art. She has held internships at the Aperture Foundation in New York City and at the Baltimore Museum of Art. She has exhibited in Labbodies’ Annual Performance Art Reviews, Artscape, Free Fall Baltimore, Motor House, Eubie Blake, and several local collectives. Lynn recently completed a residency at the Lemon Tree House in Cetona, Italy.

About The Shed

The Shed is an artist-run exhibition space in the backyard of Baltimore artist, Bonnie Crawford. Crawford opened The Shed as a space where artists can exhibit their work through the pandemic, when traditional exhibition opportunities have been scarce.

story:
As of March 11th, I have applied and been accepted to participate in the Digital Stone Project in the Garfagnana Region of Tuscany, Italy. Through this program, I will be carving a sculpture out of marble with a 7-axis robot, then spending 27 days hand finishing the piece.  As a full time Graduate Student  and aspiring artist, this program allows me the unique opportunity to work with artists and designers from around the world, making invaluable connections with students from Yale, Bennington College, New York Institute of Technology, and others, as well as professional artists. At the end of the program there will be a conference on digital fabrication of art and design, and group exhibition, where the work will be displayed in the town center of Pietrasanta, Italy for six weeks.  

This program runs from June 4th to July 3rd, and is all inclusive. The total amount for me to participate in this program will be approximately $7526.35, which includes travel.  I have applied for and been awarded scholarships from Autodesk and The Center for New Art, and am looking for additional support to help make this happen.  As mentioned in the video, this project has been very inspiring, and I have been working to create limited edition prints to give in exchange for donations.  Thank you so much for your support, if you can't donate financially, please share this page with your friends.

story:
Every year we add even more amazing Goddesses to our ranks and it gets harder and harder to figure out how to include as many as possible in the calendar campaign.  Last year we had Goddesses create Epic Archetypes such as school girl and magical girl; this year we wanted to bring you the best of the best in images and also include as many Goddesses as we could. So we are spicing things up for something a bit different.

These year's theme is WET.  Each of our participating Goddesses is in the works creating an image that best utilizes some form of water, goo, slime, milk, even sweat and blood.  We've got our bases covered for the best calendar yet!  Below you'll find an early submission  ready for viewing from the always awesome Lady Toxica in a preview of her calendar image.

The 2016 Calendar will be a standard 12 month calendar with a centerfold.  Despite this, we have 17 Goddesses participating in the Calendar Campaign.  Each of these lovely ladies will be shooting and submitting an image for possible inclusion in the calendar, along with a lovely portrait similar to last year.  Each of these images will  be offered as prints for purchase (either through one of our campaign perks or afterwards).  The best of the best, a total of 14 images (12 months, 1 Centerfold, and a Cover image) will be used in the calendar.  This allows us to give everyone a chance to participate and will allow us to provide our fans with some truly amazing prints we wouldn't be able to produce otherwise. 

Our Goal includes the cost of paying models, photographers, photo editors and getting the calendars printed.  Why so much you might ask? This year’s project has 17 Goddesses producing 17 Images. That's 17 different Goddesses that all need to be paid and nearly as many photographers.  In order to make these amazing images possible we’ve again enlisted the help of our very own Kassandra Leigh and we need to make sure she gets paid for all the hard work she’ll be giving us.

We will be offering prints of each Goddess, including portrait images similar to last year.  If you make your purchase during the campaign you can save, especially if you buy one of our print packs.

Choose From: Alice Malice, Faylin Lynx, Maygin, Minnie d'Moocha, Nana Valtiel, Nerdee, Stephanie Marie or Pigeon Foo

Of course, if our supporters are generous we can add and do even more amazing things.  Every penny we receive will go right back into making GeekGoddess even better and giving our fans even more geeky goodness.  

$7,250: Door Hanger: Backers of $50 or more will get a GeekGoddess door hanger

$7,500: 3 Girl Set: Unlock Brittnie Jade x Alice Malice x Jessica Nova in a brand new 3 girl XMen themed shoot 

$8,000: Free Surprise Print.  Receive a unreleased surprise print as a bonus for backing.  Anyone who donated at least $25 will receive a free 4x6.  Those who donated at $50 and above receive a free 8x10.  

$8,500: Geek Goddess Beach Balls:  Backers of $50 or more will get a GeekGoddess Beach Ball.  Supplies are limited.  If we have more backers than balls the early backer gets the ball ;). 

$9,000: Clothing Perks: T-Shirts, Undies and possibly more produced 

$9,500: New GeekGoddess Lanyard: New Lanyard Design Produced

$10,000:  Goddess Polaroid: Backers of $50 or more will get an autographed Polaroid mailed to them.

$10,500: NEW LANYARD FOR BACKERS! Backers of $50 or more will all get one of the new lanyards included in their order

$11,000: Exclusive Backers only Images:  Backers of $100 or more will get access to exclusive images of Jessica Nova from an unreleased set 

$12,000: Crop Top Goddesses: Backers of $100 or more will be sent a Polaroid of one of our goddesses modeling our new GeekGoddess Crop Top and Panties

$15,000: Go Web Go: Unlock for More Details

$16,000: Full GeekGoddess themed dice set produced

$18,000: Backers of $100 or more will receive the full GeekGoddess dice set

$20,000: Gifts from the Goddess: Unlock for More Details

$25,000: Mount Olympus: Unlock for more details

Are you looking for a custom perk?  Maybe you want to add a dice onto a Calendar.  When you select a perk you'll notice that you have the ability to add on additional funds to your donation.   While this most often gets used to add on shipping for our international backers there is no reason it can't be used to add on a little something extra.    If you are looking to add any of the following to your perk please use the price points below. 

$5: GeekGoddess D6, D20 or Button
$10: GeekGoddess Lanyard
$10: 2016 Calendar
$12: Individual Print/Portrait

story:
FER DE LYS

Le dessin de «Fer de Lys» fut d'abord imaginé comme symbole identitaire de la communauté de Burners du Québec en unifiant le Lys du drapeau québécois et le symbole légendaire de Burning Man. 

Équipe

L'équipe de conception et de fabrication :

  •  Arno : Midnight Poutine [2014, 2015]
  •  Alaric : Portage [2012], Neighbourhood [2014], Fire Tetris [2015]
  •  Sam : Charnival [2015]

Besoin

 L'essentiel pour la réalisation du projet: 

  • Propane +++
  • Tuyauterie + Raccord + Régulateur + travail du métal
  • Transport

La suite ?

Le projet «Fer de Lys» représente un exercise préliminaire de coordination entre les  membres de l'équipe. Il s'agit de notre premier projet ensemble.
Nous aurons plusieurs autre projets très ambitieux à vous présenter très prochainement.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


FER DE LYS

The «Fer de Lys» sketch was first imagined to symbolize the Québec burners' identity as a community. It joins the Québec flag's Fleur de Lys and the legendary Burning Man symbol.

Team

Conception and production team :

  •  Arno : Midnight Poutine [2014, 2015]
  •  Alaric : Portage [2012], Neighbourhood [2014], Fire Tetris [2015]
  •  Sam : Charnival [2015]

Needs

 The essentials for the realisation of the project :

  • Propane +++
  • Piping + Fitting + Regulator + Metal working
  • Transport

What's next ?

«Fer de Lys» is our first project together and we see it as a preliminary exercise of coordination between the team members' respective strengths. 

We have other ambitious projects to show you very soon.

Le dessin de «Fer de Lys» fut d'abord imaginé comme symbole identitaire de la communauté de Burners du Québec en unifiant le Lys du drapeau québécois et le symbole légendaire de Burning Man. 

Équipe

L'équipe de conception et de fabrication :

 Arno : Midnight Poutine [2014, 2015]
 Alaric : Portage [2012], Neighbourhood [2014], Fire Tetris [2015]
 Sam : Charnival [2015]

Besoin

 L'essentiel pour la réalisation du projet: 

Propane +++
Tuyauterie + Raccord + Régulateur + travail du métal

Transport



La suite ?Le projet «Fer de Lys» représente un exercise préliminaire de coordination entre les  membres de l'équipe. Il s'agit de notre premier projet ensemble.
Nous aurons plusieurs autre projets très ambitieux à vous présenter très prochainement.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



FER DE LYS

The «Fer de Lys» sketch was first imagined to symbolize the Québec burners' identity as a community. It joins the Québec flag's Fleur de Lys and the legendary Burning Man symbol.



Team
Conception and production team :

 Arno : Midnight Poutine [2014, 2015]
 Alaric : Portage [2012], Neighbourhood [2014], Fire Tetris [2015]
 Sam : Charnival [2015]

Needs

 The essentials for the realisation of the project :

Propane +++
Piping + Fitting + Regulator + Metal working
Transport


What's next ?

«Fer de Lys» is our first project together and we see it as a preliminary exercise of coordination between the team members' respective strengths. 
We have other ambitious projects to show you very soon.

story:
Who We Are:

I, Alexander Sedaca, began to travel and tattoo everywhere from Florida to Illinois, Michigan to New York not long after getting my degree in graphic design from the Art Institute of Tampa. I made my way back to New Orleans nearly three years ago after realizing I very much missed the city I grew up in. I have had successful art shows in the past, and I have consistently pursued knowledge and refined my craft in tattooing. I came up with the idea for Sailor's Cross Tattoo & Gallery after noticing the missing connection between artists and tattooists.


What We Will Do:

Sailor's Cross will be the first of its kind in New Orleans. It will provide the highest quality custom tattooing for serious collectors, tattooing of everything from traditional/neo-traditional to black and grey all while in a clean, welcoming, and laid back environment. Sailor's Cross will also be a current, full-time art gallery for walk-in/walk-through business; it will provide an avenue for both known and unknown local and national artists to display their work in a manner that will gain them recognition and support.

Sailor's Cross and I intend to be readily and increasingly involved in community events: hosting events such as benefits for local charities, openings for up-and-coming local artists, concerts, and much more. We want to provide a positive light to the tattoo industry and what it represents in our modern age.


What We Need:

In order to make this happen, we need your help! The expected opening date of Sailor's Cross is May 31, 2014. The start-up costs are approximately $10,660. This money will help pay for a venue, promotions, furniture/fixtures, supplies, permits, etc. Please contribute, and don't forget to spread the word; share our campaign link on your social media, and make sure to tell everyone you know! Help bring Sailor's Cross to life in New Orleans, where it surely will be one of a kind.


Don't forget to view our gallery!

Also check out our Twitter, YouTube, and Instagram; make sure you subscribe and follow!

story:
NEW PRIZE ***

What happens when something on the internet becomes tangible? When experiments leap off the screen and into real space? What shifts occur in our psyches?

CONTENT is an exhibition that connects the art of the essay, poetry, fiction, photography, drawing, sculpture, video, film, music, and performance - all culled from the internet. Hosted by ATHICA: Athens Institute for Contemporary Art, the curators, Darin Beasley (Marco Polo Arts Mag, Tiger Train) and Hope Hilton (Artistic Director, ATHICA), are bringing the world to Athens, Georgia, USA on September 7, 2013.

Featuring over 70 national and international artists from France, Germany, Mexico, Japan, Spain, London, Austria, Italy, United Arab Emirites, Portugal, Ireland, Africa, and the US, the alchemy of CONTENT is in bringing artists together from all over the world via the web, and then placing their work in an exhibition space. 

Although the dawn of the internet has graced us with more global perspectives philosophically, we believe that we also crave the physical accounts of current ideas. The event of curating beyond pixeled space results in an unusually personal international conversation and inspires a new wave of thinking and collaborating in reality. With the ease of technology we are able to connect beyond previously prohibitive boundaries and have the ability to collaborate via email, social media, and websites to make conversations happen from all points of the globe. Artists, writers, and thinkers together have a platform that is both global and intimate, usually without the restrictions and degradation of politics, religion, and war. Arthur Clarke pronounced that “Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.” This is our launching pad.

We are setting a precedent for exhibiting international artists alongside national and local artists in our small city. Please join us in creating an artist residency, printing a full-color publication, bringing world-renowned poets to read, and assisting with shipping expenses to make our exhibition come to life. You can help us create a global art conversation in Athens, Georgia. 

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

WHAT WE NEED

  • To host an Artist Residency Program & World Premiere of a performance created specifically for CONTENT with London-based collective Coffee & Sponge - $3000
  • Limited-edition, full color publication that includes frameable artwork & writing by each CONTENT participant - $3000
  • Travel expenses, shipping expenses, accommodations, stipends, and per diems for visiting artists and poets - $8000

WHAT WE HAVE

  • $3000 on behalf of ATHICA (thank you!) to cover installation fees, projector rental, insurance, events, & half of our publication

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

WHAT YOU RECEIVE

$1 - facebook shout-out on CONTENT page + thanks in the CONTENT publication

$10 - handwritten postcard from an artist in Athens, Georgia, USA + facebook shout-out + thanks in the CONTENT publication

$25 - limited-edition pencil designed by Hope Hilton + handwritten postcard from Athens, Georgia, USA + facebook shout-out + thanks in the CONTENT publication

$50 - limited-edition & collectible 8x8” c-print by artist Kristin Karch + limited-edition pencil designed by Hope Hilton + handwritten postcard from Athens, Georgia, USA + facebook shout-out + thanks in the CONTENT publication

$100 - limited-edition full color artist publication + limited-edition c-print by artist Kristin Karch + limited-edition pencil designed by Hope Hilton + hand-written postcard from Athens, Georgia, USA + facebook shout-out + thanks in the CONTENT publication

$500 - all of the above plus a custom poster printed in collaboration with Double Dutch Press by Darin Beasley and Hope Hilton and a Life Drawing Workshop with Coffee+Sponge

$1000 - all of the above plus a print from Smokey Road Press, an original short film from Coffee+Sponge, + an Instant Art Collection (!!!) which includes a 5-piece collection of art by Athens artists 

 

ABOUT THE RESIDENCY

We take great joy in inviting Coffee & Sponge to Athens to be the inaugural artists in our artist-in-residence program. Their work was selected due to our joint commonalities and interests, in particular their interest in collaborating with our immediate community to create work specific to our location and its similarities and distinctions with their community in Bow, London. The host gallery, ATHICA, is located in a popular but low-income warehouse district that hosts a variety of creative enterprises and the participation of Coffee & Sponge is invaluable - they will not only bring the dedication and perseverance that we cherish, but their conceptual backbone and interest in making the global local will enrich our community for years to come.

The first week of residency will comprise of Coffee & Sponge getting to know Athens and its environs and people. When the research is ready, their studio hours will be held daily through September 22, with technical rehearsals happening September 23-26 and the world premiere of their new work debuting on September 28 at ATHICA*.

The first of its kind in Athens, the curators of CONTENT are arranging the following as part of our artist-in-residence program:

  • a work studio for one month with close proximity to the gallery that includes a part-time studio assistant/intern as well as a volunteer crew for installation/tech/sound

  • living accommodations in the neighborhood of the gallery

  • the opportunity to teach up to 10 workshops in the gallery with the rental fee waived

  • figure drawing classes for adults in various university settings & in the gallery

  • figure drawing classes for children in the gallery

  • featured work in a full-color exhibition catalogue printed in an edition of 250

* Should we not reach our entire goal, all funds will go to the exhibition and publication as well as to artist stipends and shipping of artwork, and we will reintroduce our efforts in the future to create this very important residency

THE IMPACT - YOUR IMPACT - OF BRING THE GLOBAL LOCAL

Athens, Georgia is a small city with unique and inventive cultural production and we aim to nurture a more global view and influence. With your contribution, we are able to access art that is otherwise only accessible via the internet, and create a conversation that impacts our city, propelling it into the global conversation about art for years to come. With the inclusion of the residency with Coffee & Sponge we are able to host a world premiere of new work created specifically for the gallery. As well as assisting with the hosting workshops, lectures, and events with special guests Ariana Reines, David Trinidad, Cody John Laplante, and Sabrina Orah Mark, we have musical events happening all over the city to coincide with gallery programming that include the bands Spirit Tramp, TONDA,  Rene' LeConte, Strays, Manny and the Deepthroats , The Visitations, Glasscrafts, T S Woodward, and Darnell Boys.

 

LIST OF PARTICIPATING ARTISTS

Addison Adams Georgia

Forrest Aguar Georgia

Malcolm Alexander Georgia

Susanne Assmann Germany

Antonio Barrientos Mexico City

Sarah Beckwith Philadelphia

Max Beeching Georgia

Maximilian Woehler Germany

Mathew Wojciechowski Seattle

Zachery Wood Brooklyn

 

LIST OF AFFILIATED EVENTS

September 10, 2013: CONTENT @ 40 Watt Club with local acts  Manny and the Deepthroats, TONDA, Spirit Tramp  as well as poet Cody John Laplante (New Hampshire/Chile/France,) and Rene' LeConte. After the performances: DJ  Z Dog will spin into the wee hours. 8PM

September 14, 2013: CONTENT @ Caledonia with local acts Strays, TS Woodward, Glasscrafts, The Visitations, and Darnell Boys, 8PM

September 15, 2013: Collage Club @ ATHICA, bring your scissors, glue sticks, + magazines to our monthly collaging event in the gallery, 2PM

September 21, 2013: CONTENT @ ATHICA presents a performative lecture A tale of mathematical art and friendship with local mathematician and artist Jason Cantarella, 6:30PM, with reception and games at 7:30PM

September 22, 2013: CONTENT @ The World Famous w/ locals Revien and Pocketful of Claptonite, 8PM

September 28, 2013: CONTENT @ ATHICA with poet and guitarist Misha Feigin (Kentucky/Russia) and improvisational singerJill Burton (Florida), hosted by Killick, 7PM

October 5, 2013: CONTENT @ The World Famous hosts internationally-acclaimed poets David Trinidad(Chicago), Ariana Reines(NYC), Daniel Scott Parker (Chicago), and Sabrina Orah Mark (Athens), 7PM

October 13, 2013: CONTENT @ATHICA presents a gallery tour and art project for kids and their families, presented by co-curator Hope Hilton and several CONTENT artists, 4PM

October 17, 2013: CONTENT @ATHICA hosts a gallery walk-thru with the curators at 4PM followed by a community discussion on the influence of the internet and a contemporary, global art practice, part of ATHICA's series titled HUB: for artists + art-lovers to discuss timely topics, 5PM

October 20, 2013: Collage Club @ ATHICA, bring your scissors, glue sticks, + magazines to our monthly collaging event in the gallery, 2PM

October 26, 2013: CONTENT @ ATHICA with local acts The Glands, Strays, 7PM

November 2, 2013: CONTENT @ Go Bar with collaborative performance by Cullen Toole and Hamlin Jackson, music, and dancing late into the night with DJ Mahogany

 

<3

story:
For years, I’ve traveled the country in search of fallen, forgotten trees destined for landfills and chippers. My goal has always been to transform these hunks of waste wood into beautiful pieces of art -- to make people consider these objects from a new perspective. My most recent work, The Ball Project, features a collection of enormous wooden balls sourced from an array of different species, some of which are very rare. As an environmentalist dedicated to turning the mundane into the treasured, I began this project to showcase the crevices and distinctions these pieces of wood exhibit, exposing a depth of beauty that would otherwise be lost.

The balls vary in size, many weighing in at over a ton. In order to create these balls on such a large scale, I modified my truck into a custom, unprecedented sculptural tool called The Scorpion. For me, the size matters. There’s a certain impact a piece of wood can have when it takes up so much space.

Each ball tells its own unique story -- from its particular species to the land that fostered its growth to the storm that took it down. My goal is to honor that history and display it in a way that’s interesting and thought provoking. The real art is in the process of exposing layer after layer of the wood's background, working with the wood to bring out its blemishes, bumps and fragments of decay.

Finding the raw material has become an intuitive and broad journey in itself, from stumbled-upon fallen tree trunks to calls from strangers offering to donate a rare species growing on their property. A few years ago I was the subject of a short video and to my surprise, it went viral. This experience has not only expanded my networks in terms of finding wood, but it’s also shown me that people are truly interested in supporting this project. You can watch that video here: https://vimeo.com/41892788

 

About The Red Hook Woodlot

After years of transient and limited workspaces, I’ve found the perfect place to house both The Scorpion and my growing collection of wood balls. The Red Hook Woodlot is an open air studio near the Brooklyn waterfront. With this space, I will finally to expand the project, preserving more trees into beautiful works of art. My ultimate goal is to create and display at total of 108 wooden balls at the Woodlot, inviting fellow artists, woodturners, musicians and neighbors alike to use the space as a gathering ground for ideas, collaboration and creativity.

What We Need & What You Get:

The money raised will go towards building the Red Hook Woodlot and keeping it open, providing a space for me to create and showcase The Ball Project. The space will also be used for community and art events.

All donations made to this Indiegogo campaign are tax deductible.

The Impact:

The driving force behind my work is to value art, community and our environment. Each piece showcases a history, inviting viewers to consider the tree’s origin, its growth and its ultimate journey back into the earth. There’s a deep feeling of satisfaction when I finish turning a ball -- to watch the light reflect so intensely off an intricately detailed sphere that once was a discarded chunk of wood is an amazing experience and something I want to share with others. I want to bring this project into the greater community because I believe that preserving, beautifying and showcasing nature’s legacy is a powerful and unifying effort, locally and globally.

Share Our Values - Art. Community. Trees.

If you share my values and care about these issues, please support this project in any way you can. Even if you can’t help out financially, we can still use your support. Connect with us on Facebook or Twitter to take part in the development of the Woodlot and help us spread the word about The Ball Project.

My goal has always been to transform these hunks of waste wood into beautiful pieces of art -- to make people consider these objects from a new perspective. My most recent work, The Ball Project, features a collection of enormous wooden balls sourced from an array of different species, some of which are very rare. As an environmentalist dedicated to turning the mundane into the treasured, I began this project to showcase the crevices and distinctions these pieces of wood exhibit, exposing a depth of beauty that would otherwise be lost.

The balls vary in size, many weighing in at over a ton. In order to create these balls on such a large scale, I modified my truck into a custom, unprecedented sculptural tool called The Scorpion. For me, the size matters. There’s a certain impact a piece of wood can have when it takes up so much space.
Each ball tells its own unique story -- from its particular species to the land that fostered its growth to the storm that took it down. My goal is to honor that history and display it in a way that’s interesting and thought provoking. The real art is in the process of exposing layer after layer of the wood's background, working with the wood to bring out its blemishes, bumps and fragments of decay.
Finding the raw material has become an intuitive and broad journey in itself, from stumbled-upon fallen tree trunks to calls from strangers offering to donate a rare species growing on their property. A few years ago I was the subject of a short video and to my surprise, it went viral. This experience has not only expanded my networks in terms of finding wood, but it’s also shown me that people are truly interested in supporting this project. You can watch that video here: https://vimeo.com/41892788

 
About The Red Hook Woodlot
After years of transient and limited workspaces, I’ve found the perfect place to house both The Scorpion and my growing collection of wood balls. The Red Hook Woodlot is an open air studio near the Brooklyn waterfront. With this space, I will finally to expand the project, preserving more trees into beautiful works of art. My ultimate goal is to create and display at total of 108 wooden balls at the Woodlot, inviting fellow artists, woodturners, musicians and neighbors alike to use the space as a gathering ground for ideas, collaboration and creativity.


What We Need & What You Get:
The money raised will go towards building the Red Hook Woodlot and keeping it open, providing a space for me to create and showcase The Ball Project. The space will also be used for community and art events. 
All donations made to this Indiegogo campaign are tax deductible. 
The Impact: 
The driving force behind my work is to value art, community and our environment. Each piece showcases a history, inviting viewers to consider the tree’s origin, its growth and its ultimate journey back into the earth. There’s a deep feeling of satisfaction when I finish turning a ball -- to watch the light reflect so intensely off an intricately detailed sphere that once was a discarded chunk of wood is an amazing experience and something I want to share with others. I want to bring this project into the greater community because I believe that preserving, beautifying and showcasing nature’s legacy is a powerful and unifying effort, locally and globally.
Share Our Values - Art. Community. Trees.
If you share my values and care about these issues, please support this project in any way you can. Even if you can’t help out financially, we can still use your support. Connect with us on Facebook or Twitter to take part in the development of the Woodlot and help us spread the word about The Ball Project.

story:
Hooray! We reached the goal for the art therapy training and are now raising money for the girl's school at Nepal House. Please consider joining us in supporting this wonderful project.

Let's climb the peak!!

Any funds we raise beyond the costs of this year's art therapy training will go to the Nepal House school for girls. The school opened its doors in 2011 in response to the lack of educational opportunities and need for care and  empowerment of girls in the community. The school provides a safe place for vulnerable children to receive an education, nutritious meals, counselling services and hope for a better future. Way to go Nepal House!


Art Therapy Nepal -

I first visited Nepal in 1992 as a wide-eyed traveler exploring the mountains, monasteries and the wonders of this amazing country.  My experiences there had a huge impact on my life and way of seeing the world.  Years later, when my friend Ashwin told me about his work with children in Nepal, I jumped at the opportunity to get involved.

Since 2007, Nepal House counsellors have been using play, art and talk therapies to help children facing a range of challenges including trauma, poverty, illness, exploitation, and neglect.  This winter, I am very excited to be making my second trip as a volunteer with Nepal House.  I am part of a group of professionals who bring their knowledge and skills to Nepal, to help educate and build capacity for local people. This December, I will offer several child art therapy workshops to the Nepali counsellors and teachers working at Nepal House.

This video is a short clip from our first art therapy training at Nepal House in 2008


How Does my Contribution Help?

Volunteers who provide training to the Nepal House staff are responsible for raising their own funds to cover the cost of travel and living expenses while working in Nepal. Your contribution helps make this year's training possible by funding:

- travel expenses (airfare, visas, bicycle rental)
- basic accommodation/meals while working in Nepal
- medical insurance and immunizations
- books, teaching tools and art materials for art therapy training and outreach projects



Other Ways You Can Help

We would love your help getting the word out to other people who would be interested to support this project. Please consider letting others know about this campaign through facebook, twitter, email or word of mouth.  You can find Indigogo share tools at the bottom of the page. 


About Me

Gretchen Ladd is a registered art therapist and educator who has provided therapeutic arts to diverse communities for over 20 years.  Her clients have included long-term care residents, mental health clients, cancer patients and bereaved children. Since 2004, she has provided art therapy with Callanish Society, supporting adults and families living with cancer. Gretchen is also an instructor at the Vancouver Art Therapy Institute and has facilitated art therapy trainings in Nepal, Thailand and Japan.

Website: www.gretchenladdarts.com

Interested in Nepal House Society? Please visit www.nepalhouse.org

story:
Our Story

The Artist-Humankind: Location-Earth project was created by nationally board certified art therapist, Beth Ann Short, to provide any individual the opportunity to share their own experience of life through mixed media art making and self-portraiture.  The final outcome will be an exhibition and small press art book documenting the process.


The funding of this project will make it NO COST TO THE PARTICIPATING INDIVIDUALS in the pilot session!  Participants in the pilot session of this workshop will experience some basic fine art education in using fine art media as well as support through six scheduled meetings.  In addition to learning about the historical use of self-portraiture and subject matter content in story telling throughout time, participants will examine the concept of roles in life that guide our behaviors, rights and obligations through the social experience in social status, social community and expectations of others.  Throughout the process participants will have therapeutic support.  Artists will also have the opportunity to access the art studio individually, in addition to the scheduled group meetings if they wish.  Participants in this project may have, but need not have any experience in fine art technique.   


The pilot will focus on the roles of: Mother/Father/Parent/Caregiver.  Self-portraits created will be in response to the group process.    


The Impact

ART SAVES LIVES

The Benefits?  

In this pilot project participants will examine their own experience of mother/father/parent/caregiver in relation to the others in the group.  Individuals will experience increased ability to use creativity in self-care, managing anxiety, as well as in problem solving while gaining insight into past, present and future life choices through this process.  Furthermost, participants will explore self-perception and personal role identity formation while exploring and engaging with others in core group finding normalcy in their experience, while translating their own experience in their unique art voice.


In addition to individual benefits, the community on a whole will also be impacted by the art show and publication.  Even people who don't make the art can learn from the experience just by coming into contact with the art!


What We Need!

Art materials for 8 participants = $720

Art Showing Exhibition Fees = $200

Studio Space for group and individual art making = $780

Art therapy facilitation and teaching by registered art therapist = Total $1500

Art booklet publication costs =  $600


Other Ways You Can Help

Pass along the details of this campaign!

Copy and paste the link on your facebook, twitter or other social media you enjoy!

THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU

story: 1

Gallery Show by the Denver Metro Art Salon

Where do we come from?


We’re a group of artists from the Living Arts Co-Op, an independent community
organization which originally started out as program of the Jefferson Center for Mental
Health. Like many artists, we want the public to be able to experience our art. Last fall
we started an art marketing salon using Alyson Stanfield’s materials.

Serving Our Community

Our members have taught free art workshops, served on committees for the Living Arts
Co-Op, and encouraged emerging artists to develop and market their art.

What are we trying to do?

As a final project for the salon, our goal is to do our own month long show at a high
visibility gallery in the Denver Metro area. The funds donated for this project will be
used to rent a gallery, purchase post cards, and create a website for our art show. It’s our hope that other members of the Living Arts Co-Op will be encouraged to follow our lead and get their art out there. Each of us will share a little bit about our art and how we create it in our video.

story:
Funk Yeah!  The Mothership   She needs you...

To all those that have been touched by the Funk.....We need you now.


We are obsessed with the funk! My name is Reilly and together with my wife and partner Misty, we own the FUNK YEAH! It has been our pleasure to ride the playa and bring funky transportation to all of you through the years. 

The FUNK YEAH! rolled onto the playa for her debut in 2008 and has brought the funk in so many ways over the years it makes me happy everytime I think about her. Bringing the funk from old school to new school while keeping it fresh has been the FUNK YEAH!'s mission from day 1. 

Our collection of FUNK music is a result of a lifetime of gathering rare grooves and old school collections. Our main collection is over 200 GB of music and it is quite an honor to bring it to BurningMan. Funk is such a necessary music form on the playa especially when it balances out the dubstep or house mix during sunrise.

I was lucky to aquire her for $3,000. Including the $700 annual storage fee at the Art Car Support Ranch I have put over $6,500 into her in 5 years. Until last year all she needed was gas and away we went. 

Historically, the FunkYeah! has cost the fuel to run her. For those of you that have contributed to expenses over the years it has been greatly appreciated.

Last year proved to be a challenge for her and she had to be towed off the playa to the ranch where she lives. 

Misty and I need your help if we are to bring her to the playa this year.

 

Your contributions will go toward the following:


1. Engine replacement/rebuild. $1500

2. New carberaetor $350-$500

3. transmission seal replacement $500

4. Exhaust manifold leak repair. (x2) $500

5. New Silver wrap for cage and speakers $100

6. New Lighting system $250

7. Storage fee $700

 

If we reach our goal the FUNK YEAH! will shine like the star that is FUNKY.  

We have some really cool perks for your contributions including our funky FUNK YEAH! sticker, the official FUNK YEAH sweatband and T-shirt. The FUNK YEAH 2GB Flash Drive with select FUNK YEAH playlists will keep you movin and a groovin'. Our Night out on playa wine and cheese funk rambles have become famous and we are offerring a lucky group a private tour!

If for some reason, we dont quite reach our goal know that your contribution will go to the repairs that need to be done in order to ensure she makes it to the playa!

story:
Have you ever opened a festive card and been greeted with a picture of a bird pecking the snow and thought "what the hell has that got to do with anything?!" 

The Taliban Tree

 Having spent the last few years attempting to give my friends in Iraq and Afghanistan a smile by drawing and sending them topical, amusing, and usually somewhat violent Christmas cards and being told many times "These are great, you should get some professionally printed" I have decided to see if the masses are actually interested in getting some!

 Humorous military themed cards will be well received by not only veterans of Afghanistan and Iraq, but anyone who has ever served, or doubtless, the good friends or relatives of a serviceman or woman. The servicemen pictures on the designs are wearing the more common Multicam design favoured by both British and American troops in theatre, and also several EU nations. Obviously this was to try and make them accessible to everyone, so I also kept the insignias and flags of the myriad military formations to a minimum.

  I dare say they will go down well with most people's grandparents as well, if my ill-tempered politically incorrect grandfather is anything to go by! 

Battlesleigh

Needless to say, having spent 3 Christmases over in Iraq and Afghanistan, I would have been far happier getting a humorous, relevant Christmas card from a friend or relative, instead of a card emblazoned with a picture of a candle or painting of a cathedral. 

Obviously Indiegogo gives me a chance to see if there is an interest before I go to the printers and pay a princely sum for them, sell none, and then leave them all next to the dryer in my basement for a few years and possibly burn my house down. 

So, here they are. I have redrawn, scanned, and digitally coloured a selection of 4 designs for your viewing pleasure. Please note, they are far smaller thumbnails to stop an evil corporation from simply scanning them, printing them enmasse and then not giving me any credit for them, and the actual images are far larger, and obviously much better quality.

 If funding is successful, the cards will be printed on high-quality card by a professional printer and mailed with individual envelopes included. 

Afghan Sledding

Unfortunately, I have a full time job that is far less interesting, and graphic design is simply a hobby of mine! As a result, I obviously have to go to a professional printer to have the cards manufactured, which is a pretty expensive process. Still, the price is reasonable at about £1/$2 a card, and the good news is that the more I have printed, the cheaper it is. 

 Therefore, I have been furiously drawing some other designs, and will be able to add a few cards to the basic pack as stretch goals if by some miracle I manage to get some funding! 

 The downside is overseas postage obviously, which I had had to make pretty expensive for fear of the weight hugely increasing if the campaign progresses and is successful, and then me being out of pocket and having to sell my frankly worthless death-trap of a car or something. But still, considering how much cards retail for in stores, I think the price is excellent and offers a significant savings over going and buying a card for someone.  

Especially some crappy card without any violence in it! 

Afghan Sandman

 So that is it, if you fancy raising a smile this year, I suggest you pick some up. Don't forget to spread the word, because If I hit anywhere near my target, I will be able to afford to mail some extras out, so I shall once again unleash my pencil of fury and add some more warm-hearted festive violence to the campaign for your enjoyment.

story:
Singing Bridges: UFO Bridge Sculpture 

Singing Bridges is an urban sonic sculpture on a global scale, making music with the sound of bridges. Placing contact microphones directly on the cables, I record and compose with the sound from inside the bridge, listening to the voice of the structure as wind, traffic and tension create vibrations. Listen to more cable-stay and suspension bridge sounds here

April 2012 is the tenth anniversary of my first trip to record stay-cabled bridges worldwide. I'm celebrating with a brand new work giving a sculptural dimension to this incredible archive of bridge recordings. The Singing Bridge Sculpture is the first in a series of bridge designs, interrelated compositions and visual works that transmit and pay tribute to the wonderful and unexpectedly rich world of bridge sounds. 

An elegant bridge silhouette, the Singing Bridge sculpture features a soundscape composed from bridge recordings, played through custom-built electronics by Andy Holtin. The bridge is produced in plexiglas or metal and the sound of the bridge plays through the object, as 'exciters' or contact speakers turn the bridge into a speaker. Below is the UFO Bridge design for the first prototype to be cut in steel blue, slate grey, gold or silver coloured plexiglas or anodised aluminium and wired for sound. 


Now is your chance to support Singing Bridges, own a design prototype or other cool stuff!





Image: Singing Bridges Design - UFO Bridge

Why make a Singing Bridges Sculpture?

Investing the past ten years in Singing Bridges, I've played and recorded over 60 bridges worldwide. This has created wonderful opportunities to share my passion for these unique voices, working in collaboration with artists, musicians and engineers in each location in ephemeral & site-specific works. I'm truly excited about making this sculpture to transmit the rich and diverse sonic experience, share the magic and celebrate Singing Bridges through a visual and sonic design for bridge, music and art lovers. Your generous support will help create this extraordinary sonic bridge sculpture!


The Story So Far

Singing Bridges is a poetic, philosophical and creative work that helps transform our perception and experience of the world by tuning in to the intangible. Connecting people, places and cultures, bridges are always singing, all we need to do is stop and listen. 

More than the acoustic properties or harmonics in the wires, the sound is also the voice of the bridge, released through the vibration that travels along the cables and reaches out across the globe. Imagine the voice of bridges all over the world singing together in an Acoustic Indra's Net.

Introduction to Singing Bridges on TEDx Kreuzberg

Music from bridges at Pecha Kucha, Maastricht

Singing Bridges on Prezi



Image: Bizovik Bridge soundcheck, Ljubljana Dec 24th 2007 Photo: Luka Prinčič

More about the design and materials.

The first three Singing Bridge sculpture designs are based on my favourite UFO Bridge (Novy Most), Bratislava; Santiago Calatrava's Alamillo Bridge, Seville: and the iconic Golden Gate Bridge, San Francisco. 

Dimensions 900mm x 350mm x 5mm, with the original series laser cut in coloured plexiglas.

A touch sensor controls the bridge sound with electronics custom-built by Andy Holtin. 

Later versions will be fabricated in anodised aluminium, and I am approaching a specialist audio company in Sweden to make the bridges sound even more incredible.



Image: Custom-built electronics by Andy Holtin


What are the Perks?

The perks are lots of fun: everyone who contributes will receive a thank you on the website and eternally singing bridges in gratitude + digital thank you postcard + invitation to send me a postcard of your favourite bridge with a story to be part of a future exhibition!

Depending on your chosen contribution: download of digital release specially composed bridge songs; a real postcard sent with a lipstick kiss from wherever I am & signed print of glamour bridge photoshoot; the first small scale 10cm to 15cm cut out of the bridges in plexiglas - these come in different colours depending on which perk you claim, a screen print of the Singing Bridge on alu-dibond; your own aluminium bridge cut-out from the studio of Andy Holtin; or a gorgeous Soviet Printing press graphic bridge poster.

Step up to the plate and enjoy a fabulous 4 course meal at Vin Aqua Vin in Berlin, with the artist & highly esteemed chef Jan Kreuzinger, or take the Golden Bridge that comes with a hug & kiss at the VIP Private View*, a gold plexiglas 15cm bridge sculpture, artist made screen print and eternal singing bridges...

The Diamond Bridge gives you the actual Singing Bridge sculpture prototype - or the Singing Bridge and Bridge of Dreams where I will come to the suitable bridge location nearest you and create a live sonic event!

The Live Sonic Event on a bridge near you will take place during 2012. The graphic bridge poster will be created in the springtime in Tallinn. All other perks will be delivered between 4-6 weeks (postcards, plexiglas bridges, screen print) or 8-12 weeks (composition, private view, prototype) after the campaign ends. A sneak peek at previous sonic bridge events in Paris, Maastricht, Ljubljana, Ghent & Glasgow...


*NB All Invitations to private view in Berlin/BCN/Istanbul/Tallinn - Travel & accommodation not included

How will you use the money? 

This campaign is focused on the sculpture in the context of the 10th Anniversary of Singing Bridges. The money will help towards materials, production and promotion of the Singing Bridges Sculptures. Your generous support covers the production costs, time to produce new bridge designs, compositions and launch events.

In addition to the prototypes; we will make the screen printed image on aluminium-dibond, have 10cm and 15cm bridges cut in plexiglas, continue to design the sculpture series and create new compositions for each bridge, go to Tallinn to learn and create graphic bridges with the Soviet Printing Press.

Once the prototype is made, I will continue working on the design and compositions for the limited edition of seven bridges, make recording trips to create live sonic bridge events with unsung bridges and take the next steps in planning the Global Bridge Symphony. I have ten years experience in creative project management and have successfully realised a diverse range of cultural events with an exceptional network and international team.

All supporters will be updated with details of the bridge sculpture, events and releases. Even with only part of the funding goal, I can still finish the prototype sculpture, send postcards and hand made screen prints. Launch events will be held in Berlin, Barcelona and if someone selects the Bosphorous Bridge, Istanbul!


Image: Live Sonic Event with Luka Prinčič & Luka Dekleva, Bizovik Bridge, Ljubljana 2007

Co-Produced by Code-EP, Kapelica Gallery and supported by the Slovene Ministry of Culture.

Who is involved?

I'm Jodi Rose and I've been making music with bridges since going to art school in 1994, where I studied Sculpture, Performance and Installation, moving to Berlin in 2007. I have done many artist residencies, on-site concerts, performances and gallery installations at electronic and media art festivals internationally.

Sculptor and professor Andy Holtin is working with me on designing the electronics and components to make the bridge sculptures sing. See these designs as they unfold, and watch our tests with the prototypes updated during the campaign.

Peter Newman is making the video with me - so you can hear the bridge sing... mrpeternewman (at) gmail (dot) com

Justin Tyler Tate is collaborating on building the Ice Bridge you can sleep under at the Ice Hotel this winter, check out his designs and claim one of the perks to get a print of the photograph of our room.

Ernest Truely has invited me to come and play on the Soviet Printing Press at Polymer Culture Factory in Estonia, where I am looking forward to making the graphic style bridge posters.

Sasha Matteucci has created the most amazing headdress and art deco costume for the launch event and is finding us a location to perform and play in Istanbul and the fabulous Tommy and Crick in Barcelona have offered a superb launch event at Federal. 

Photographer Patrick Jendrusch is all set to take pictures with Sasha's incredible costumes and of the bridge when we have the first one cut by laser guru Martin at lasernlasern in Kreuzberg. The Berlin launch venue to be confirmed, following a private view and exclusive VIP dinner with the artist at Vin Aqua Vin. I'm thrilled to have such an incredible team of wonderful bridge lovers already on board with me!

Other ways to help bridges sing

Your contribution - large or small - is greatly appreciated, and it's easy to support Singing Bridge Sculptures and Live Sonic Events. Simply click on 'Contribute Now' and choose the amount you can afford - and of course pick the perk you like best! Even if you don't have cash to contribute, everyone who likes the idea can help by spreading the word and telling friends, colleagues and bridge lovers about Singing Bridges. 

IndieGOGO has some great share tools already here on the page - leave a comment, and please share this project with anyone you think may be interested, by linking to this page through your preferred social media networks, tweet, email, 'like' and embed it into your own site or newsletter.

Thank you!

This is a completely independent experiment in alternative cultural economics outside arts commissions, institutions and gallery system, one that I hope will be exciting as a peer funding campaign. Thanks to indiegogo for this great platform, network and opportunity, huge thanks to my wonderful community of friends, family, inspiring colleagues & lovely flatmates Ced & Masha for all your support and encouragement,  thanks to my mum who always believes in me and dad for sending coffee & cake contributions. Very special thanks to Pixelache Helsinki for being the first and still my favourite festival to program Singing Bridges, Sophea Lerner for all the radio & dancing! Ela Kagel of the Free Culture Incubator & supermarkt, Eric Poettschacher from Shapeshifters, Christoph at Betahaus & Jay at Open Design City for conversations, workshops and provocations that have helped transform my thinking and beliefs about creativity, money and value. 

Thank you for giving your time, attention and support, and thanks to IndieGOGO for this great opportunity to create something new and exciting.

Let the bridges sing!!
story_txt:
Singing Bridges: UFO Bridge Sculpture Singing Bridges is an urban sonic sculpture on a global scale, making music with the sound of bridges. Placing contact microphones directly on the cables, I record and compose with the sound from inside the bridge, listening to the voice of the structure as wind, traffic and tension create vibrations. Listen to more cable-stay and suspension bridge sounds here


April 2012 is the tenth anniversary of my first trip to record stay-cabled bridges worldwide. I'm celebrating with a brand new work giving a sculptural dimension to this incredible archive of bridge recordings. The Singing Bridge Sculpture is the first in a series of bridge designs, interrelated compositions and visual works that transmit and pay tribute to the wonderful and unexpectedly rich world of bridge sounds. 
An elegant bridge silhouette, the Singing Bridge sculpture features a soundscape composed from bridge recordings, played through custom-built electronics by Andy Holtin. The bridge is produced in plexiglas or metal and the sound of the bridge plays through the object, as 'exciters' or contact speakers turn the bridge into a speaker. Below is the UFO Bridge design for the first prototype to be cut in steel blue, slate grey, gold or silver coloured plexiglas or anodised aluminium and wired for sound. 

Now is your chance to support Singing Bridges, own a design prototype or other cool stuff!







Image: Singing Bridges Design - UFO Bridge
Why make a Singing Bridges Sculpture?
Investing the past ten years in Singing Bridges, I've played and recorded over 60 bridges worldwide. This has created wonderful opportunities to share my passion for these unique voices, working in collaboration with artists, musicians and engineers in each location in ephemeral & site-specific works. I'm truly excited about making this sculpture to transmit the rich and diverse sonic experience, share the magic and celebrate Singing Bridges through a visual and sonic design for bridge, music and art lovers. Your generous support will help create this extraordinary sonic bridge sculpture!

The Story So Far

Singing Bridges is a poetic, philosophical and creative work that helps 
transform our perception and experience of the world by tuning in to the
 intangible. Connecting people, places and cultures, bridges are always singing, all we need to do is stop 
and listen. 
More than the acoustic properties or harmonics in the wires, the sound is also the voice of the bridge, released through the vibration that travels along the cables and reaches out  across the globe. Imagine the voice of bridges all over the world singing together in an Acoustic Indra's Net.
Introduction to Singing Bridges on TEDx Kreuzberg
Music from bridges at Pecha Kucha, Maastricht
Singing Bridges on Prezi


Image: Bizovik Bridge soundcheck, Ljubljana Dec 24th 2007 Photo: Luka Prinčič



More about the design and materials.

The first three Singing Bridge sculpture designs are based on my favourite UFO Bridge (Novy Most), Bratislava; Santiago Calatrava's Alamillo Bridge, Seville: and the iconic Golden Gate Bridge, San Francisco. 
Dimensions 900mm x 350mm x 5mm, with the original series laser cut in coloured plexiglas.
A touch sensor controls the bridge sound with electronics custom-built by Andy Holtin. 
Later versions will be fabricated in anodised aluminium, and I am approaching a specialist audio company in Sweden to make the bridges sound even more incredible. 



Image: Custom-built electronics by Andy Holtin


What are the Perks?

The perks are lots of fun: everyone who contributes will receive a thank you on the website and eternally singing bridges in gratitude + digital thank you postcard + invitation to send me a postcard of your favourite bridge with a story to be part of a future exhibition!
Depending on your chosen contribution: download of digital release specially composed bridge songs; a real postcard sent with a lipstick kiss from wherever I am & signed print of glamour bridge photoshoot; the first small scale 10cm to 15cm cut out of the bridges in plexiglas - these come in different colours depending on which perk you claim, a screen print of the Singing Bridge on alu-dibond; your own aluminium bridge cut-out from the studio of Andy Holtin; or a gorgeous Soviet Printing press graphic bridge poster.
Step up to the plate and enjoy a fabulous 4 course meal at Vin Aqua Vin in Berlin, with the artist & highly esteemed chef Jan Kreuzinger, or take the Golden Bridge that comes with a hug & kiss at the VIP Private View*, a gold plexiglas 15cm bridge sculpture, artist made screen print and eternal singing bridges...
The Diamond Bridge gives you the actual Singing Bridge sculpture prototype - or the Singing Bridge and Bridge of Dreams where I will come to the suitable bridge location nearest you and create a live sonic event!
The Live Sonic Event on a bridge near you will take place during 2012. The graphic bridge poster will be created in the springtime in Tallinn. All other perks will be delivered between 4-6 weeks (postcards, plexiglas bridges, screen print) or 8-12 weeks (composition, private view, prototype) after the campaign ends. A sneak peek at previous sonic bridge events in Paris, Maastricht, Ljubljana, Ghent & Glasgow...

*NB All Invitations to private view in Berlin/BCN/Istanbul/Tallinn - Travel & accommodation not included



How will you use the money? 
This campaign is focused on the sculpture in the context of the 10th Anniversary of Singing Bridges. The money will help towards materials, production and promotion of the Singing Bridges Sculptures. Your generous support covers the production costs, time to produce new bridge designs, compositions and launch events. 
In addition to the prototypes; we will make the screen printed image on aluminium-dibond, have 10cm and 15cm bridges cut in plexiglas, continue to design the sculpture series and create new compositions for each bridge, go to Tallinn to learn and create graphic bridges with the Soviet Printing Press. 
Once the prototype is made, I will continue working on the design and 
compositions for the limited edition of seven bridges, make recording trips to create live sonic bridge events with unsung bridges and take the next steps in planning the Global Bridge Symphony. I have ten years experience in creative project management and have successfully realised a diverse range of cultural events with an exceptional network and international team.All supporters will be updated with details of the bridge sculpture, events and releases. Even with only part of the funding goal, I can still finish the prototype sculpture, send postcards and hand made screen prints. Launch events will be held in Berlin, Barcelona and if someone selects the Bosphorous Bridge, Istanbul!
Image: Live Sonic Event with Luka Prinčič & Luka Dekleva, Bizovik Bridge, Ljubljana 2007
Co-Produced by Code-EP, Kapelica Gallery and supported by the Slovene Ministry of Culture.

Who is involved?

Thanks to indiegogo for this great platform, network and opportunity, huge thanks to my wonderful community of friends, family, inspiring colleagues & lovely flatmates Ced & Masha for all your support and encouragement,  thanks to my mum who always believes in me and dad for sending coffee & cake contributions. Very special thanks to Pixelache Helsinki for being the first and still my favourite festival to program Singing Bridges, Sophea Lerner for all the radio & dancing! sing!!

story:
Watch the video and read the story of

The Little Cafe that Could ...

There are landlords and then there are, landlords.

Welcome to EOA, East of Adelaide, the “wrong side of the tracks” in London, Ontario. “You’re opening a café in the east end? You must be mad!” This was the refrain we often heard in the early days of East Village Coffeehouse.  “But we live here, it’s our neighbourhood.” we responded. 

In the spring of 2008 we rented a long neglected space (with a hole leading to the basement, no plumbing, no electricity) with the purpose of revitalizing our stigmatized community while pushing the limits on how sustainable our local business could be.  (See our 10 Guiding Principles on the Updates Page.)  A poster on our front window says it all - “A safe space where human rights are protected”. An open, independent café that celebrates local arts, and offers affordable healthy fair trade goods is the best sign of a community turning a corner. However, not everyone shares this vision.

The Long Bill of the Law

Our struggle with our landlord started during our renovation, with the many stressful set-backs and delays (look at our add on pages for updates on the details – they must be cleared with our lawyer before we can publish them).  We started legal proceedings after our landlord attempted to seize our premises by marching in a bailiff for alleged non-payment of rent.  Our landlord had post-dated cheques for the entire year in his hands when he did this.  We have been struggling to defend our dream ever since.

Now --- four years and over $70,000 in legal fees later --- we are close to the final trial date of our law suit, Sept. 17.  Judging from our experience, our landlord’s strategy has been to delay, obstruct, and backtrack whenever possible.  This has jacked up the costs exponentially. But we have more at stake here than just money or the success of our business. We are fighting to improve the quality of life for folks at all income levels in our stigmatized neighbourhood.

We need your help to finish this and move on to our even bigger goal of starting a local, independent small business association.  Our immediate goal is to raise $15,000 to help us win this lawsuit and our deadline is our trial date --  September 17, 2012.

Together We CAN...

We feel it's a tremendous privilege to have enough, enough that we can give back. We are givers and we don't find it easy to ask for anything, even when we need help. But this issue is different because it's about the continued survival -- nay, success -- of our safe space project in EOA. Ironic really, given what we have had to bear in order to keep operating. And it's about these unjust "David and Goliath" situations that kill off local independent small businesses in neighborhoods all over North America. We could say so much more about that. And its about growing and healing our stigmatized community. We see that if you give groups of people a safe space to gather, the neighborhood will heal itself.

We've kept these doors open 7 days a week for 4 years because we believe that David can win. We think we can...we think we can...we think we can...

Beyond Our Goal

3% of your donations will go back into Indiegogo causes no matter how much we raise.

If we go over our goal, we will put that money toward the lawsuit if it still hasn’t been paid.  When it is paid, any extra money will be used to renovate and move into an alternative café space in EOA since we clearly cannot stay where we are.

We have plans to start LILA – Local Independent London Association – to help foster and build a local economy in London that is safe and supportive of small businesses. No more David and Goliath stories!

We have started to inquire about what we can do to change an abandoned lot, right on Dundas Street in the centre of EOA, into a community garden and park with a splash pad for the kids. One model we may pursue is that of a community land trust.

Linda will buy a new pair of shoes and Glenn will purchase more than one pair of socks.

Updates and Additional Info

If you care about what we're doing, we'll have plenty of updates where we answer people's questions publicly and give more info. For example, we can tell you more about our gluten-free menu, efforts to remain affordable to our street folk while fighting this legal battle, ecological start-up renovation, scheme to book local musicians and make sure they get paid, and many other facets of our project that we don't mention here.
