story:
Short Summary

Gates of O’brillin is Brenda Konitzer & Jai Atkinson, aka Miss Brenda & Lady Jai. They are Gothic Steampunk artists who focus on upcycling, creating boxes, cameo jewelry, home decor & more. They bring in elements of fantasy and sci-fi, including homages to favorite books & shows. They are heavily influenced by the Victorian era writers including, Poe, Verne, Stoker, Shelly and Wells.

Gates of O’brillin started with Miss Brenda full time trying to fulfill a long time dream. Lady Jai started part time & recently took the leap to full time by leaving her long time position as a social worker. Besides art markets & Etsy, they travel the southeast sharing their art at comic cons. Each year they try to expand & in 2018 they will be traveling to events in New Orleans, & Madison, WI. That is where you come in!

What We Need & What You Get

Our Short range goal is $5000. Here's what that will go towards:

  • Convention fees. We did 12 events in 2017, 8 of them were out of state. We paid $2400 in fees for space. In 2018 and 2019, we plan to do even more events farther out, starting with New Orleans. We are also hitting Madison, WI in September. We've found that the exposure of a corner booth increases our sales by huge amounts. Unfortunately, it also increases our con fees. Our most profitable event last year was in Raleigh & the corner fee was $550 with a convenience fee of $50 when you pay for space.
  • Hotel costs. All of those out of town events require a place to stay, both during the event & for the long distance ones, while traveling. We stay at the con hotel when possible, for a variety of reasons, including networking and convenience. They tend to be Marriott or Hilton based, so we accumulate points that can lead to free rooms or food, which is a big help. 
  • Travel Expenses. Gas, food, parking and van maintenance all add up quickly.
  • The little things. Or the not so little things that come up, like the $100 vendor license for Nashville & the $142 insurance fee for a 6x2 foot table in Orlando.

 

We started this journey together & want to include you every step of the way. We've come up with some great perks if you help us.

  • $25 gets you right into the Adventure! A signed print of our travelers, Katie & Nathaniel, plus an invitation into their online story where you are the star.
  • $50 will give you Zombified book 1, signed by Santiago Cirilo, our favorite Walker.
  • $250 is an ultimate package with cameo jewelry & a matching box, all hand painted by the lovely Lady Jai & Miss Brenda.

Check out the other perks. You can find something for however much you have to give.

 

We chose Indiegogo for a very important reason, Flexible Funding. That means, if for some weird reason we don't make our goal, all hope is not lost. What you donate still comes to us (minus some handling fees of course) which means you will still get your perks no matter what! Plus, everything that is raised will help in some way. Whether it gets us to one con or 20, it is a huge burden off of us and will help us stay creative & able to keep bringing our great work to you.

This also means that if we exceed our goal, we can go further. More cons, more states & more advertising, so everyone can see what we do & we can meet even more great people, like you!

Risks & Challenges

People often say, "life happens" & the same is true in business. Over the years we've had medical emergencies, vehicle problems, & other unexpected occurrences. Things are bound to happen again. The key is how we react to them. We keep going.

A few years ago, my mom was in ICU and Jai was recovering from a major surgery, so I did an out of town event alone. We adapt and aren't afraid to rethink things. Flexibility is the key.

Minor things, like not getting the layout you expected, happen often. We work with what we have & make it work to our advantage. That is what we will continue to do. Things may not happen 100% as planned & that's okay, we will find a way to make it work.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to funding our campaign, you can help in other ways:

  • Share the campaign
  • Share our posts (even if we're not your style, your friends may be interested)
  • Moral support is always appreciated. We are taking a chance, so it's always nice to feel the love.

story:
Die :.PixelHELPER International SARL hat es sich zur Aufgabe gemacht, gegen Ungerechtigkeiten vorzugehen

Bei einer Summe von 2.000€ werden wir eine Lichtkunstkarikatur auf ein Gebäude projizieren und die entstandenen Fotos und Videos der Aktion medienwirksam verteilen. Wir können alternativ auch eine Aktivismus Drohne mit 8 Lautsprechern für weitreichende Aufmerksamkeit einsetzen. Je nach Inhalt der Aktion haben wir viele alternative Möglichkeiten für eine Umsetzung.

Eines unserer großen Themen ist die Waffen-Kritik. 

Um gegen den Waffenhandel zu demonstrieren, hat Licht- und Aktionskünstler Oliver Bienkowski bereits mehrfach mit provokativen Lichtkunstaktionen auf diesen Missstand aufmerksam gemacht. Zahlreiche Medien berichteten darüber. 


Um auch in Zukunft dafür zu kämpfen und Licht- und Kunstaktionen durchzuführen, starten wir dieses Crowdfunding. 



Wir bitten um eure Unterstützung, damit wir Ungerechtigkeiten nicht länger hinnehmen müssen, sondern gemeinsam dagegen vorgehen und protestieren können! 

Durch das kaufen der einzelnen Perks, könnt ihr nicht nur uns helfen, unsere Aktionen zu realisieren, ihr seid dadurch auch selbst Teil der Aktionen.

Jede unserer Aktionen wird auf Video fest gehalten, für deine Unterstützung wirst du namentlich im Abspann unserer Videos genannt.

Hilf' uns jetzt dabei, etwas zu bewegen und gegen die Ungerechtigkeiten in dieser Welt vorzugehen!

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Spendenkonto:IBAN: DE70 8105 3272 0641 0339 40

Bank: Sparkasse Magdeburg

Inhaber: PixelHELPER International SARL
